AutoRecall.texts.desc: Automatically recalls vehicle when [Sandworm] is detected.

SpecialRegion.texts.name: Special Region
SpecialRegion.texts.desc: This is a [SpecialRegion], controlling them is a strategic advantage
SpecialRegion.texts.plural.name: Special Regions

OnOrbit.texts.name: In Shuttle
OnOrbit.texts.desc: This unit is being transported by a shuttle.

Loot.texts.name: Loot
Loot.texts.desc: Resources in inventory (can be retrieved by defeating this army)

OrniEscort.texts.name: Escorted by Ornithopter
OrniEscort.texts.desc: An [Ornithopter] is watching out for this unit.

CeaseFire.texts.name: Under Cease Fire
CeaseFire.texts.desc: This unit is under a Cease Fire. It cannot attack nor be attacked.

NoWater.texts.name: Deficit Water
NoWater.texts.desc: This unit will not gain any [Supply].

Resources.texts.name: Resources
Resources.texts.desc: Detail of local productions, upkeep, requirements and pillage reward.

DeleteAction.texts.desc: Resolving this Discovery will remove it.

BonusAction.texts.desc: Unlock a bonus for the zone owner. It will be active as long as this Discovery exists.

RepeatAction.texts.desc: Resolving this Discovery won't remove it. Action cooldown: ::nb:: days.

Developments.texts.name: Developments
Developments.texts.desc: Invest [Knowledge] in research that will give advantages to your Faction through impactful [Development]s.

LandsraadCouncil.texts.name: Landsraad Council
LandsraadCouncil.texts.desc: Use your [CouncilVote]s and [Influence] to pass Resolutions in the Council, with the potential to impact the whole planet.

Spying.texts.name: Espionage
Spying.texts.desc: Use your [Agent]s to infiltrate other factions and entities and gain [!Infiltration] and [Intel] that you can spend to scheme against your enemies.

Equipment.texts.name: Armory
Equipment.texts.desc: Customise the gear of [$my(faction)-shortname] military units.

CHOAMMarket.texts.name: CHOAM Market
CHOAMMarket.texts.desc: Manage your [CHOAMShare]s and try to gain ownership over the CHOAM by reaching over 50% shares.

SpiceReport.texts.name: Spice Report
SpiceReport.texts.desc: Open the Spice Report, showing imperial tax and CHOAM rates details.

Spice.texts.name: Spice
Spice.texts.desc: The most precious substance in the universe, [Spice] can be sold for [Solari]s to the CHOAM, or kept in stockpiles to pay the [$my(contract)].
Spice.texts.plural.name: Spice

Solari.texts.name: Solari
Solari.texts.desc: The [Solari] is the official currency unit of the Imperium. Its purchasing power is set at quadricentennial negotiations between the Guild, the Landsraad, and the Emperor.
Solari.texts.plural.name: Solaris

Plascrete.texts.name: Plascrete
Plascrete.texts.desc: [Plascrete] is a versatile material, used at great cost in all aspects of construction. It is light but durable enough to withstand the harsh environment of Arrakis.
Plascrete.texts.plural.name: Plascrete

Manpower.texts.name: Manpower
Manpower.texts.desc: Human resources remain a very important asset in the struggle for Arrakis. [Manpower] is used to train soldiers, recover damaged units' [Life], and man [$my(Harvester)]s.
Manpower.texts.plural.name: Manpower

line0.desc: Human resources remain a very important asset in the struggle for Arrakis. [Manpower] is used to train soldiers and recover damaged units' [Life].

FuelCell.texts.name: Fuel Cell
FuelCell.texts.desc: [FuelCell]s are used to operate vehicles and drones far away from encampement, as well as to power heavy industries.
FuelCell.texts.plural.name: Fuel Cells

Water.texts.name: Water
Water.texts.desc: [Water] is essential for life, and a rare resource on Arrakis. It is consumed by active buildings and it increases the maximum [Supply] of all units, allowing them to go farther away from ally territory.
Water.texts.plural.name: Water

Authority.texts.name: Authority
Authority.texts.desc: [Authority] represents a Faction's leadership and reach over the Regions of Arrakis. It is used to take control of villages.
Authority.texts.plural.name: Authority

Hegemony.texts.name: Hegemony
Hegemony.texts.desc: [Hegemony] is the reflection of a Faction's overall power over Dune. Some thresholds will unlock new abilities and ultimately allow you to win the game!
Hegemony.texts.plural.name: Hegemony

Standing.texts.name: Landsraad Standing
Standing.texts.desc: This is your Faction's current political power and standing within the Landsraad. A high [Standing] unlocks new possibilities while a low [Standing] will make you an easy target.
Standing.texts.plural.name: Landsraad Standing

Knowledge.texts.name: Knowledge
Knowledge.texts.desc: [Knowledge] is used to develop new technologies and upgrades to improve your Faction's capabilities.
Knowledge.texts.plural.name: Knowledge

Influence.texts.name: Influence
Influence.texts.desc: [Influence] that can be spent to strengthen your votes for Landsraad Resolutions.
Influence.texts.plural.name: Influence

Agent.texts.name: Agent
Agent.texts.desc: Your spies, women and men in the shadows, allow you to monitor your assets and your enemies.
Agent.texts.plural.name: Agents

CouncilVote.texts.name: Vote
CouncilVote.texts.desc: Along with [Influence], [CouncilVote]s represent your political might. They can be allocated to vote on Landsraad Resolutions ([Influence], unlike [CouncilVote]s, is lost when used).
CouncilVote.texts.plural.name: Votes

CommandPoint.texts.name: Command Point
CommandPoint.texts.desc: Command points limit the size of your army. Military developments are the main way to increase this number.
CommandPoint.texts.plural.name: Command Points

TrainingSlot.texts.name: Training Slot
TrainingSlot.texts.desc: Training Slots allow a Faction to recruit several military units at the same time.
TrainingSlot.texts.plural.name: Training Slots

Thumper.texts.name: Thumper
Thumper.texts.desc:
A Fremen created device that repeatedly pounds the ground to attract a [Sandworm].
Cancels [Sandworm] attacks in the vicinity.
Thumper.texts.plural.name: Thumpers

GuildFavor.texts.name: Guild Favor
GuildFavor.texts.desc: [GuildFavor]s are service owned from [SpacingGuild-longname]. It is required for the deployment of spaceships. Acquiring [GuildFavor] is generally expensive.
GuildFavor.texts.plural.name: Guild Favors

Scraps.texts.name: Spaceship Part
Scraps.texts.desc: Fremen lack industrial capacities of the great houses. To compete with them in the air, they have to gather [Scraps]s and reassemble them into functionning aircraft.
Scraps.texts.plural.name: Spaceship Parts

line0.text: Gain [Scraps] by killing enemy spaceships

line1.text: Can be traded in the [RecyclingPlant]

Attack.texts.name: Attack
Attack.texts.desc: [Attack] is the amount of damage inflicted to a target without [Armor] over 10 seconds.
Attack.texts.plural.name: Attack

MeleeAttack.texts.name: Melee Attack
MeleeAttack.texts.desc: Must be in melee range to attack.
MeleeAttack.texts.plural.name: Melee Attack

Life.texts.name: Health
Life.texts.desc: The amount of Damage that can be sustained before being destroyed. Consumes [Manpower] or [Solari] to recover.
Life.texts.plural.name: Health

Armor.texts.name: Armor
Armor.texts.desc: Amount deducted from incoming attack [Power] to determine damage.
Armor.texts.plural.name: Armor

CrewPoint.texts.name: Crew
CrewPoint.texts.desc: Crews that can be attributed to [$my(harvester)]s to improve their [Spice] production. Each [CrewPoint] is hired by spending [Manpower].
CrewPoint.texts.plural.name: Crews

Overcharge.texts.name: Power Cell
Overcharge.texts.desc: Power Cells used on [V_Harvester]s to improve their [Spice] production.
Overcharge.texts.plural.name: Power Cells

Supply.texts.name: Supply
Supply.texts.desc:
[Supply] reflects the amount of provisions a unit has to survive on hostile territory. It can be replenished near ally Villages.
[Water] determines both how much maximum [Supply] your units can get and how fast it replenishes.
Supply.texts.plural.name: Supplies

CarryCapacity.texts.name: Carry Capacity
CarryCapacity.texts.desc: [CarryCapacity] is the amout of units that this unit can transport at once.
CarryCapacity.texts.plural.name: Carry Capacities

SubSting.texts.name: Sting
SubSting.texts.desc: The amount of [H_Sting]s currently under supervision of the [!H_Frigate].
SubSting.texts.plural.name: Stings

SubHelpfulEntourage.texts.name: Helpful Entourage
SubHelpfulEntourage.texts.desc: The number of [E_HelpfulEntourage]s currently escorting the champion.

Time.texts.name: Time
Time.texts.desc: The time required for the annexation of the Village.
Time.texts.plural.name: Time

Militia.texts.name: Militia
Militia.texts.desc: Number of units defending this Village
Militia.texts.plural.name: Militia

ExtensionSpace.texts.name: Building Slot
ExtensionSpace.texts.desc: The space available in a Village to build extensions on
ExtensionSpace.texts.plural.name: Building Slots

EconomicLevel.texts.name: Economic Level
EconomicLevel.texts.desc: Capacity of the Sietch to generate resources to trade
EconomicLevel.texts.plural.name: Economic Level

ThreatLevel.texts.name: Threat Level
ThreatLevel.texts.desc: Propensity of the Sietch to launch raids on nearby enemy factions
ThreatLevel.texts.plural.name: Threat Level

SandwormActivity.texts.name: Sandworm activity
SandwormActivity.texts.desc: Likeliness of [Sandworm] attacks in the region
SandwormActivity.texts.plural.name: Sandworm activity

Wind.texts.name: Wind Strength
Wind.texts.desc: Strength of the wind in the region. Strong winds can be exploited for [Water] production.
Wind.texts.plural.name: Wind Strength

Experience.texts.name: Experience
Experience.texts.desc: Units gain more [Power] and [Life] as they defeat opponents.
Experience.texts.plural.name: Experience

Relationship.texts.name: Relation Level
Relationship.texts.desc: Higher Relation Levels lead to fewer attacks and more trading potential.
Relationship.texts.plural.name: Relation Levels

CHOAMShare.texts.name: CHOAM Share
CHOAMShare.texts.desc: Shares owned from the CHOAM, can be used to achieve an Economic Victory
CHOAMShare.texts.plural.name: CHOAM Shares

AgendaPriority.texts.name: Charter Priority
AgendaPriority.texts.desc: The available [!Charter] with highest priority will appear on the next Council's agenda.
AgendaPriority.texts.plural.name: Charter Priority

Intel.texts.name: Intel
Intel.texts.desc: General intelligence, which unlocks information and allows you to carry out various spying actions.
Intel.texts.plural.name: Intel

Infiltration.texts.name: Information
Infiltration.texts.desc: Knowledge of a Faction's military, economic or political capabilities.
Infiltration.texts.plural.name: Informations

SpaceGuild_Infiltration.texts.name: Spacing Guild Information
SpaceGuild_Infiltration.texts.desc: Spying field relative to the Spacing Guild.
SpaceGuild_Infiltration.texts.plural.name: Spacing Guild Information

Choam_Infiltration.texts.name: CHOAM Information
Choam_Infiltration.texts.desc: Spying field relative to the CHOAM.
Choam_Infiltration.texts.plural.name: CHOAM Information

CQ_ImprovementPoint.texts.name: Development Asset
CQ_ImprovementPoint.texts.desc: These assets allow you to improve your territories by choosing bonuses that will apply as long as you keep them.
CQ_ImprovementPoint.texts.plural.name: Development Assets

CQ_StratagemPoint.texts.name: War Asset
CQ_StratagemPoint.texts.desc: These assets can be used to prepare stratagems before a difficult battle.
CQ_StratagemPoint.texts.plural.name: War Assets

CQ_PlotProgress.texts.name: Plot progress
CQ_PlotProgress.texts.desc:
Progress of the plot trying to take you down
If it reaches 100%, you will be defeated and the run will end.
CQ_PlotProgress.texts.plural.name: Plot progress

CQ_FremenRelations.texts.name: Fremen Relationship
CQ_FremenRelations.texts.desc: Current relationship of your faction with the Fremen on Arrakis.
CQ_FremenRelations.texts.plural.name: Fremen Relationship

CQ_FremenRelations_Fremen.texts.name: Fremen Unity
CQ_FremenRelations_Fremen.texts.desc: Current followers of your cause among Fremen society.
CQ_FremenRelations_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Fremen Unity

CQ_FaufrelucheRelations.texts.name: Faufreluche Corruption
CQ_FaufrelucheRelations.texts.desc: Current influence of your organisation on the Faufreluches' legitimate processes.
CQ_FaufrelucheRelations.texts.plural.name: Faufreluche Corruption

CQ_RenegadeRelations.texts.name: Renegades Relationship
CQ_RenegadeRelations.texts.desc: Current relationship of your faction with the Renegades.
CQ_RenegadeRelations.texts.plural.name: Renegades Relationship

War.name: Conflict
War.desc: An active conflict is going on between your two factions. Relationships are tense, and some hostile actions are now expected. It also restricts some positive actions.

Peace.name: Truce
Peace.desc: The world of Arrakis is harsh, and there are no real allies. Despite that, you seem to have a common goal with this faction for now, opening up interesting diplomatic options.

ConstructionInProgress.text: There is already a construction in progress.

CarrierStillOnField.text: Previous [Carryall] has yet to give sufficient clearance.

CannotDeployOwnedZone.text: Cannot deploy in territory owned by someone else.

NeedsOccupation.text: Must occupy the city. (Successfully besiege it).

NeedsOccupierNearby.text: Must have a military unit nearby.

TreatyProposeOnCooldown.text: Must wait before proposing this treaty again.

AlreadyPendingTrade.text: A trade is already pending with this faction.

NoResourcesAllowedWithTreaty.text: Cannot have resources in the trade with this [Treaty].

TradeMaxItems.text: Cannot propose more than ::value(Trading_MaxConcurrentItems):: items on one side of the trade.

AlreadyAtWar.text: Already at War with this faction.

IsAlly.text: Cannot do that on an Ally.

DangerousOperation.text: This Operation will break [Peace] if detected.

RelationsAtMax.text: Already at maximum relations with this faction.

UnitsInEnemyTerritory.text: Some of your units are in this enemy's territory.

NoDeclareWarAsTributeLiege.text: As [TributeLiege], you cannot declare war on your [TributeSubject]

EnhancedSecurityFaction.text: Faction has enhanced security and cannot be targeted for now.

OnLand.text: Cannot be done while on the surface.

WormRiding_ThumperTooFar.text: A [Thumper] can only be placed close to ground Military Units.

WormRiding_InCombat.text: A [Thumper] cannot be used while in combat.

WormRiding_NeedSand.text: A [Sandworm] can only be called on sand.

WormRiding_ThumperMissing.text: You don't have any thumper to use.

WorldEventCantRaid.text: There is no valid target to launch the raid right now. Please try again later.

WorldEventNoAgents.text: You need to assign [Agent]s to a [Field_Infiltration] slot.

WorldEvent_AgentsBusy.text: Your agents are already investigating another Discovery.

AllDevsResearched.text: You have already researched all [Development]s of the reward type.

KnowledgeAlreadyInvested.text: You are already investing [Knowledge] in another Discovery.

MaxHarvTraining.text: Cannot recruit more than one [F_Harvester_Mobile] at the same time.

FactionCannotUseBuilding.text: This type of [!Building_Village] cannot be used by this faction.

InPreviewMode.text: Click on an empty slot to build.

NoVillageInZone.text: The region does not contain a [!Village].

VillageWithNoHeadquarterOrNotSieged.text: You must besiege or have a [UWHeadquarters] in this [!Village].

NoBuildingSlotAvailable.text: This [!Building_Village] takes up a [!Building_Village] slot you don't have access to.

MaxWondersInVillageReached.text: Can't build more than ::value(Village_Max_Wonders):: Major Building in a [!Village].

CannotPlaceBuilding.text: You cannot place a new [!Building_Village] there.

CantRebelMilitia.text: This Village can't rebel while defended by [Militia].

AlreadyCapturing.text: You are already capturing this village.

PauseDisabled.text: Pause is not available in this game.

PauseHostOnly.text: Only the game creator can pause.

PauseInstigatorOnly.text: Only the player who paused the game can resume it.

PausedByOther.text: Game is paused by another player.

PausedByWindow.text: Game is paused by an open window.

TreatyAllyCollision.text: Teammates already benefit from these effects.

NeedZoneOrNeighborOwner.text: You must own the region or one of its neighbors.

NeedZoneOrNeighborOwnerOrUWHQ.text: You must own [UWHeadquarters] or a [!Village] in the region or one of its neighbors.

NeedZoneNotOwnedByOpponent.text: The Region must not be owned by an opponent

OutOfZone.text: Must be completely within the region.

NeedVillageOverlap.text: Must overlap with the origin village.

NotEnoughSharesToSell.text: You don't have that amount of shares.

NoCarrierCapacityLeft.text: Not enough room left for this unit.

IsNotAtPeace.text: You must be in [Peace] with the target faction.

IsNotAtWar.text: You must be in [War] with the target faction.

Contract_LevelChange_InCooldown.text: Must wait before making a change in the contract.

Contract_LevelChange_InvalidGap.text: Cannot change directly to this level in the contract.

NuclearRangeMin.text: Cannot send Nuclear Heads this close to the launcher.

NuclearRangeMax.text: Cannot send Nuclear Heads this far from the launcher.

NeededMaxLevel.text: Need to be at level MAX.

CtairSkillNoTrait.text: No ally non-mechanical units or [!Village] in range.

FogHidden.text: Hidden in the fog of war.

HostileUnitsInRegion.text: Hostile units are in the region

ActionBlockedDuringLandsraad.text: You must confirm the current phase of the Landsraad.

SupportCharterDisabledDuringLandsraad.text: You cannot support a [Charter] while the [Landsraad] is in session.

SupportCharterDisabledBeforeLandsraad.text: The Council will open soon. The Charter agenda is locked.

SietchAlreadHasAlly.text: Another faction already has an alliance with this [Sietch].

TradeBlocked.text: Trade with this [Sietch] is not available.

AllianceBlocked.text: Alliance with this [Sietch] is not available.

CantRestorePillagedSietch.text: You have pillaged this [Sietch]. You cannot repopulate it.

CantRestorePillagedSietchAlly.text: Your teammate have pillaged this [Sietch]. You cannot repopulate it.

NoCitySelected.text: Select Region that contains a base or a village.

NoVillageSelected.text: Select Region that contains a village.

NoMainBaseSelected.text: Select a Region with a base.

NeedDevResearched.text: Can only be used on a researched development.

DevAlreadyResearchedByOther.text: Another faction has researched this development.

NeedNearbyVillage.text: Must be near a village to use.

CannotUseDuringStorm.text: Ability cannot be used during a [Sandstorm].

AllDevsAreKnown.text: You already have researched all developments known by this faction.

NeedAirfieldOrRefinery.text: The Village has no [Refinery] and no [Airfield].

NeedWormActivity.text: The region has no sand for [Sandworm]s to navigate.

RenegadeBaseInZone.text: The region is controlled by a [RenegadeBase].

BuildingAlreadyHastened.text: Hasten already used on this building.

NoSietchAssign.text: Cannot be sent as Emissary on a [Sietch].

VictoryMissionAlreadyOngoing.text: Another Assassination mission is already started.

NoAssassination.text: There is no assassination ongoing against you.

MissionSameTypeOngoing.text: A mission of the same kind is already started.

OperationSameTypeOngoing.text: An operation of this type is available. Use it or cancel it to be able to start the mission.

MissionFinished.text: You already have completed this mission.

AgentCooldown.text: Agents have a cooldown when assigned.

MissionForbiddenFaction.text: This mission is not allowed for your faction.

NoOperationSlot.text: There is no more space for another operation.

NoOperationToSacrifice.text: You don't have any operation to sacrifice.

MissionAlreadyHastened.text: Hasten already used on this mission.

MissionTargetGreatHouses.text: You can only target Great Houses

OptionNotAvailableWithFontSize.text: Not available with minimum font size.

NoOpponentTeam.text: All players cannot be on the same team.

NoHumanPlayer.text: Cannot start games with only AIs.

P2POwnerMustPlay.text: The host must be a player in peer-to-peer games.

ParametersNotLocked.text: Game parameters must be locked first.

LobbyIsSave.text: Lobby is a loaded game you are not part of.

LobbyIsLostSave.text: Lobby is a loaded game in which you have already lost.

SpectateDisabled.text: This lobby does not allow spectators.

SpectateFull.text: This lobby has too many spectators.

NoPlayerSlot.text: There are no player slots left.

LobbyKicked.text: You have been kicked from this lobby.

InputDisabled_Mouse.text: Mouse and keyboard controls are disabled for this lobby.

InputDisabled_Gamepad.text: Gamepad controls are disabled for this lobby.

UnsportmanlikeConduct.info: Collusion, match fixing, wintrading, assisting the enemy

Inactivity.info: Leaving games, early conceding, ignoring teamplay

Griefing.info: Disrupting lobbies, unjustified social exclusion, smurfing

Me_HasTResNetProd.desc: Have a net production of [::target::] over ::value::

Me_AgentsLeftToRecruit.desc: Have at least ::value:: [Agent] left to recruit

Me_HasStandingArmyArmor.desc: Has a total of ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Armor] combined on Military Units

Me_TotalMainBaseBuildingsCount.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: total [!Building_MB]s in your Main bases

Me_DistrictCompleteCount.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: completed districts in your Main base

Me_DistrictBonusesCount.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: active district bonuses in your Main base

Me_InfluenceSpentOnVotes.desc: Spend ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Influence] on Landsraad votes since the game started

Me_InfiltrationLevelOtherFactions.desc: Have at least ::value:: [!Infiltration] levels in every other faction (currently ::value-crt::)

Me_InfiltrationLevelAnyOtherFaction.desc: Have at least ::value:: [!Infiltration] levels in one other faction (currently ::value-crt::)

Me_MaxInfiltrationLevel.desc: Have at least one [!Infiltration] field at level ::value:: (currently ::value-crt::)

Me_TotalInfiltrationLevels.desc: Have at least a total of ::value:: [!Infiltration] levels (currently ::value-crt::)

Me_MaxRelationshipLevel.desc: Have at least one faction above ::value:: [Relationship]

Me_FightingStructuresCount.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: sieges or occupations against you in progress

Me_HasHeadquartersInEveryVillage.desc: Have a [UWHeadquarters] in every single player-owned [Village] but your own

Me_HasMBHeadquartersInEveryMainBase.desc: Have a [MBUWHeadquarters] in every single Main Base but your own

Me_NoCHOAMSaleForDuration.desc: Don't sell [Spice] to the [CHOAM] for ::floored-crt::/::value:: days

Me_HasCrewCount.desc: Have a total of ::floored-crt::/::value:: [CrewPoint] on your [Harvester]s

Me_Targetted_By_Assassination_InProgress.desc: Assassination attempt against me in progress

Me_IsLastAlive_ExceptTFaction.desc: Be the last faction standing. Ignores [::target::]

Me_MainBase_StableNeighborAllyVillageCou.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: ally villages not rebelling next to your main base

Me_IsHighestTObjectiveProgress.desc: have the highest progress on the [::target::] objective

Me_Track_TraitorPeace.desc: Betray or sign [Peace] with an opponent

Me_Track_ElectOtherToPositiveResolution.desc: Elect other faction to ::floored-crt::/::value:: positive Resolutions

Me_Track_SucessfulSiegesOnEnemy.desc: Successfully besiege ::floored-crt::/::value:: villages owned by another faction

Me_Track_SiegeActionCompleted_NearOppone.desc: Complete ::floored-crt::/::value:: siege on a [Village] neighboring an opponent's Main Base

Me_Track_CompleteDiscoveries_OutsideTerr.desc: Find and resolve ::floored-crt::/::value:: discoveries outside your territory with military units

Me_Track_MainBaseDamage_WithUnitOriginal.desc: Deal ::floored-crt::/::value:: damage to enemy main bases with [::target::]s

Me_Track_KillsInZoneWithOwnOperation.desc: Kill ::floored-crt::/::value:: enemy units while a [$my(faction)-adjective] operation is ongoing

Me_Track_VillageTimeWithTTrait.desc: [$my(faction)] [Village]s had the [::target::] trait for a total of ::floored-crt::/::value:: days

Me_Track_WinVotesInOneCouncil.desc: Win ::floored-crt::/::value:: votes in a single Landsraad council

Me_Track_OperationUsesOnTRegion.desc: Use ::floored-crt::/::value:: operations of level ::value2:: or more on ::target::

Me_Track_OperationDetected_ByFactionWith.desc: Have ::floored-crt::/::value:: operations detected by a faction you have ::floored1:: [!Infiltration] levels in

Me_Track_TUnitType_TimeSpentAssistingMil.desc: [::target::] has spent ::value-crt::/::value:: days assisting Military Units in combat

Me_Track_TInfiltrationLevel.desc: Have at least a total of ::value:: [!::target::] levels (currently ::value-crt::)

Game_ControlledVillages_ByEnemies.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Village]s are controlled by an enemy faction

Game_ControlledVillages_ByEnemies_Ratio.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Village]s are controlled by an enemy faction

Game_InfluenceSpentOnVotes.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Influence] was spent in total in votes

Game_TargetedResolutionsPassed.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: Factions have been elected to resolutions

Game_MilitaryUnitsTrained.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: Military Units were trained in total

Game_MaximumAssassinationStep.desc: ::floored-crt::/::value:: steps in Assassination were reached by at least 1 faction

Game_OneFaction_OverPercentCHOAMShares.desc: At least one faction has more than ::percent_value:: of CHOAM shares

Game_OneMainBase_UnderHealthPercent.desc: At least one [MainBase] are under ::value:: health

Game_HasZoneWithTTrait.desc: A [::target::] region is on the map

Game_IsAtSpeed.desc: Set the game speed to x::value::

Dev_RandomResearchable_GainDays.desc: Advances a random researchable [Development] by ::value:: days

TUnit_SpawnMB_WithTTrait2.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unit::] with [::target2::-trait] near your Main Base

TUnit_SpawnMB_XpLevel.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unit::] near your Main Base directly at level ::value1::

TUnit_SpawnMB_XpLevel_WithTTrait2.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unit::] with [::target2::-trait] near your Main Base directly at level ::value1::

GroundUnit_Random_SpawnMB.desc: Receive ::value:: random available ground unit near your Main Base

TUnitType_SpawnMB.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unitType::] unit near your Main Base

TUnitType_SpawnMB_WithTTrait2.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unitType::] unit with [::target2::-trait] near your Main Base

TUnitType_SpawnMB_XpLevel.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unitType::] units near your Main Base directly at level ::value1::

TUnitType_SpawnMB_XpLevel_WithTTrait2.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unitType::] unit with [::target2::-trait] near your Main Base directly at level ::value1::

TUnit_SpawnMB_InTBlackboard2.desc: Receive ::value:: [::target-unit::] near your Main Base in [::target2::]

TBBUnits_SetXpLevel.desc: Units in [::target::] are set to xp level ::value::

TUnit_SetLevel.desc: All your [::target::] units go to level ::value::

Army_RandomLosses.desc: ::value:: of your military units will leave your service

FactionSpecialUnit_Unlock_RandomFactionW.desc: Gain access to one special military unit of a random faction, within which you have Level ::value:: [!Infiltration], until the end of the game

SpawnHeroMB.desc: [::mission-hero::] will spawn at your main base

TDiscovery_Spawn_WithinMBZones.desc: Spawn a [::target::] [Discovery] near your Main base

Agent_RandomLosses.desc: ::value:: of your agents will defect and leave your service

Infiltration_FactionLevels_Lose.desc: All factions [!Infiltration] levels are reduced by ::value::

Infiltration_NotFactionLevels_Gain.desc: All non-faction [!Infiltration] levels are increased by ::value::

Start_TQuest_Against_AssassinationSource.desc: Interrupt Assassination progress for a while

Assassination_ReduceFlatProgression.desc: Reduce all the assassinations attempt by ::value::

Assassination_ReducePercentProgression.desc: Reduce all the assassinations attempt by ::s_percent::

Assassination_Treaty_Cancel.desc: End the assassination attempt by treaty

Faction_AI_BlockTotalWar.desc: Start in [Peace] with [::target::]. Also get less focused by [::target::] attack intentions

Charters_OnFirstElection_GainAgentWithTT.desc: The faction that gets elected to a Charter for the first time gains ::value:: agent with the trait ::target::

AllyEnd_WithBBEntities.desc: No longer allied with the targeted entities

Landsraad_OpenWindow.desc: Opens the Landsraad window if not already opened

Landsraad_SetCouncilResAction_OnSlot.desc: Set [::target::] on the resolution on spot ::value::

Landsraad_AddFakeInfluenceSpentOnVotes.desc: Adds fake influence spent on votes

Landsraad_ForceKeepOpen.desc: Sets if the landsraad window can be closed or not

Spawn_Worm_InRegionX.desc: Spawn a [Sandworm] in the designated Region

Faction_AI_ForceTotalWar_WithTFaction.desc: Force faction to be in total war with [::target::]

Faction_AI_ForceTotalWar_NonHostPlayers_.desc: Force faction to be in total war with all other non host factions, except for [::target::]

Faction_AI_TeamAlly_WithTFaction.desc: Force [::target::] AI to be in the same team, in peace and blocking total war

Faction_AI_TeamAlly_NonHostPlayers_Excep.desc: Force faction to be in the same team, in peace and blocking total war with all other non host factions, except for [::target::]

Conquest_LockTerritory.desc: No faction will be able to own this territory

ContractDue.name: [Spice] Contract
ContractDue.desc: All forces involved must meet their [!Spice] contract.

HeroDiedNoKiller.name: [::entityKind::] dies to the harshness of Arrakis

EcazChampionDiedNoKiller.name: The [!TEcazChampion] dies to the harshness of Arrakis

SpaceshipToAKnifeFight.name: Bringing a Spaceship to a Knife Fight

ATasteOfHisOwnMedicine.name: A taste of their own medicine

line0.text: Singleplayer win rate

line1.text: Multiplayer win rate

line0.text: Victory

Atreides.texts.name: House Atreides
Atreides.texts.desc: The stellar reputation of House Atreides owes a lot to its leader's commanding style: firm yet honorable and fair. By imperial decree, the Atreides just inherited the stewardship of Arrakis and have a lot of work to do to take over from the Harkonnens.
Atreides.texts.plural.name: House Atreides

Harkonnen.texts.name: House Harkonnen
Harkonnen.texts.desc: House Harkonnen shares its chilling reputation with its leader, Baron Vladimir Harkonnen. They have been called despotic, merciless, scheming and devious. And those are only their finer qualities.
Harkonnen.texts.plural.name: House Harkonnen

Smugglers.texts.name: Smugglers
Smugglers.texts.desc: There's a fine line between smugglers and full-fledged bandits, and Esmar Tuek is adept at walking that line. Smugglers can provide anything to anyone, provided they put the price... and do not look at the specifics too closely.
Smugglers.texts.plural.name: Smugglers

Fremen.texts.name: Fremen
Fremen.texts.desc: Fremen are the only people native to Arrakis and will do anything to protect their way against the offworlders. While their leader, Liet Kynes, doesn't originally come from Dune, she is every bit as determined and attached to the planet as the next Fremen.
Fremen.texts.plural.name: Fremen

Corrino.texts.name: House Corrino
Corrino.texts.desc: Imperial House Corrino has ruled the galaxy for ten millennia, and Shaddam IV intends to keep it that way. The situation on Arrakis calls for the direct intervention of the Padishah Emperor, who will use all His wit and the might of His administration to turn the war to His benefit.
Corrino.texts.plural.name: House Corrino

Ecaz.texts.name: House Ecaz
Ecaz.texts.desc: House Ecaz is known for its touristic resorts, its recreational drugs, and its patronage for the Art. But behind this enticing exterior, the refined house and its no less refined ruler, Archduchess Armanda, are ruthless and efficient defenders of their interests.
Ecaz.texts.plural.name: House Ecaz

Vernius.texts.name: House Vernius
Vernius.texts.desc: House Vernius of the Ixian confederacy is the main provider of spacefolding ships in the galaxy. Their obsession with technological progress clashes with the prohibition on thinking machines imposed by the Butlerian Jihad. They've mostly managed to stay within the letter of the law until now, but a monopoly on spice could free them of these petty restrictions.
Vernius.texts.plural.name: House Vernius

ImperialTax.texts.name: Imperial Tax
ImperialTax.texts.desc: [Spice] tax due to the [Imperium], condition of your presence on Arrakis.
ImperialTax.texts.noDemand: The [Imperium] has no [Spice] demand, for now.

ImperialBribe.texts.name: Imperial Bribe
ImperialBribe.texts.desc: [Spice] bribe due to the [Imperium], condition of its tolerance of your activities
ImperialBribe.texts.noDemand: The [Imperium] has no [Spice] demand, for now.

SpacialGuildBribe.texts.name: Spacing Guild Bribe
SpacialGuildBribe.texts.desc: [Spice] bribe due to the [SpacingGuild], condition of your agreement thanks to which they keep satellites out of Arrakis's Orbit, making it harder to monitor your activities
SpacialGuildBribe.texts.noDemand: The [SpacingGuild] has no [Spice] demand, for now.

GuildFees.texts.name: Guild Fees
GuildFees.texts.desc: [Spice] requested by the [SpacingGuild], condition of its good cooperation with your house and the [Landsraad-shortname] system as a whole
GuildFees.texts.noDemand: The [SpacingGuild] has no [Spice] demand, for now.

GinazSwordmasters.texts.name: Ginaz Swordmaster
GinazSwordmasters.texts.desc: A renowned swordmaster from Ginaz is visiting your palace. You could try to convince them to join your service.

MinorHouseRefugies.texts.name: House Minor Refugees
MinorHouseRefugies.texts.desc: A house minor has recently suffered a natural disaster on their home planet, that left many people destitute. We could shelter some of them here, on Arrakis.

BeneGesseritDelegation.texts.name: The Reverend Mother
BeneGesseritDelegation.texts.desc: A reverend mother of the Bene Gesserit is visiting your palace. The Sisterhood requires you to contribute to their mysterious scheme. It would be unwise to disobey.

TheArchitect.texts.name: The Investors
TheArchitect.texts.desc: A group of CHOAM entrepreneurs are looking for an opportunity to invest in a major business. Give them something to believe in and they'll reward you handsomely.

GuildProposal_SpaceportBreach.texts.name: Spaceport Breach
GuildProposal_SpaceportBreach.texts.desc: There was an accident at the Spaceport. Helping the [SpacingGuild] with the repairs would get us in their good grace.

IxScientists.texts.name: Ix Scientist
IxScientists.texts.desc: Representatives from Ix are visiting Arrakis to study the planet. A collaboration of higher minds is in order.

GS_TrainSoldiers.texts.name: Give them a taste of Arrakis

PromisingPolitician.texts.name: Promising Politician
PromisingPolitician.texts.desc: A bright young politician is rising in the [Landsraad-shortname]. No matter the subject, they always manage to steer the debate toward a favorable consensus. [$my(faction)-longname] could use such skills.

MinorHousesDelegations.texts.name: House Minor Delegation
MinorHousesDelegations.texts.desc: A delegation from a house minor has come to you for help. They need to reach one of your enemies, but don't have the means to do so safely.

RumoredAttack.texts.name: Rumored Attack
RumoredAttack.texts.desc: A rumor is circulating about your involvement in an attack on civilian transport. Denying the fabricated slander would only strengthen the rumor.

HeraldChangeVenue.texts.name: Herald of the Change
HeraldChangeVenue.texts.desc: A Herald of the Change is visiting. His duty is to report to the [Landsraad-shortname] about the current event on Arrakis and ensure that you respect your ordained duty.

RenowedMerchant.texts.name: Renowned Merchant
RenowedMerchant.texts.desc: A renowned traveling salesman is looking for new markets on Arrakis. There may be some mutual gain to be found.

CHOAMLoan.texts.name: CHOAM Loans
CHOAMLoan.texts.desc: The Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles has heard of your misfortune. They are ready to help, but want something in return.

RM_SetUpMerchant.texts.name: Help them to set up a water market

RM_FindValuables.texts.name: Introduce them to the black markets

UnderworldContacts.texts.name: The Ghost
UnderworldContacts.texts.desc: An undercover [Agent] of great talent that you thought lost long ago has contacted you with critical information about your opponents. The intel seems factual.

FremenEnvoys.texts.name: The Fremen Leader
FremenEnvoys.texts.desc: A "Naib" from a nearby sietch has come to your palace. Despite his rough manners, the fremen is friendly enough. The hate of your common enemies might be ground for an alliance of sort.

line0.desc: Kill enemy units while a [$my(faction)-shortname] operation is ongoing (currently ::floored-crt::, max ::max::)

ContrabandSupply_HardPower.texts.name: Contraband Supply
ContrabandSupply_HardPower.texts.desc: New smuggling opportunities have been brought up

ContrabandSupply_SoftPower.texts.name: Contraband Supply
ContrabandSupply_SoftPower.texts.desc: New smuggling opportunities have been brought up

ContrabandSupply_Lord.texts.name: Contraband Supply
ContrabandSupply_Lord.texts.desc: New smuggling opportunities have been brought up

CSW_Authority.texts.name: Make a deal with a crime baron

SecurityProtocols.texts.name: Security Protocols
SecurityProtocols.texts.desc: A plot is in progress to end your life. Your security team suggest to change all your protocols to slow down the assassins.

HarkonnenEnvoys.texts.name: Harkonnen Scheme
HarkonnenEnvoys.texts.desc: [Harkonnen-longname] wants to integrate you in one of their devious plots, but they want to test your commitement first... Or, maybe the test is part of the scheme?

HE_PushArmies.texts.name: Push your forces to their limits

HE_NoMercy.texts.name: Show no mercy to the locals

Leto.title: Duke
Leto.desc: Leto is the revered leader of House Atreides. A fair man respected for his wisdom and cunning, he is equally at ease in the Emperor's court as on a battlefield. He is well known for earning the trust and loyalty of his subjects rather than ruling over them by terror.

Thufir.desc: Thufir is an elderly Mentat - a human computer - and House Atreides' Master of Assassins. Renowned in the Landsraad for being both outstandingly cunning and honorable, Thufir is also a mentor in the art of war and political instruction.

Gurney.desc: Warmaster and poet, Gurney's indefectible loyalty and long service to House Atreides earned him the status of valued friend and confidant. While not exactly a handsome man, his combined abilities to sing and fight without missing a note make him both a charismatic and fearsome figure.

Jessica.title: Lady
Jessica.desc: The Lady Jessica is Duke Leto's concubine. Although she is a Bene Gesserit, her loyalty always goes to house Atreides before the Sisterhood.

Duncan.desc: One of Leto's most trusted men and House Atreides' Swordmaster, Duncan was tasked with being Leto's ambassador to the Fremen upon their arrival on Arrakis.

Paul.title: Young
Paul.desc: Paul is the heir to House Atreides. Benefiting from both a Bene Gesserit education from his mother and martial, tactical and political training from his father's most trusted men, Paul is a fearless and brilliant young man, promised to a heroic future as Leto's successor.

Yueh.title: Dr.
Yueh.desc: Yueh is a graduate from the prestigious Suk medical school. While he has not been in service of House Atreides for as long as other close councilors of the Duke, the imperial conditioning that all Suk doctors must undergo ensures his absolute loyalty.

Vladimir.title: Baron
Vladimir.desc: The Baron is the leader of House Harkonnen. A disgustingly grotesque man whose complete lack of morality allied to a keen intellect make him a formidable opponent. He is Leto's main rival and has vowed to take down House Atreides and take back Arrakis.

Glossu.desc: Nicknamed "the Beast" after murdering his own father, the Count of Lankiveil is every bit as evil and corrupt as his uncle, the Baron Harkonnen. Rabban only rules through violence and terror, making him a dreaded and despised leader.

Iakin.desc: Iakin is the Captain of the House Harkonnen guard. Although regarded as decently reliable while on duty, he is a known Semuta addict, which, to some, is enough to cast doubt on all of his abilities.

Slavemaster.desc: Cron is the favored slavemaster of the baron, a precarious but profitable position. He provides the court with a large array of services, ranging from sexual entertainment to docile workforce.

Umman.desc: Umman is the Captain of the House Harkonnen guard. His many years of duty have turned him into a violent, unsubtle man. Rumors say not even his personal life has been spared.

Feyd.desc: Glossu's younger brother and the Baron's favored nephew, Feyd-Rautha has all it takes to uphold his family's sadistic culture. An unmatched duelist and charismatic leader, he is the chosen na-Baron of House Harkonnen, destined to take over his uncle's legacy.

Piter.desc: Piter is a twisted Mentat; that is a human computer, but bred on planet Tleilax with much less ethical constraints in mind than their regular counterparts.

Esmar.desc: A sly spice smuggler used to keeping himself and his operations low key, Esmar Tuek has secret arrangements with both the Fremen and the Imperium. He also works in the shadows to undermine the Harkonnen's lingering grip on Arrakis.

Staban.desc: Staban is Esmar Tuek's son and, just like his father, a renowned smuggler of various goods on Arrakis, most notably Spice Melange. Like many of his people, he thrives in a harsh environment while routinely defying the highest authorities. He is a proud man who doesn't abide by anybody's rules but his own.

Bannerjee.desc: Bannerjee serves as the head of security at Tuek's Sietch. A stout, intimidating hulk of a man with a jaded outlook on life, he is a reliable ally when it comes to protecting Esmar's best interests.

Operative.desc: Stakkanov started in Tuek's operation as an independent contractor. She rapidly became a reliable master of operation, making unexpected profits of the most dangerous and unpredictable jobs.

Drisq.desc: Drisq is Esmar Tuek's loyal quartermaster, managing supplies and commodities for the whole Sietch. She is also regularly involved in the logistics of her master's smuggling operations.

Intelbroker.desc: Lashon Hara is a purveyor of information, whose job is to know everything, and sell it for the right price. Esmar has taken her under his protection after she got in trouble with the Harkonnens.

Lingar.desc: Lingar's business revolves around a single commodity, but one which is so rare on Arrakis, only Spice tops it in importance: water. While his extraction operations are not technically illegal, they are, by nature, risky enough that Lingar had to forge an alliance with smugglers, and most notably Esmar Tuek.

Liet.title: Doctor
Liet.desc: Liet Kynes is an imperial planetologist who took over from her father's project to terraform Arrakis into a lush environnment. She has considerable influence over the Fremen and is sensitive to the Atreides' honorable methods as rulers.

Ramallo.desc: Ramallo is an elderly Sayyadina, a rogue Bene Gesserit Reverend Mother who successfully changed the Water of Life. She therefore possesses a vast knowledge inherited from her foremothers, and her immense wisdom makes her a revered mother figure among the Fremen.

Otheym.desc: Otheym is a renowned and fearsome Fremen fighter who left Sietch Gara Kulon for Sietch Tabr led by Stilgar. A wise and loyal if a bit gruff man, he likes to be on the front line, be it in combat or through experimenting with new kinds of strategies.

Jamis.desc: Jamis is a renowned and fearsome Fremen fighter, prone to anger and brooding, but also gentle and loyal to his friends. He is decisive and passionate, and you'd rather have him on your side of a fight.

Chani.desc: Chani is a young Fremen mothered by the famous imperial planetologist Liet Kynes. A bold and charismatic woman and an adept fighter, she is loyal to her native people and is determined to do whatever it takes to remove any lingering Harkonnen presence from her planet.

Shimoom.desc: Shimoom is a watermaster of Sietch Tabr, responsible for ensuring the exact value of a water trade between two parties, and that no water of the tribe is lost. He does his job diligently and with precision.

Stilgar.desc: Stilgar is the Naib - the leader - of Sietch Tabr, one of the most prominent Fremen communities on Arrakis. A wise and honorable leader, he has a soft spot for Chani Kynes, whom he regards as his niece.

Shaddam.title: Padishah Emperor
Shaddam.desc: Shaddam IV is the 81st Emperor of the Known Universe. Head of the famed House Corrino, he is also Leto Atreides' adoptive cousin, for whom he harbors fond feelings. Unfortunately, the current balance of power demands that he fights him as fiercely as any other foe.

Wensicia.desc: Wensicia is the third daughter of Shaddam IV. She is trained in stewardship and takes care of much of the day to day logistics of the imperial palace. Her impulsiveness often causes trouble, but brings her to rapid success even more often.

Aramsham.desc: Captain Aramsham is a proud Sardaukar officer, used to wielding authority over his subordinates, conscripts of the Landsraad and Sardaukar alike. Pragmatic and experienced, he is often put in charge of dangerous operations, which he always returns victorious from.

Zum.desc: Zum Garon has been Supreme Bashar of the Sardaukar for decades. He is brutal and uncompromising, with enemies and subordinates alike. Often leading the troops personally, his loyalty to Shaddam IV has been proven many times.

Irulan.desc: Irulan is the eldest daughter of Shaddam IV. Her lack of a brother makes her the prime candidate to become Empress at the death of her father. She received a Bene Gesserit education from her mother, but still keeps a strong ambition that often puts her at odds with the Emperor.

Mohiam.desc: Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam is both a powerful agent of the Bene Gesserit, and the personal Truthsayer of Shaddam IV. She is fully loyal to the Sisterhood and would do anything for their breeding plan to succeed.

Fenring.desc: Hasimir Fenring was once part of the Bene Gesserit's breeding program, candidate for the role of Kwisatz Haderach. He was abandoned by the Bene Gesserit because of a genetic defect. Serving as mentat and assassin for Shaddam IV, he is also His closest friend.

Sanya.desc: Sanya is the eldest daughter of Armanda, and current heir to the Ecaz dynasty. Her charming personality and eclectic tastes allow her to thrive among the artistic community of the house. She even has a few works to her name.

Whitmore.desc: Whitmore Bludd was a renowned instructor at the Ginaz swordmaster school. After the fall of Ginaz, he entered the service of House Ecaz, first as Ilesa's bodyguard, and then as warmaster.

Rivvy.desc: Rivvy was a renowned instructor at the Ginaz swordmaster school. After the fall of Ginaz, he entered the service of House Ecaz as Armanda's personal bodyguard.

Ilesa.desc: Ilesa is the second daughter of Armanda. Having barely survived an assassination attempt at the onset of adulthood, losing an arm and an eye in the process, Ilesa has grown into a bitter and serious woman, with no qualms about using her infirmity to guilt people into doing her bidding.

Ibbo.desc: Ibbo is a famous political philosopher, who has enjoyed the Ecazi court for a while. His central thesis rests on the idea that trade and gift-giving, especially of non-essential items, are powerful means of control.

Mesa.desc: Mesa is the youngest daughter of Armanda. She may appear shy and reserved at first glance, but it's only her sisters taking all the spotlight. In private, she is driven and smart, always trying to push the house resources toward helping the people.

Bolig.desc: Bolig Avati is the de facto leader of the Ixian Technocrat Council, the rising counterpower to the autocratic ruling of House Vernius. While Bolig and Rhombur do not always see eye to eye, they are both loyal to the interests of Ix.

Bronso.desc: Bronso is the son of Rhombur and Tessia Vernius. He is a shy young man, but his sharp intellect already manifests itself in his interests for historical science and sociology.

Cammar.desc: Cammar Pilru has served as ambassador of House Vernius for many years. While his job is often hindered by the unfounded technophobia of the Imperium, he has learned to promote Ixian machines as both harmless and necessary to the Great Houses.

Tessia.desc: Tessia is the wife of Rhombur. While she is a sister of the Bene Gesserit, it is clear that her loyalty and love goes to Rhombur. All of her considerable skills are used for his benefits only, which often irritates the Sisterhood.

UnknownLeader.desc: You will need to discover this leader's territory to have more information on them.

PeacefullyAnnex.name: Peaceful Annexation
PeacefullyAnnex.desc:
Annexation time: ::val(CaptureDuration):: days
Peacefully capture this village

Oppression.name: Oppression
Oppression.desc: Oppress the village to increase its productivity but cause unrest when the effect ends.

HastenFake.name: Hasten
HastenFake.desc: While some uses violence to increase efficiency, Thufir prefers subtler forms of pressure.

HastenBuilding.name: Hasten
HastenBuilding.desc: While some uses violence to increase efficiency, Thufir prefers subtler forms of pressure.

HastenMission.name: Hasten
HastenMission.desc: While some uses violence to increase efficiency, Thufir prefers subtler forms of pressure.

DeployMainBase.name: Main Base Deployment
DeployMainBase.desc: Razes the village and deploys an [ImpBase] in its stead. Can only be used once.

EcazPride.name: Garden Resort
EcazPride.desc:
Turn this [!Village] into a Garden Resort.
Can only be done once.

HoldPosition.name: Hold Position
HoldPosition.desc: Will stay at the current position and only retaliate on enemies within direct attack range

Shuttle.name: Shuttle
Shuttle.desc: Transport to any area within an [Airfield]'s range.

ChangeToHarvCaravan.name: Break camp
ChangeToHarvCaravan.desc: Pack camp and depart with your [::unit(UReplaceWith)::]

VHarvesterInstall.name: Deploy
VHarvesterInstall.desc: Deploy the [!V_Harvester] and begin to harvest [Spice].

CDroneInstall.name: Install
CDroneInstall.desc: Installs the [C_Drone] in place and deploys its cannon, allowing it to fire at long range but blocking its movement.

CDroneLeave.name: Uninstall
CDroneLeave.desc: Uninstalls the [C_Drone] and pack its cannon, allowing it to move again.

CFrigateDeploy.name: Airfield Configuration
CFrigateDeploy.desc: Set up the [!C_Frigate] as a military [!Airfield].

CFrigateLeave.name: Mobile Configuration
CFrigateLeave.desc: Recover the [!C_Frigate] mobility and offensive abilities.

Disembark_Drone.name: Disembark
Disembark_Drone.desc: Releases all units carried by the drone.

Disembark.name: Disembark
Disembark.desc: Releases all carried units below the ship.

VEliteInstall.name: Repair Station
VEliteInstall.desc: Deploy a repair station for fixing drones.

VEliteLeave.name: Uninstall
VEliteLeave.desc: Uninstalls the [V_Elite]'s repair station, allowing her to move again.

DecimationProtocols.name: Decimation Protocols
DecimationProtocols.desc: Drones do not have any survival instincts, which is a beautiful quality in some contexts.

ToxicPurge.name: Toxic Purge
ToxicPurge.desc: Increases the volume of toxic gases ejected for a stronger effect.

A_Hero_1_Skill.name: Duncan's Last Stand
A_Hero_1_Skill.desc: At the height of the battle, [!A_Hero_1] tap into deep reserve of strength coming from his loyalty to [Atreides-longname].

A_Hero_2_Skill.name: Forced March
A_Hero_2_Skill.desc: [!A_Hero_2]'s songs remind everyone of the sweetness of life, even when it is tough.

A_Hero_2_Skill_Cancel.name: Stop Forced March
A_Hero_2_Skill_Cancel.desc: [!A_Hero_2]'s songs remind everyone of the sweetness of life, even when it is tough.

H_Hero_1_Skill.name: Gladiator Drugs
H_Hero_1_Skill.desc: [!H_Hero_1] uses a psychedelic cocktail that temporarily turns his bodyguards into frenzied zombies.

H_Hero_2_Skill.name: Cannon Fodder
H_Hero_2_Skill.desc: The terrifying [H_Hero_2] feeds the grinder of wars with fresh meat.

S_Hero_2_Skill.name: Street Urchins
S_Hero_2_Skill.desc: [!S_Hero_2] finds some use of the disillusionned youth of Arrakis

F_Hero_1_Skill.name: Ambush
F_Hero_1_Skill.desc: A proper ambush requires discretion, coordination, and imagination.

V_Hero_1_Skill.name: Nuwa's Repair Station
V_Hero_1_Skill.desc: Deploy a repair station for fixing drones.

ProbeSetup.name: Probe Setup
ProbeSetup.desc: Knowledge is power, they say. It's even more true on Arrakis, where ignorance can be lethal.

LeaveOrder.name: Leave Order
LeaveOrder.desc: The Landsraad cannot force you to remove your troops, but it can fine you for not complying.

GearSabotage.name: Defense Sabotage
GearSabotage.desc: The most effective defensive weapons do not matter if your enemy cannot use them.

ScavengerTeam.name: Scavenger Team
ScavengerTeam.desc: Corpses usually have many valuables on them. It'd be a shame to leave them to the desert.

SupportIntelligence.name: Support Intelligence
SupportIntelligence.desc: Coordinating analysts at the office and soldiers on the field allows for a better reaction to threats, which saves many lives.

CombatDrugs.name: Combat Drugs
CombatDrugs.desc: Some drugs and chemical compounds can significantly enhance combat efficiency at the cost of a reduced lifespan.

SupplyCaches.name: Supply Caches
SupplyCaches.desc: There are only few ways to get what you need in the middle of the desert. The easiest one is to have it ready and set up in the right place, long in advance.

HiddenThumpers.name: Hidden Thumpers
HiddenThumpers.desc: Fremen are masters at using Shai-Hulud for transport. A secret technique lets them influence the movement of sandworms on the whole planet, facilitating wormriding.

Consolidation.name: Consolidation
Consolidation.desc: The constant redeployment of the Imperial army on various fronts of the Imperium has made them incredibly resistant. Through unusual formations and well-timed restocking, they can enhance this ability even further.

EpicQuest.name: Epic Quest
EpicQuest.desc: A personal mission given to a proud soldier is the best motivation in the world.

SupplyDrop.name: Supply Drop
SupplyDrop.desc: An army without supply will not last long in the desert.

WormCalling.name: Decoy Thumper
WormCalling.desc: Fremen place thumpers in peculiar places to attract and enrage sandworms on their enemies' paths and out of theirs.

EMPBomb.name: EMP Bomb
EMPBomb.desc: An electromagnetic pulse that will deactivated all electronics, making drones useless for a little while.

ArrakisDiplomacy.name: Arrakis Diplomacy
ArrakisDiplomacy.desc: Empathy, patience, and attention for cultural differences lead to a great deal of success in getting the locals' favors.

SleeperAgent.name: Sleeper Agent
SleeperAgent.desc: With care and meticulousness, it's possible to plant a sleeper agent in every army squad that will betray them on command.

PoisonReserves.name: Poison the Reserves
PoisonReserves.desc: Tainted rations will not only make you physically sick but will infect even your trust and confidence in your teammates.

ExtractionNetwork.name: Extraction Network
ExtractionNetwork.desc: Leaving combat to fight another day is not cowardice; it is tactical acumen.

CrowdManipulation.name: Awake the People
CrowdManipulation.desc: Carefully placed instigators and targeted propaganda are enough to turn docile workers into violent dissidents.

InterdictionZone.name: Interdiction Zone
InterdictionZone.desc: To be effective, a no-fly zone has to be enforced by a mix of political and legal means, as well as military support often given from space.

LivePerformance.name: Live Performance
LivePerformance.desc: A good show provokes admiration, but a bad one invites mockery.

EmpiricalData.name: Empirical Data
EmpiricalData.desc: Progress is a constant back and forth between theoretical breakthrough and practical issues. Collecting data from real life fights on the surface of Arrakis informs current researches.

DefenseSabotage.name: Defense Breaches
DefenseSabotage.desc: Even the best fortress has weaknesses. With a little bit of planning, it's easy to exploit them and fully disorganize the defenders.

AdministrativeBurden.name: Administrative Burden
AdministrativeBurden.desc: By liberal use of red tape and obfuscation, a colonial administration can be almost completely immobilised, at least for a while.

CeaseFire.name: Cease Fire
CeaseFire.desc: Sometimes a ceasefire is the stepping stone to a durable peace. More often, it is only a stalling scheme.

HiddenBackdoor.name: Hidden Backdoor
HiddenBackdoor.desc: A tiny security default, hidden deep within the mechanical engineering of any machine built by the House, can be activated at any moment to take control. There shall be no witness to such an event left alive, for it would ruin Ix reputation.

ToxicVapors.name: Toxic Vapors
ToxicVapors.desc: Chemical weapons are an easy way to get rid of military resistance if you are not too concerned with ethical considerations.

CommunicationJamming.name: Communication Jamming
CommunicationJamming.desc: Controlling the flow of information in battle is often the way to victory.

SandCloak.name: Hiding Tracks
SandCloak.desc: By choosing when to strike, Fremen can disarm the invaders of their strongest tools.

OrbitalStrike.name: Orbital Strike
OrbitalStrike.desc: The Emperor always keeps a few ships in low orbit. They are ready to strike at any time, as long as they get the right coordinates.

ElaccaFog.name: Elacca Fog
ElaccaFog.desc: The Elacca drug from Ecaz forests is used in gladiator shows to inhibit self-preservation. During war time, it can be deployed as a thick fog to get the same effect.

AmbientConnection.name: Ambient Connection
AmbientConnection.desc: Drones can connect to the Nodal Network through natural static electricity, but preparation should be made and a temporary relay installed.

InfiltrationCells.name: Infiltration Cells
InfiltrationCells.desc: There is a limit to what you can do from afar. If you really want to know someone, you need to get closer.

CellSearch.name: Cell Search
CellSearch.desc: A cell of assassins is easy to miss, if you don't look for it meticulously.

Assassination.name: Assassination
Assassination.desc: Murder is such an ugly word, but when someone has become too much of a pain, it can be efficient.

CB_DisableShield.name: Disable Shield
CB_DisableShield.desc: Someone in the inner circle of [Leto-fullname]'s court can open up the city from the inside.

CB_FraufrelucheBribe.name: Faufreluche Bribe
CB_FraufrelucheBribe.desc: The right gift to the right person at the right time will open doors that really should have stayed shut.

ProduceNuclearHead.name: Load a Nuclear Warhead
ProduceNuclearHead.desc: A [NuclearHead] will be installed safely into the Silo, in position for an unscheduled launch.

CancelProduceNuclearHead.name: Cancel Nuclear Warhead
CancelProduceNuclearHead.desc: The cost will be refunded fully

LaunchNuclearHead.name: Launch Nuclear Warhead
LaunchNuclearHead.desc: The use of nuclear weapons against humans is forbidden by the Great Convention. There is no greater crime recognized by [Landsraad-longname].

BlackoutDev.name: Obfuscate
BlackoutDev.desc:
This development will have no effect for any faction.
Can obfuscate a single researched development.

PatentDev.name: File Patent
PatentDev.desc:
Every other faction will have to pay [Vernius] <good>500</good> [Solari] to research this development.
Patents can be filed on developments that only [Vernius-longname] has researched.

MaraudersRaid.desc: Corsair and mercenaries have always been a part of warfare. Being able to deleguate military tasks to an outside entity is just more practical, in many cases.

BraceForStorm.name: Brace for the Storm
BraceForStorm.desc: Village activities are sacrificed for resilience

CB_InciteRebellion.name: Incite Rebellion
CB_InciteRebellion.desc: The [Harkonnen-adjective] propaganda machine is a paper tiger. If you fight back a little bit it will fold on itself.

DeploySails.name: Deploy Sails
DeploySails.desc: Deploy additional sails to speed up the ship.

Arrakeen.texts.name: Arrakeen
Arrakeen.texts.desc: An ancient city, one of the largest and most beautiful on Arrakis, Arrakeen is largely built on bedrock, which is sure to keep it safe from [Sandworm]. The palace is now the home of Duke Leto and headquarters of the Atreides, but used to be inhabited by the Emperor's right-hand man, Count Hasimir Fenring.
Arrakeen.texts.plural.name: Arrakeen

Carthag.texts.name: Carthag
Carthag.texts.desc: A densely populated city, erected by the Harkonnens shortly after their arrival on Arrakis, and the headquarters of their forces. It was built quickly, with functionality and efficiency in mind rather than aesthetics or quality of life, which has led many observers to criticize its austere architecture and almost menacing silhouette.
Carthag.texts.plural.name: Carthag

Tuek.texts.name: Sietch Tuek
Tuek.texts.desc: The home of Esmar Tuek and headquarters of his smuggling operations, Sietch Tuek looks remarkably welcoming and conspicuous, much like an open air bazaar. Indeed, while the activities conducted here are kept low key, the sietch doesn't try to keep itself hidden or out of sight, as it is has to be found easily by potential customers.
Tuek.texts.plural.name: Sietch Tuek

Tabr.texts.name: Sietch Tabr
Tabr.texts.desc: Sietch Tabr is one of the bigger and more famous Fremen sietches on Arrakis. It is elusive to its enemies, as its closed architecture and secluded location make it hard to spot in the desert. While the Fremen are usually welcome, other visitors may receive a rather cold reception.
Tabr.texts.plural.name: Sietch Tabr

ImpBase.texts.name: Imperial Base
ImpBase.texts.desc: Giant space lighters are used by Shaddam IV as mobile palaces and bases of operations. They are fully fitted to house the whole imperial court, communication apparatus able to reach the entire galaxy, and several legions of Sardaukar. While not as comfortable as the Imperial palace of Kaitain, these ships are still ostensibly luxurious.
ImpBase.texts.plural.name: Imperial Bases

Foliage.texts.name: Foliage
Foliage.texts.desc: Leaving their home planet for Arrakis was a difficult journey for [Ecaz-longname]. Foliage was built as a reminder of the majesty and quiet of Ecaz forests. All of Ecazi craftmanship was deployed into its high arch and fine pillars of sculpted wood.
Foliage.texts.plural.name: Foliage

IxianCore.texts.name: S-Vault
IxianCore.texts.desc: Ixians are used to living underground. Building a new city on Arrakis is simple for such an industrious and crafty people. The S-Vault was built the Ixian way, below surface with a focus on comfort and secrecy. It makes you wonder what they're making in there.
IxianCore.texts.plural.name: S-Vault

TESTBase.texts.name: Arrakeen
TESTBase.texts.desc: An ancient city, one of the largest and most beautiful on Arrakis, Arrakeen is largely built on bedrock, which is sure to keep it safe from [Sandworm]. The palace is now the home of Duke Leto and headquarters of the Atreides, but used to be inhabited by the Emperor's right-hand man, Count Hasimir Fenring.
TESTBase.texts.plural.name: Arrakeen

ConquestBase.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Atreides.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase_Atreides.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase_Atreides.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Harkonnen.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase_Harkonnen.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase_Harkonnen.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Smugglers.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase_Smugglers.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase_Smugglers.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Ecaz.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase_Ecaz.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase_Ecaz.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Vernius.texts.name: Advanced Outpost
ConquestBase_Vernius.texts.desc: When fighting far away from home, Great Houses will often use frontline bases of operations.
ConquestBase_Vernius.texts.plural.name: Advanced Outposts

ConquestBase_Fremen.texts.name: Major Sietch
ConquestBase_Fremen.texts.desc: Some Sietches are big enough to be used as frontline bases of operations for joint fremen war effort.
ConquestBase_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Major Sietches

SietchNeutral.texts.name: Wary Sietch
SietchNeutral.texts.desc: This Sietch's population is wary of strangers. By trading with them, you can show them how useful you can be, and maybe become friend.
SietchNeutral.texts.plural.name: Wary Sietches

SietchHostile.texts.name: Hostile Sietch
SietchHostile.texts.desc: This Sietch's population is hostile to strangers. They can be coerced into an alliance of sort, if you show them how unpleasant it can be to resist you.
SietchHostile.texts.plural.name: Hostile Sietches

SietchAncient.texts.name: Ancient Sietch
SietchAncient.texts.desc: This Sietch dates back to the Zensunni. It holds a religious significance to the Fremen.
SietchAncient.texts.plural.name: Ancient Sietches

SietchAccursed.texts.name: Accursed Sietch
SietchAccursed.texts.desc: This Sietch has been banished from Fremen society. It shouldn't have survived all this time.
SietchAccursed.texts.plural.name: Accursed Sietches

LocalSietch.texts.name: Settlement
LocalSietch.texts.desc: A base of operations within an allied [Sietch] useful to get additional productions.
LocalSietch.texts.plural.name: Settlements

UWHeadquarters.texts.name: Underworld Headquarters
UWHeadquarters.texts.desc: An underground base useful to sabotage and exploit a Village's operation.
UWHeadquarters.texts.plural.name: Underworld Headquarters

UWCells.texts.name: Underworld Cell
UWCells.texts.desc: An underground base useful to slowly annex a Village.
UWCells.texts.plural.name: Underworld Cells

MBUWHeadquarters.texts.name: Major Underworld Headquarters
MBUWHeadquarters.texts.desc: An underground base attached to an enemy Main Base useful to exploit this faction's strength and sabotage them.
MBUWHeadquarters.texts.plural.name: Major Underworld Headquarters

RenegadeBase.texts.name: Renegade Base
RenegadeBase.texts.desc:
[Renegades] refurbished their ship as a base of operations.
Destroy the [RenegadeBase] to gain [Solari]s and [GuildFavor]s, and free the nearby [Village] from their grip.
RenegadeBase.texts.plural.name: Renegade Bases

SpiceArea.texts.name: Spice Field
SpiceArea.texts.desc: This area is full of [Spice] ready for harvesting.
SpiceArea.texts.plural.name: Spice Fields

GeothermalEnergyArea.texts.name: Energy sources
GeothermalEnergyArea.texts.desc: This area contains geothermal energy sources.
GeothermalEnergyArea.texts.plural.name: Energy sources

MineralArea.texts.name: Minerals
MineralArea.texts.desc: This area contains a high amount of Minerals.
MineralArea.texts.plural.name: Minerals

ResearchArea.texts.name: Abandoned Imperial Station
ResearchArea.texts.desc: An old Imperial station that can contain vast amounts of resources or information.
ResearchArea.texts.plural.name: Abandoned Imperial Stations

CrashedOrnithopter.texts.name: Crashed Ornithopter
CrashedOrnithopter.texts.desc: This [Ornithopter] wreck could contain valuable information.
CrashedOrnithopter.texts.plural.name: Crashed Ornithopters

CrashedShuttle.texts.name: Crashed Shuttle
CrashedShuttle.texts.desc: The Wreck of a shuttle that's beyond repair.
CrashedShuttle.texts.plural.name: Crashed Shuttles

CrashedShuttle_quest.texts.name: Crashed Shuttle
CrashedShuttle_quest.texts.desc: The Wreck of a shuttle that's beyond repair.
CrashedShuttle_quest.texts.plural.name: Crashed Shuttles

CrashedHarvester.texts.name: Harvester Wreck
CrashedHarvester.texts.desc: The hulking machine is utterly destroyed and has been abandoned to the desert.
CrashedHarvester.texts.plural.name: Harvester Wrecks

AbandonnedFremenCamp.texts.name: Abandoned Fremen Camp
AbandonnedFremenCamp.texts.desc: An old Hiereg that has been abandoned for unknown reasons.
AbandonnedFremenCamp.texts.plural.name: Abandoned Fremen Camp

Hiereg.texts.name: Settled Hiereg
Hiereg.texts.desc: Although Hieregs are mainly temporary desert camps, some could stay in the same, safe place for a long time when needed.
Hiereg.texts.plural.name: Settled Hieregs

SmugglerBlackMarket.texts.name: Black Market
SmugglerBlackMarket.texts.desc: Some traders are prepared to risk a lot to sell illegal goods.
SmugglerBlackMarket.texts.plural.name: Black Markets

WaterSellerCaravan.texts.name: Water Seller Caravan
WaterSellerCaravan.texts.desc: These members of the Water Seller Union go from village to village to sell precious water.
WaterSellerCaravan.texts.plural.name: Water Seller Caravans

Ruins.texts.name: Ruins
Ruins.texts.desc: An old village that was abandoned years ago.
Ruins.texts.plural.name: Ruins

LostDonation.texts.name: Lost Box
LostDonation.texts.desc: A container holding what appears to be gifts. How did it end up there?
LostDonation.texts.plural.name: Lost Boxes

CrashedSpacefolder.texts.name: Space Scrap
CrashedSpacefolder.texts.desc: The wreck of a Spacing Guild ship. They are not supposed to ever crash. What has happened here?
CrashedSpacefolder.texts.plural.name: Space Scrap

CrashedShip.texts.name: Crashed Spaceship
CrashedShip.texts.desc: A forgotten Imperial spaceship that crashed on Arrakis years ago.
CrashedShip.texts.plural.name: Crashed Spaceships

CrashedShip_quest.texts.name: Crashed Spaceship
CrashedShip_quest.texts.desc: A forgotten Imperial spaceship that crashed on Arrakis years ago.
CrashedShip_quest.texts.plural.name: Crashed Spaceships

BeneGesseritRelic.texts.name: Bene Gesserit Relic
BeneGesseritRelic.texts.desc: This old thing is marked by the Bene Gesserit. We are not supposed to open it. What secrets does it hold?
BeneGesseritRelic.texts.plural.name: Bene Gesserit Relics

BeneGesseritRelic_quest.texts.name: Bene Gesserit Relic
BeneGesseritRelic_quest.texts.desc: This old thing is marked by the Bene Gesserit. We are not supposed to open it. What secrets does it hold?
BeneGesseritRelic_quest.texts.plural.name: Bene Gesserit Relics

MinorHousesDonation.texts.name: House Gift
MinorHousesDonation.texts.desc: A container holding resources gifted by Houses Minor who support your cause.
MinorHousesDonation.texts.plural.name: House Gifts

SmugglerStash1.texts.name: Smuggling Stash
SmugglerStash1.texts.desc: A container containing resources collected by teams of Smugglers.
SmugglerStash1.texts.plural.name: Smuggling Stashes

LostWeatherStation.texts.name: Lost Weather Station
LostWeatherStation.texts.desc: This ancient weather station was lost to the desert. Chances are, there is both water and data inside.
LostWeatherStation.texts.plural.name: Lost Weather Stations
LostWeatherStation.props.worldEvent.noActionText: A useless relic from a time when the Empire wanted to terraform Arrakis.

SpaceCruiserScrap.texts.name: Space Cruiser Scrap
SpaceCruiserScrap.texts.desc: A part of the Space Cruiser that crashed in that region. It may still contains some valuable.
SpaceCruiserScrap.texts.plural.name: Space Cruiser Scraps

IxWreck.texts.name: Ix Wreck
IxWreck.texts.desc: A crashed pod filled with dangerous technology.
IxWreck.texts.plural.name: Ix Wrecks

GhostMarketDiscovery.texts.name: Ghost Market
GhostMarketDiscovery.texts.desc: A ghost market has established outside of this outpost. Left unchecked, it will divert a part of its revenue.
GhostMarketDiscovery.texts.plural.name: Ghost Markets

ImpStation.texts.name: Abandoned Imperial Station
ImpStation.texts.desc: An old Imperial station that can contain vast amounts of resources or information.
ImpStation.texts.plural.name: Abandoned Imperial Stations

SpiceFreighter_TerritoryOwner.texts.name: Spice Freighter
SpiceFreighter_TerritoryOwner.texts.desc: To ensure a smooth journey, these specialized vehicules are often used to transport the precious Spice on long flights.
SpiceFreighter_TerritoryOwner.texts.plural.name: Spice Freighters

SpiceFreighter_Host.texts.name: Spice Freighter
SpiceFreighter_Host.texts.desc: To ensure a smooth journey, these specialized vehicules are often used to transport the precious Spice on long flights.
SpiceFreighter_Host.texts.plural.name: Spice Freighters

A_Ornithopter.texts.name: Ornithopter
A_Ornithopter.texts.desc: A very common type of transport vessel, the ornithopter is a jet-propelled vehicle whose articulated wings help to improve maneuvrability and ensure stability. They are primarily used as reconnaissance vehicles.
A_Ornithopter.texts.plural.name: Ornithopters

A_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.name: Scavenged Ornithopter
A_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.desc: This ornithopter has seen better days. The wings are bent and the engine is barely functionning. Hopefully, you can still get just a little bit of mileage from its old carcass.
A_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.plural.name: Scavenged Ornithopters

A_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.name: Experimental Ornithopter
A_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.desc: The Ixians have used their craft to create this cutting-edge ornithopter. It flies faster, quieter, and farther than a traditionnal one, using only the power of the sun, a resource in abundance on Arrakis. It will be years before we can mass-product such a vehicle.
A_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.plural.name: Experimental Ornithopters

A_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.name: Labthopter
A_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.desc: The Ixians have stuffed this ornithopter with all kind of captors and data collecting devices to study the effect of Arrakis on its cability. It's a bit slower, and cannot really operate properly, but they are confident that the collected data will be valuable.
A_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.plural.name: Labthopters

A_Harvester.texts.name: Harvester
A_Harvester.texts.desc: A bulky, mobile factory-like building that harvests Spice Melange from Spice fields. Due to their structure and functionality, harvesters generate a great deal of vibrations which are bound to attract [Sandworm].
A_Harvester.texts.plural.name: Harvesters

A_Trooper.texts.name: Trooper
A_Trooper.texts.desc: Troopers are fierce melee fighters. They become stronger when supported by specialized units.
A_Trooper.texts.plural.name: Troopers

A_Soldier.texts.name: Ranger
A_Soldier.texts.desc: Armed with medium-range projectile weapons, rangers are best used alongside defensive units that can protect them.
A_Soldier.texts.plural.name: Rangers

A_Demo.texts.name: Heavy Weapon Squad
A_Demo.texts.desc: Equipped with rocket launchers, these specialists can easily breach enemy defenses and open the way for other units.
A_Demo.texts.plural.name: Heavy Weapon Squads

A_Drone.texts.name: Support Drone
A_Drone.texts.desc: This heavy, remote-controlled drone is well suited for combat, but its primary purpose is to provide field support to nearby units.
A_Drone.texts.plural.name: Support Drones

A_Elite.texts.name: Warden
A_Elite.texts.desc: The Wardens are the Atreides' elite section. Equipped with heavy-duty armor, shields and swords, they are ready to give their lives to defend their allies.
A_Elite.texts.plural.name: Wardens

A_Ship.texts.name: Hawk
A_Ship.texts.desc: Fashioned after the heraldic bird of House Atreides, the Hawk harasses weakened enemies with its two machine guns.
A_Ship.texts.plural.name: Hawks

A_Frigate.texts.name: Kraken
A_Frigate.texts.desc: This utility frigate has heavy shielding and a large cabin area to keep wounded troops out of harms way. They will live to fight another day.
A_Frigate.texts.plural.name: Krakens

A_Hero_1.texts.name: Duncan
A_Hero_1.texts.desc: One of Leto's most trusted men and House Atreides' Swordmaster, Duncan was tasked with being Leto's ambassador to the Fremen upon their arrival on Arrakis.
A_Hero_1.texts.plural.name: Duncans

A_Hero_2.texts.name: Gurney
A_Hero_2.texts.desc: Warmaster and poet, Gurney's indefectible loyalty and long service to House Atreides earned him the status of valued friend and confident. While not exactly a handsome man, his combined abilities to sing and fight without missing a note make him both a charismatic and fearsome figure.
A_Hero_2.texts.plural.name: Gurney

H_Ornithopter.texts.name: Ornithopter
H_Ornithopter.texts.desc: A very common type of transport vessel, the ornithopter is a jet-propelled vehicle whose articulated wings help to improve maneuvrability and ensure stability. They are primarily used as reconnaissance vehicles.
H_Ornithopter.texts.plural.name: Ornithopters

H_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.name: Scavenged Ornithopter
H_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.desc: This ornithopter has seen better days. The wings are bent and the engine is barely functionning. Hopefully, you can still get just a little bit of mileage from its old carcass.
H_Ornithopter_Scavenged.texts.plural.name: Scavenged Ornithopters

H_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.name: Experimental Ornithopter
H_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.desc: The Ixians have used their craft to create this cutting-edge ornithopter. It flies faster, quieter, and farther than a traditionnal one, using only the power of the sun, a resource in abundance on Arrakis. It will be years before we can mass-product such a vehicle.
H_Ornithopter_Prototype.texts.plural.name: Experimental Ornithopters

H_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.name: Labthopter
H_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.desc: The Ixians have stuffed this ornithopter with all kind of captors and data collecting devices to study the effect of Arrakis on its cability. It's a bit slower, and cannot really operate properly, but they are confident that the collected data will be valuable.
H_Ornithopter_Lab.texts.plural.name: Labthopters

H_Harvester.texts.name: Harvester
H_Harvester.texts.desc: A bulky, mobile factory-like building that harvests Spice Melange from Spice fields. Due to their structure and functionality, harvesters generate a great deal of vibrations which are bound to attract [Sandworm].
H_Harvester.texts.plural.name: Harvesters

H_Trooper.texts.name: Trooper
H_Trooper.texts.desc: These rank and file troops are widely used by the Harkonnens, with little regard for their survival as long as they can further their goals.
H_Trooper.texts.plural.name: Troopers

H_Demo.texts.name: Gunner
H_Demo.texts.desc: These Harkonnen specialists use demolition charges and various explosives to stun and disorient their targets, reducing their efficiency.
H_Demo.texts.plural.name: Gunners

H_Soldier.texts.name: Cerberus
H_Soldier.texts.desc: A special section of Harkonnen fanatics, trained from birth to value success at all costs over survival.
H_Soldier.texts.plural.name: Cerberus
