CustomProperty.desc: Description of a game mechanic not specific to an ATB

SolariDeficit.name: Solari Deficit
SolariDeficit.desc: Solve your other deficits, destroy expensive units or buildings, increase your share of solaris sold to CHOAM, or trade with other factions to get more [Solari].

line1.desc: Cannot heal or recruit mechanical units

line2.desc: Units will desert and [!Building_Village]s will break until the deficit is resolved

FuelCellsDeficit.name: Fuel Cells Deficit
FuelCellsDeficit.desc: Create more [FuelCellFactory] or destroy units that use [FuelCell]s to remove this penalty.

PlascreteDeficit.name: Plascrete Deficit
PlascreteDeficit.desc: Destroy some of your buildings or trade with other factions to get more [Plascrete].

ManpowerDeficit.name: Manpower Deficit
ManpowerDeficit.desc: Create [RecruitmentOffice] or disband some of your units to get more [Manpower].

AuthorityDeficit.name: Authority Deficit
AuthorityDeficit.desc: Place Spying Agents on Field slots on Arrakis to earn more Authority.

InfluenceDeficit.name: Influence Deficit
InfluenceDeficit.desc: Create [ListeningPost] or trade with other factions to get more [Influence].

IntelDeficit.name: Intel Deficit
IntelDeficit.desc: Create [DataCenter], trade with other factions, or cancel all active assassination attempts to get more [Intel].

CommandPointDeficit.name: Command Point Deficit
CommandPointDeficit.desc: Unlock "Command" Developments or disband some of your units to get more [CommandPoint].

No_CouncilVote.name: You do not have access to [CouncilVote]s

line0.desc: Gain [AllFactions_HasNoVillage] if you have less than ::value:: [!Village]s

line1.desc: [Atreides-adjective] [!Village]s cost ::s_percent_value:: [Authority] to [Annex] and are ::us_percent_value:: longer to [Liberate].

line0.desc: Gains ::target_effects:: while under the effect of a positive targeted Resolution.

line1.desc: Gains ::target_effects:: while under the effect of a negative targeted Resolution.
Permanently gains ::target_effects:: upon being elected for a positive Resolution (x::target_stacking_limit:: max).

Atreides_PositiveResolution.name: Benefits of Reputation
Atreides_PositiveResolution.desc: The Landsraad's approval generates support for the [Atreides] economy.

Atreides_NegativeResolution.name: Allied Military Support
Atreides_NegativeResolution.desc: The Landsraad's disapproval inflames the troops of [Atreides-longname].

ImperialTax_Success.name: Imperial Satisfaction

TDualGuns.name: Dual Guns

TDualSwords.name: Dual Swords
TDualSwords.desc: Wielding two swords leads to a more aggressive posture. It's also quite impressive.

TGatlingGuns.name: Gatling Guns
TGatlingGuns.desc: Gatling guns shoot small-caliber bullets at a demented speed, shredding less armored units to pieces.

TSardaukarCleaver_Old.desc: Swords can be optimized for cutting through bones and flesh, but they are less balanced and will be less practical against a fresh foe.

TShotguns.desc: These short-range rifles have a powerful kick.

TAssassinGear.desc: With the right tools, one can really benefit from sneak attacks and weaknesses in their opponent's armour.

TBetterAmmunition.name: Better Ammunition
TBetterAmmunition.desc: High-end piercing ammunitions are costly but deadly.

TBetterCombustibles.name: Better Combustibles
TBetterCombustibles.desc: These volatile compounds burn stronger but cannot be safely contained.

TBetterFuelPumps.name: Better Fuel Pumps
TBetterFuelPumps.desc: With minutiae improvements to their combustible pumps, flamethrowers fire even further away.

TChemicalWeapons.name: Chemical Weapons
TChemicalWeapons.desc: Impregnating weapons with caustic and poisonous compounds will contaminate enemy supplies.

TConcentratedExplosives.desc: High-quality bombs produce a shockwave that shatters armor.

TEMPAmmunitions.name: EMP Ammunitions

TExperimentalCombustibles.name: Experimental Combustibles
TExperimentalCombustibles.desc: Adding a mix of phosphorus and other chemical compounds makes the combustible abrasive to skin and electronics alike.

line0.desc: Ignores half of the enemy armor

TFremenAssaultGear.name: Fremen Assault Gear
TFremenAssaultGear.desc: Fremen use various specialized gear to ambush their opponents and get an edge in combat.

TRedFluid.name: Red Fluid
TRedFluid.desc: This red fluid is not blood. Not exactly. But it does go into one's veins.

TTemperedSword.name: Tempered Sword
TTemperedSword.desc: A good blacksmith with good materials can forge harder swords with an incredible edge.

TOffensiveMindset.name: Offensive Mindset
TOffensiveMindset.desc: Developing a healthy competitive spirit towards the opponents can lead to some excess, but it helps when hacking each other to bits is in order.

TCrossfireTactics.name: Crossfire Tactics
TCrossfireTactics.desc: Attacking the same enemy carefully from two sides makes it difficult for them to react, without causing friendly fire.

TCrossfireTactics_Buff.name: Crossfire Tactics
TCrossfireTactics_Buff.desc: This unit is benefiting from a [TCrossfireTactics].

TAutomaticWeapons.name: Automatic Weapons
TAutomaticWeapons.desc: Semi-automatic weapons use the excess energy of a discharge to load the next bullet in the chamber, allowing the user to fire again immediately.

THeavyLoads.name: Heavy Loads
THeavyLoads.desc: While it's usually not recommended by the manufacturer, loading a weapon with oversized ammunition can have spectacular results.

TBirdSlayer.name: Bird Slayer
TBirdSlayer.desc: Shooting large birds out of the sky is so satisfying. This weapon is optimized to find a flailing target in a clear sky.

TWhistlingAmmo.name: Whistling Ammo
TWhistlingAmmo.desc: This ammo vibrates strongly in subsonic frequencies, creating waves of turbulence breaking the delicate equipment of most flying vessels.

TExoticCompounds.name: Exotic Compounds

TBattlefieldFrenzy.name: Battlefield Frenzy
TBattlefieldFrenzy.desc: Sardaukars' sense of duty shines brighter on major battlefront, when they are surrounded by many supporting levies.

TVowOfHeroism.desc: I will surpass myself, to reach my full potential!

TVowOfHonor.name: Vow of Honor

TPreLoadedWeapons.desc: Having a spare canon already loaded will make the first few rounds of combat a lot more impactful.

TSelfSufficiency.name: Self-sufficiency
TSelfSufficiency.desc: [!F_Elite]s are trained to operate on their own, without any outside assistance when needed.

TDevastatingStrikes.name: Devastating Strikes
TDevastatingStrikes.desc: Hitting with resolve and strength will make most close formations panic and make mistakes.

TTinkeringGear.desc: [!V_Soldier]s are constantly improving the machines surrounding them, if they are provided with some basic tools.

TTinkeringGear_Buff.desc: This drone is finely tuned by a nearby [V_Soldier].

TSharpenBlades.name: Sharpened Blades
TSharpenBlades.desc: Nanoblades are so sharp that they cannot be held in a sheath. Their use results in numerous accidental wounds.

TShrapnelAmmunitions.desc: Shells that project small metal splinters in all directions are very effective against infantry.

TStickyNapalm.desc: These new viscous combustibles stick to their victims while burning, resulting in gruesome wounds.

THeavyArmor.name: Heavy Armor
THeavyArmor.desc: A closed full-body armor increases the odds of survival in combat significantly, at the cost of reduced swiftness.

TBetterProtections.name: Better Protections
TBetterProtections.desc: A well-adjusted uniform with a few more layers of armour in the right places can do a lot for survival in combat.

TFoodAdditives.desc: The right food supplements can increase pain tolerance to superhuman levels.

TLightArmor.name: Light Armor
TLightArmor.desc: Even light armour will impede sneaking abilities.

TAssassinArmor.name: Stealth Gear
TAssassinArmor.desc: It is easy to hide without moving, but remaining hidden in movement on a planet like Arrakis... That's a proper challenge.

TSalvagedShields.name: Salvaged Shields
TSalvagedShields.desc: Salvaging is an art form that few people really master. While not as durable as a proper breastplate, a salvaged piece of armour can still save life in a hurry.

TSalvagedShields_Buff.desc: This unit has taken a piece of armor from an enemy.

PaddedShielding.name: Padded Shielding
PaddedShielding.desc: Padded armor and hulls help dissipate kinetic and thermal energy from explosive and incendiary weapons.

TFrontLineTactics.name: Front Line Tactics

TFrontLineTactics_Buff.name: Front Line Tactics
TFrontLineTactics_Buff.desc: This unit is supported by a close ally.

TParryingArmguards.name: Parrying Armguards
TParryingArmguards.desc: When you cannot rely on shields anymore, older parrying apparatus come back in fashion.

TDistorsionUmbrella.name: Distortion Umbrella

TCoverTactics.desc: Protecting each other during retreat and maneuvering saves lives and helps to get reinforcements sooner.

TConfusingTactics.name: Confusing Tactics
TConfusingTactics.desc: In a war, soldiers generally prefer to keep their friends on one side and their enemies on the other, which is not always easy with slippery opponents.

TConfusingTactics_Buff.name: Confusing Tactics
TConfusingTactics_Buff.desc: This unit is using his enemies' proximity to escape harm.

TShelterMaps.name: Shelter Maps
TShelterMaps.desc: Knowing all the good cover spots helps with the guerilla style of the Fremen army.

TWorkShelter.name: Work Shelter
TWorkShelter.desc: A quiet and safe environement is often mandatory to fulfill engineering work peacefully.

line0.desc: Gain ::target_effects:: while the repair station is deployed

TAdditionalBags.name: Additional Bags
TAdditionalBags.desc: Greed is a sin, they say. Maybe the real sin is to let perfectly good weapons and gear to rot in the desert.

line0.desc: Gain ::value:: [Solari] per active [S_Drone_Buff] at the end of combat

TMedkit.name: Medkit
TMedkit.desc: Trained medics in every squadron improves recovery, even behind enemy lines.

TCamouflageFabric.name: Camouflage Fabric
TCamouflageFabric.desc: [Fremen] are experts at staying unseen in the desert. Even a kulon can be hidden at the right place.

line0.desc: Cannot be seen outside of combat
Cannot be seen outside of combat

TSecretBeacon.name: Secret Beacon
TSecretBeacon.desc: If the worst happens, a magnetic beacon hidden in the stillsuit, lets the clan recover Water and valuables.

line0.desc: ::percent_value:: of recruitment costs are refunded upon death

TWarMemoir.name: War Memoir
TWarMemoir.desc: Field experience is essential, but a good theoretical framework for warfare also improves performance.

TPranaBindu.name: Prana Bindu Initiation
TPranaBindu.desc: Even a short initiation to prana bindu training improves healing and pain resistance over time.

TCaffeinePills.name: Caffeine Pills
TCaffeinePills.desc: With a proper stimulant, one can drastically reduce the time lost to sleeping. Surely, the side effects are not that big of a deal.

TAdaptativeShield.name: Adaptative Shield
TAdaptativeShield.desc: A device monitoring the health of the soldier is connected to an armor that can seal itself and deliver first care, preserving the life of its wearer.

TScarringArmor.name: Scarring Armor
TScarringArmor.desc: A clothing technology inspired by the way scarring tissue are created can be used to make self-repairing armor.

TEndocrineArouser.name: Endocrine Arouser
TEndocrineArouser.desc: The body naturally produces all kind of hormones when it is hurt. Giving it a little boost is enough to reach almost superhuman capability.

TSmallFormation.name: Small Formation
TSmallFormation.desc: Smaller formations allow faster reactions to unexpected changes of plan and a tailored micro-management of the frontline.

TWideNozzle.name: Wide Nozzle
TWideNozzle.desc: Flamethrowers come in many different shapes and sizes. This nozzle has an unusual wide flow.

TElaccaInjector.name: Elacca Injector
TElaccaInjector.desc: With controlled amount of elacca drug carefully injected into their veins, the [!H_Soldier] loses all sense of self-preservation without suffering any numbing.

TFixupKit.name: Fix-up Kit
TFixupKit.desc: Equipping every soldier with basic disinfectants, painkillers and wound dressing tools let them keep fighting for longer.

line0.desc: Heal ::percent_value:: [Life] at the start of combat

line1.desc: Lose [Life] healed this way at the end of combat

TBloodThinner.name: Blood Thinner
TBloodThinner.desc: A less viscous blood increases oxygenation, leading to a nice sense of euphoria, but you better not cut yourself.

line0.desc: Lose [Life] above ::percent_value:: at the start of combat

line1.desc: Regain [Life] lost that way at the end of combat

TRunningSandshoes.name: Running Sandshoes
TRunningSandshoes.desc: Sand is notoriously unstable. These shoes are designed to let the wearer run on sand even faster than they would on dirt.

TRunningSandshoes_Buff.name: Running Sandshoes
TRunningSandshoes_Buff.desc: Sand is notoriously unstable. These shoes are designed to let the wearer run on sand even faster than they would on dirt.

TFrighteningReputation.name: Frightening Reputation
TFrighteningReputation.desc: The Sardaukar's reputation as remorseless and efficient killers is the main political asset of the Emperor.

TJumpingBoot.name: Jumping Boot
TJumpingBoot.desc: A boot reinforcing the calf muscles of its wearer would permit jumps of incredible length.

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: for ::target_duration_seconds:: seconds after the target died

TJumpingBoot_Buff.name: Jumping
TJumpingBoot_Buff.desc: This [!E_Special] is jumping to her next target.

TDryTraining.name: Dry Training
TDryTraining.desc: The Fremen can train themselves to resist even better in the dry desert.

TLoudBang.name: Loud Bang
TLoudBang.desc: A sonic grenade might seem like a joke, but it will destabilize the most hardened veteran.

TLoudBang_Debuff.name: Loud Bang
TLoudBang_Debuff.desc: This unit is stunned by the sound of loud grenades.

TFocusedMind.name: Focused Mind
TFocusedMind.desc: When you remain focused on the task at hand, nothing can slow you down.

TFoldingFrame.name: Folding Frame
TFoldingFrame.desc: A light frame that can be folded in seconds will improve drastically the installation time of most appliance.

line0.desc: ::s_percent:: time to deploy and undeploy the turret

TShadowScan.name: Shadow Scan
TShadowScan.desc: A precise scanner looking for differences in heat, air pressure, and visual movement will detect most attempt at concealement.

TAmbushCamouflage.name: Ambush Camouflage
TAmbushCamouflage.desc: The [!F_Special_2] is equipped to stay hidden in the same place and disable any passerby aircraft.

line0.desc: Cannot be seen outside of combat

line3.desc: The target suffers ::target_effects:: for ::target_duration:: days when attacking undetected

TAmbushCamouflage_Debuff.name: Ambushed
TAmbushCamouflage_Debuff.desc: This unit has been ambushed by a hidden [F_Special_2].

TElectronicScrambler.name: Electronic Scrambler
TElectronicScrambler.desc: A small piece of electronic is enough to scramble most of radio communication to a drone making it a lot harder to pilot.

line0.desc: Once per combat, a mechanical target is [TElectronicScrambler_Debuff] until the end of combat (x::target_stacking_limit:: max): ::target_effects_list::

TElectronicScrambler_Debuff.name: Scrambled
TElectronicScrambler_Debuff.desc: This mechanical unit has been scrambled.

TMemoryImplant.name: Memory Implant
TMemoryImplant.desc: Memory is an aspect of humanity that could easily be improved with machines.

TDIYKit.name: DIY Kit
TDIYKit.desc: [!V_Soldier]s are used to taking care of their own needs, but they have to start with some basic resources.

TMultiParts.name: Multi-Purpose Parts
TMultiParts.desc: [!V_Elite]s often take care of the regular maintenance of drones on the battlefield, but they need the right parts to do it properly.

TMultiParts_Buff.name: Multi-Purpose Parts
TMultiParts_Buff.desc: This unit is properly maintained by a close [V_Elite].

TKrakenProtocols.name: Kraken Protocols
TKrakenProtocols.desc: Applying some of the [!A_Frigate] adaptive technology to the [!A_Drone] makes it more versatile on the field.

line2.desc: For each unit carried by the [!A_Drone], it gets: ::target_effects_list::

TSupportingField.name: Supporting Field
TSupportingField.desc: The [!A_Drone] makes its presence known with blasting sounds, emboldening [Atreides-adjective] soldiers in the vicinity.

line0.desc: As long as the [!A_Drone] is not full, non-mechanical [Atreides-shortname] base units at [Long_Range] gain (x::target_stacking_limit:: max): ::target_effects_list::

TSupportingField_Buff.name: Supporting Field
TSupportingField_Buff.desc: The Supporting Field of a nearby [A_Drone] emboldens this unit.

TEvasionBooster.name: Evasion Booster
TEvasionBooster.desc: An expensive but powerful engine can be the difference between life and death in an emergency.

TWeaponizedConfiguration.name: Weaponized Configuration
TWeaponizedConfiguration.desc: The [!A_Drone] can be reconfigured to assume a more active role in combat.

TOptmizedBedArrangement.name: Optimized Bed Arrangement
TOptmizedBedArrangement.desc: By carefully utilizing all space inside the [!A_Drone], it's possible to increase its capacity, but the energy cost is significant.

TMakersEffigy.name: Maker's Effigy
TMakersEffigy.desc: Faith in the Maker keeps the [Fremen] strong in adversity.

TEnhancedWeapons.name: Enhanced Weapons
TEnhancedWeapons.desc: Drone and turret weaponry is a question of balance between raw power and practicality. You can always equip them with a bigger gun, but you'll have to lose weight somewhere else.

TExperimentalWeapons.name: Experimental Weapons
TExperimentalWeapons.desc: With the proper equipment, the [H_Drone] can really strike a nerve in its opponent.

TTortureTools.name: Torture Tools
TTortureTools.desc: With the proper equipment, the [H_Drone] can really strike a nerve in its opponent.

TLongRifles.name: Long Rifles
TLongRifles.desc: Longer canons are enough to increase precision at long range, but it comes at the prize of a lower projectile velocity.

TLongCannons.name: Long Cannons
TLongCannons.desc: These long cannons increase the range of the drone, but also the size of their blind spot.

TUpperArmor.name: Upper Armor
TUpperArmor.desc: Focusing armour on critical points improves durability, but requires more maintenance.

TImprovedAlloy.name: Improved Alloy
TImprovedAlloy.desc: Costly alloys that absorb impacts instead of breaking can be a worthy investement for mechanical warfare.

TLightAlloys.name: Light Alloys
TLightAlloys.desc: Cheaply made drones are only slightly less resistant.

TOpticCamouflage.name: Optic Camouflage
TOpticCamouflage.desc: With a good amount of optical fibers and a big battery, anything can disappear.

TVirtualBlackBox.name: Virtual Black Box
TVirtualBlackBox.desc: Learning from what remains of a wreck is a difficult skill, that can be made easier by designing a drone for it.

TShockDampener.name: Shock Dampener
TShockDampener.desc: Looted artifacts of less sturdy composition could give us a lot of insight on the enemy if they survived the trip.

TMotivationalCashbox.name: Motivational Cashbox
TMotivationalCashbox.desc: When you're doing well, everyone should know and wealth should be shared, so that they're motivated to do even better.

line1.desc: When receiving [S_Drone_Buff], every ally unit at [Medium_Range] get ::target_effects2:: for ::value:: days (x::target_stacking_limit2:: max)

TMotivationalCashbox_Buff.name: Motivational Cashbox
TMotivationalCashbox_Buff.desc: This unit is motivated by greed induced by a nearby [S_Drone].

TShieldingStraightener.name: Shielding Straightener
TShieldingStraightener.desc: Most of the armor and gear you find on a battlefield is too damaged to use, but it's possible to fix it up just enough for one last time.

TShieldingStraightener_Buff.name: Makeshift Protection
TShieldingStraightener_Buff.desc: Most of the armor and gear you find on a battlefield is too damaged to use, but it's possible to fix it up just enough for one last time.

line0.desc: Ally ground Military Units in [Medium_Range] gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

TShieldingStraightener_Allies_Buff.name: Makeshift Protection
TShieldingStraightener_Allies_Buff.desc: This unit is using looted equipment from the [S_Drone].

TDistractingLights.name: Distracting Lights
TDistractingLights.desc: A mesmerizing light show can easily make anyone forget the rest of the world.

line1.desc: Enemy units targeting this unit receive ::s_percent_value:: damage

TDistractingLights_Debuff.name: Distracting Lights
TDistractingLights_Debuff.desc: This unit is distracted by their [E_Drone] target.

TMarchingColors.name: Marching Colors
TMarchingColors.desc: In a conditioned mind, the simple view of certain colors and shapes can incentivize a specific behavior.

TMarchingColors_Buff.name: Marching Colors
TMarchingColors_Buff.desc: This unit is marching under a [E_Drone].

TPropagandaMachine.name: Propaganda Machine
TPropagandaMachine.desc: There is no down time for the diligent salesman. It's always the right time to sell your product.

TPropagandaMachine_Debuff.name: Propaganda Machine
TPropagandaMachine_Debuff.desc: This unit is influenced by enemy propaganda.

TBigBanner.name: Big Banner
TBigBanner.desc: Sometimes, you just want to send a big message.

TMaterialPreProcessor.name: Material Pre-processor
TMaterialPreProcessor.desc: Identifying the target's weakness lets the [!V_Trooper] select the right weapons for the task.

line0.desc: For each point of [Armor] the target has, get ::s_percent:: [Power]

line1.desc: For each point of [Armor] the target has, get ::s_percent:: attack speed

THeavyShielding.name: Heavy Shielding
THeavyShielding.desc: A heavier frame and shielding resists shocks better.

TAnatomicalScanner.name: Anatomical Scanner
TAnatomicalScanner.desc: Organic entities generally have hidden weaknesses based on their evolved internal organization.

TSmartArmor.name: Deep Signals
TSmartArmor.desc: Encrypting strategic combat data in the electrostatic cloud around the [!V_Drone] enhances the fighting prowess of any drone at range.

line0.desc: Ally mechanical units at [Medium_Range] inflict ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

TSmartArmor_Buff.name: Deep Signals
TSmartArmor_Buff.desc: This unit receives combat data from a [V_Drone].

TSmartLens.name: Learning Transistors
TSmartLens.desc: Adaptative lens and custom data processors improve the extraction of useful knowledge from combat analysis.

TWarmMagnets.name: Strong Magnets
TWarmMagnets.desc: High-energy magnets improve the speed of railgun's projectiles even further.

TRepeaterNode.name: Repeater Node
TRepeaterNode.desc: A miniaturized version of the neural node can be integrated into bigger drones to increase the range of the network.

TDisruptiveField.name: Fractal Frequencies
TDisruptiveField.desc: By applying various fractal frequencies to the Holtzman Coil, its electrostatic field becomes even more lethal.

TDisruptiveField_Buff.name: Fractal Frequencies
TDisruptiveField_Buff.desc: The electrostatic effect generated by a nearby [V_Drone] is even more lethal than normal.

TDisruptiveField_Debuff.name: Disrupted
TDisruptiveField_Debuff.desc: This unit is in the disruptive field of a [V_Drone].

TFeedbackGate.name: Feedback Gate
TFeedbackGate.desc: Loose energy from the electrostatic field can be harnessed and fed back into the Holtzman Coil to improve its resistance.

TImprovedMedicine.name: Improved Medicine
TImprovedMedicine.desc: Better tools, and a larger selection of drugs and medicines tremendously increases the efficiency of [A_Drone]s.

line0.desc: Nearby ally non-mechanical units gain ::s_percent_value:: [Life] regeneration per day

TAnalysisTools.name: Analysis Tools
TAnalysisTools.desc: A drone replacing some of its weaponry with scopes and lenses will provide valuable [Intel] to its pilot.

TMountedExplosives.name: Mounted Explosives
TMountedExplosives.desc: Lining the inside of a drone with incendiary bombs that trigger on death is an easy way to bring fear to the enemy.

line0.desc: Upon death, deals high damage in a [Melee_Effect]
Ignores half of the enemy armor

TSkyFacade.name: Sky Facade
TSkyFacade.desc: Painting the bottom of an aircraft in blue is a simple way to make it disappear.

TListeningDevices_Altar.name: Wreck Harness
TListeningDevices_Altar.desc: Catching the pieces and bits as they fall is a matter of great skill.

line0.desc: Killing enemy flying units at [Long_Range] gives ::s_percent_value:: [Scraps]

line1.desc: Other ally Military Units at [Melee_Strict] gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line0.desc: Increases the amount of [Scraps] gained on kills by ::percent_value::

THeavyArmor_Altar.name: Makeshift Workshop
THeavyArmor_Altar.desc: Keeping a well-stocked reserve of scrap metal and tools on board allows for a speedy recovery on the go.

TWindTraps_Altar.name: Symbol of Freedom
TWindTraps_Altar.desc: A flying representation of the [Fremen-shortname]'s hopes for a freed Arrakis.

line1.desc: Gain ::value:: [Authority] when liberating a [!Village] in the region

TAdditionalSails_Altar.name: Storm Sails
TAdditionalSails_Altar.desc: Going with the flow instead of fighting it is the key to surviving the storms of Arrakis.

TReconStations_Altar.name: Recon Stations
TReconStations_Altar.desc: With a rotating crew of lookouts, equipped with powerful spyglasses, it's easy to survey a large territory from the sky.

TSandCloud_Altar.name: Sand Cloud
TSandCloud_Altar.desc: In the desert, any strong wind immediatly raises a large murky cloud of sand.

line0.desc: Ground ally Military Units at [Long_Range] get [Sneak_Trait]

TFreedomSymbol_Altar.name: Supply Holds
TFreedomSymbol_Altar.desc: A large hold lets the [!F_Frigate] bring supplies directly to the front.

line0.desc: Ally Military Units at [Long_Range] regain [Supply] outside combat

Storm_Village.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Village.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

line10.desc: Cannot use any ability on the village

Storm_Army.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Army.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Ship.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Harvester.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Village_Reduced.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.
[FremenCommand] let you pass the storm unharmed.

Storm_Ship_Reduced.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Ship_Reduced.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Frigate_Reduced.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Frigate_Reduced.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Ornithopter_Reduced.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Ornithopter_Reduced.desc: Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.

Storm_Harvester_Reduced.name: Sandstorm
Storm_Harvester_Reduced.desc:
Wind can blow at seven hundred kilometers an hour inside Arrakis' Sandstorm, ripping anything in its path.
[FremenCommand] let you pass the storm unharmed.

line1.desc: Ignores half of the enemy armor

Main_BaseTrait.name: Main Base
Main_BaseTrait.desc: Most major factions house their main base of operations in an important city.

line1.desc: Ignores half of the enemy armor

line0.desc: Ignores half of the enemy armor

MaintenanceCenter_Trait.name: Organized Supply
MaintenanceCenter_Trait.desc: A nearby [MaintenanceCenter] reduces the [Upkeep] of buildings in this [!Village].

MonitoringStation_Trait.name: Under Surveillance
MonitoringStation_Trait.desc: A nearby [MonitoringStation] increases the chances to detect enemy operations in this [!Village].

MilitaryBase_Trait.name: Military Base Support
MilitaryBase_Trait.desc: A nearby [MilitaryBase] increases the coordination of Military Units.

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: to ally Military Units in the Region and its neighbors (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

Tethered.name: Tethered
Tethered.desc: This drone benefits from the strategic analysis of [Vernius-adjective] Nodal Network.

NotTethered.name: Untethered
NotTethered.desc: This drone is too far away from [Vernius-adjective] Nodal Network.

line0.desc: Go in a region neighboring a node of the [Vernius_ConnectedVillage] to become [Tethered]

Furnace_Trait.name: Active Furnace
Furnace_Trait.desc: A nearby [ExperimentalAlloyFurnace] increases the production of [!Economy] [!Building_Village]s in this [!Village].

Furnace_Trait_Harvester.name: Active Furnace
Furnace_Trait_Harvester.desc: A nearby [ExperimentalAlloyFurnace_Fremen] increases the production of this [F_Harvester].

Furnace_Trait_Harvester_Vernius.name: Active Furnace
Furnace_Trait_Harvester_Vernius.desc: A nearby [ExperimentalAlloyFurnace] increases the production of this [V_Harvester].

SmugglingCenter_Trait.name: Spice Smuggling
SmugglingCenter_Trait.desc: Spice smuggling is running rampant in this village

SmugglingCenter_FakeTrait.name: Spice Smuggling
SmugglingCenter_FakeTrait.desc: Spice smuggling is running rampant in this village

AtreidesFremenEmbassy_Trait.name: Concord Chamber
AtreidesFremenEmbassy_Trait.desc: A nearby [AtreidesFremenEmbassy] helps bettering relationship with this [!Sietch].

AtreidesFremenEmbassy_AlliedTrait.name: Concord Chamber
AtreidesFremenEmbassy_AlliedTrait.desc: A nearby [AtreidesFremenEmbassy] helps bettering relationship with this [!Sietch].

T_AnalysisCenter.name: Analysis Center
T_AnalysisCenter.desc: An [AnalysisCenter] in the region prevents all operations.

Main_Museum_Trait.name: Museum of Unbound Arts
Main_Museum_Trait.desc: The creative process is a paradoxical one. It thrives on the tension between the constrained and the free. A truly radical museum would cage only the most extreme and unrestrained pieces of art.

Merchants.name: Bartering Customs
Merchants.desc: A strong bartering culture attracts a lot of traders and shoppers.

Contacts.name: Connections
Contacts.desc: Knowing the right person is the first step to making a new friend.

DataBrokers.name: Data Brokers
DataBrokers.desc: Exchange of information can be as lucrative as any other trade.

DesertMiners.name: Desert Miners
DesertMiners.desc: Artisanal Plascrete is hard to make, but an essential resource for many folks on Arrakis.

FormerSmugglers.name: Former Smugglers
FormerSmugglers.desc: Some old smugglers elected to retire and settle in this village, each with talents that could prove highly beneficial for those who know how to use them...

FormerSoldiers.name: Former Soldiers
FormerSoldiers.desc: Some residents have deserted their homes to flee the horrors of war and isolate themselves in the desert. But war is always around the corner...

GoodHandymen.name: Handymen
GoodHandymen.desc: If everyone helps a little, mountains can become molehills.

IngeniousMind.name: Ingenious Mind
IngeniousMind.desc: Early worm catches the bird, and the whole harvester with it. To make a profit on Arrakis, you want to be even earlier than that.

IntersectingData.name: Analysts
IntersectingData.desc: Aggregating multiple datasets reveals surprising insights.

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Intel] production when the village has at least one [!Building_Village] of each type

SupplyChains.name: Local Sourcing
SupplyChains.desc: When everything can be done locally, the village is more resilient to crises.

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Solari] production when the village has at least one [!Building_Village] of each type

Versatile.name: Versatile
Versatile.desc: Most crafts are not easily compartimentalized. Doing a bit of everything can build unexpected bridges between unlikely professions.

line0.desc: ::s_percent_value:: resource production when the village has at least one [!Building_Village] of each type

Plunderers.name: Plunderers
Plunderers.desc: Turning might into profit requires skills and cold pragmatism.

ScavengerNetwork.name: Scavenger Network
ScavengerNetwork.desc: There's no reason to leave the possessions of the dead to the desert.

line0.desc: Gain ::value:: [Solari] per enemy unit dying in ally territory

Scholarly.name: Scholarly
Scholarly.desc: A passion for knowledge is your best asset in many situations.

FussyPeople.name: Strong-willed
FussyPeople.desc: Good fighters often come from stubborn people.

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Manpower] production when the village has at least one [!Building_Village] of each type

ArrakisTrainers.name: Way of the Desert
ArrakisTrainers.desc: A good teacher will bring a good student to mastery of desert tactics.

HardWorkers.name: Hardworkers
HardWorkers.desc: Love to work, and you'll never be out of things to do.

WellDiggers.name: Well Diggers
WellDiggers.desc: Deep under the sand lie small pockets of water that a good drowser can sometimes find.

StrongNetwork.name: Strong Network
StrongNetwork.desc: Many gossiping mouths move secrets faster than a horse.

GlassSculptors.name: Glass Sculptors
GlassSculptors.desc: Glass sculpting is not only an artistic venture. It's also used in the building process of many high-quality instruments.

WaterTraders.name: Water Traders
WaterTraders.desc: Even in the middle of the desert, some people would rather have money in the bank than water in their belly.

Industrious.name: Industrious
Industrious.desc: Old factory towns always keep a certain feel to them. Even after years, it never fully goes away, like it's just waiting for a reopening.

Scientists.name: Scientists
Scientists.desc: Care for truth and knowledge does not always make you a better man, but it does make you a better scientist.

SecretHolders.name: Secret Holders
SecretHolders.desc: A secret can beat the best of weapons, as long as you don't reveal it.

YouthfullEargerness.name: Youthful Eagerness
YouthfullEargerness.desc: Young people always want to leave their home and discover the world, seeking adventure. So few ever come back.

Devastated.name: Devastated
Devastated.desc: This village is in shambles. Its productions are at rock bottom and no further action can be taken there for a while.

line0.desc: Cannot be targeted by an attack

Abandonned.name: Abandoned
Abandonned.desc: This [!Village] has been abandoned by its previous owner.

line0.desc: Cannot be targeted by an attack

DevastatedSietch.name: Devastated
DevastatedSietch.desc: This [Sietch] is in shambles. Raids are stopped and no further action can be taken there for a while.

line0.desc: Cannot be targeted by an attack

Pillaged.name: Hostile
Pillaged.desc: This village was previously pillaged by your faction and it will be harder to regain their trust.

line0.desc: Cannot be targeted by an attack

Freed.name: Freed by your Faction
Freed.desc: This village has been liberated by your Faction. No offensive action can be taken with it.

line0.desc: This Village cannot be targeted by an attack from your Faction

FreedforAll.name: Just Freed
FreedforAll.desc: This village has been liberated. No offensive action can be taken against it.

line0.desc: Cannot be targeted by an attack.

LSNoAlliance.name: Inaccessible
LSNoAlliance.desc: The associated [Sietch] is no longer allied, you can't access its buildings until it is allied again.

WeakenedStructure.name: Architectural Surveys
WeakenedStructure.desc: During surveys, new buildings are cheaper to build but the structure is weakened. It cannot attack and is more fragile.

StabilityLow.name: Unrest
StabilityLow.desc: This Village suffers from unrest. You need more [Water] or [Authority] to avoid rebellion.

StabilityLow_Forced.name: Unrest
StabilityLow_Forced.desc: Because of Mother Ramallo's [RamalloPassive] and your proximity with the [Fremen], this Village suffers from unrest. It will rebel soon.

StabilityCritical.name: Rebellion
StabilityCritical.desc: This Village has rebelled. You need to send troops to fight the rebels.

RenegadeControl.name: Renegade Control
RenegadeControl.desc: This Village is controlled by [Renegades] and cannot be attacked directly, a nearby [RenegadeBase] is overseeing activities

line0.desc: This [Village] cannot be targeted by an attack until the nearby [RenegadeBase] is destroyed

HostileVillage.name: Hostile Village
HostileVillage.desc: This village's inhabitants are fearful of foreigners and won't accept your rule without a fight.

FriendlyVillage.name: Friendly Village
FriendlyVillage.desc: This Village tends to be friendly to outsiders.

InstillFear.name: Instill Fear
InstillFear.desc: This village has fear instilled deep into it.

RecentPurge.name: Recent Investigation
RecentPurge.desc: After a recent investigation in the [!Village], we can guarantee there is no threatening presence there.

line0.desc: [!Village]s with at least one [Building_Village] of each type gain: ::target_effects_list::
Rebellions are twice as numerous and [Liberate] their [!Village]

T_LingarExtension.name: Lingar Bewt's Investement
T_LingarExtension.desc: [Lingar] has installed his [Water] empire in this [!Village].

line0.desc: Gain ::value:: [Solari] per unit dying in the region
Gain ::value:: [Influence] if the host support a [Bounty]

T_BeaconNetworks.name: Early Threat Detection
T_BeaconNetworks.desc: A [MBBeaconNetwork] protects ally troop in the region.

SietchHostile.name: Hostile Sietch
SietchHostile.desc: This [Sietch] will send raids against surrounding Villages and Harvesters.

ArrakisHeroes.name: Seasoned Combat Trainers
ArrakisHeroes.desc: This [Sietch] has better elite troops, making it a powerful local player.

TrainingGrounds.name: Training Grounds
TrainingGrounds.desc: Veteran fighters can help make your most promising troops even more efficient.

ScoutsoftheSecretPaths.name: Scouts of the Secret Paths
ScoutsoftheSecretPaths.desc: Knowing the field is already half the battle.

ArrakisHarvesters.name: Arrakis Harvesters
ArrakisHarvesters.desc: This [Sietch] often patrol the desert, in search of the dead's lost valuables.

line0.desc: Gain ::percent_value:: of the power of Military Units that die in controlled territory as [Solari]

HeraldsoftheRevolution.name: Heralds of the Revolution
HeraldsoftheRevolution.desc: A strong, respected [Sietch] with highly trained troops.

Populous.name: Arrakis Heart
Populous.desc: The hearts of Arrakis inhabitants are enthralled by a few Landmarks across the land.

CommercialHub.name: Commercial Hub
CommercialHub.desc: This [Sietch] is a trading hub on Arrakis, providing many trading benefits to their friends.

HelpingHand.name: Helping Hand
HelpingHand.desc: This [Sietch] works hand in hand with local villagers, improving production.

line0.desc: All the faction [!Village] productions are increased by ::s_percent_value::.

ToolMakers.name: Tool Makers
ToolMakers.desc: Buildings are easier to maintain thanks to appropriate tools and spare parts.

line0.desc: All [!Building_Village] [!Upkeep]s of the faction is reduced by ::percent::

ArrakisCollectors.name: Arrakis Collectors
ArrakisCollectors.desc: Trinkets and curios from all over the world cannot be obtained without a good diplomatic network.

FremenAgents.name: Fremen Agents
FremenAgents.desc: This [Sietch] has many contacts and its own Agents spread out in the area.

FremenScientists.name: Fremen Scientists
FremenScientists.desc: This [Sietch] develops its own specialist technologies.

FremenBrotherhood.name: Fremen Brotherhood
FremenBrotherhood.desc: An exchange of valuable men is a traditionnal way to seal an alliance in the Fremen society.

T_FremenNegotiator.name: Fremen Negotiator
T_FremenNegotiator.desc: Negotiations with the local population yields better trade rates.

T_SpiceSeekers.name: Spice Seekers
T_SpiceSeekers.desc: Experts in finding fresh spice fields are helping the locals to increase their [Spice] production.

EquatorRegion.name: Equatorial Region
EquatorRegion.desc: Strong Equatorial winds enter this region, increasing the [Wind] inside.

line0.desc: Allows for the construction of a [$my(refinery)] in the local Village to produce [Spice].
Allows for the construction of [FuelCellFactory]s and [Fremen] [SandCaches]

R_TheDesolation.name: [TheDesolation]
R_TheDesolation.desc: This harsh desert area is even more dangerous and unwelcoming than the rest of the planet. Life here simply cannot be sustained.

R_Pole.name: Polar Sink
R_Pole.desc: The north pole of Arrakis is the only place where water can be found in significant quantities, although in frozen form.

R_ShieldWall.name: Shield Wall
R_ShieldWall.desc: The Shield Wall is a natural barrier that protects the surrounding land from [Sandstorm], making it one of the safest places on Arrakis

R_MountIdaho.name: Mount Idaho
R_MountIdaho.desc: One of the highest points on the planet, Mount Idaho is rich in hard minerals.

R_ImperialBasin.name: Imperial Basin
R_ImperialBasin.desc: The Imperial Basin is a Region protected from [Sandworm] thanks to its natural features. It is also one of the most populated in the planet.

R_Volcano.name: Great Volcano
R_Volcano.desc: Abundant sulfides and hydrogen greatly facilitate the production of Fuel Cells in this area.

line0.desc: Allows for the construction of [FuelCellFactory] and [Fremen] [SandCaches]

R_MoonDewVale.name: Moon Dew Vale
R_MoonDewVale.desc: This hidden valley is relatively protected from high temperatures and wind, making it as much of a safe harbor as your can find on Arrakis for local wildlife.

R_ObservatoryM.name: Observatory Mountain
R_ObservatoryM.desc: Standing at 8110 meters, Observatory Mountain provides a commanding view on the surrounding area.

line3.desc: Allows for the construction of [DataCenter] and [ListeningPost]

R_RichMountain.name: Well of Riches
R_RichMountain.desc: This pit contain many rare elements that could make a House very wealthy.

R_WhiteRift.name: White Rift
R_WhiteRift.desc: The Rift contains precious materials found only on Arrakis. They have a great value when sold offworld.

R_AcidLake.name: Acid Lakes
R_AcidLake.desc: A very dangerous and inhospitable area, but also a great boon for research.

R_AcidLake_Trait.name: Acid Lakes
R_AcidLake_Trait.desc: A very dangerous and inhospitable area, but also a great boon for research.

R_CrescentRidge.name: Crescent Ridge
R_CrescentRidge.desc: The geology of this region accelerates and gives a particular force to the winds.

R_WormNest.name: Worm Nest
R_WormNest.desc: The high activity of [Sandworm] in this region makes it very difficult to practice, but its spice field is especially prolific.

R_SpaceWreck.name: Space Wreck
R_SpaceWreck.desc: A frigate from old times, probably fallen centuries ago, has started emerging from the sand in this region.

R_SandFall.name: Sand Fall
R_SandFall.desc: The combination of an unusual updraft and the sudden edge of a cliff gives this region a beautiful and constant cascade of sand.

line0.desc: Minor Houses will often favor you on positive resolutions

line1.desc: Minor Houses will never vote for you on negative resolutions

Q_StealUnit_Atreides.name: Atreides Technology Blueprint
Q_StealUnit_Atreides.desc: Help from the Bene Tleilax enabled your engineers to replicate complex technology from [Atreides-longname].

Q_StealUnit_Harkonnen.desc: Help from the Bene Tleilax enabled your engineers to replicate complex technology from [Harkonnen-longname].

Q_StealUnit_Corrino.desc: Help from the Bene Tleilax enabled your engineers to replicate complex technology from [Corrino-longname].

TEcazPride.name: Garden Resort
TEcazPride.desc: [Ecaz-longname] is famous for its vegetalized resorts. Such an expansive facility contrasting with the raw natural beauty of Arrakis is sure to be a crowd-pleaser.

TLeaveOrder.desc: The Landsraad cannot force you to remove your troops, but it can fine you for not complying.

TGearSabotage.name: Defense Sabotage

TGearSabotage_MainBase.desc: The most effective defensive weapons do not matter if your enemy cannot use them.

TSupplyCaches.name: Supply Caches
TSupplyCaches.desc: There are only few ways to get what you need in the middle of the desert. The easiest one is to have it ready and set up in the right place, long in advance.

TSupplyCaches_Armies.name: Supply Caches
TSupplyCaches_Armies.desc: There are only few ways to get what you need in the middle of the desert. The easiest one is to have it ready and set up in the right place, long in advance.

THiddenThumpers.desc: Fremen are masters at using Shai-Hulud for transport. A secret technique lets them influence the movement of sandworms on the whole planet, facilitating wormriding.

TConsolidation.desc: The constant redeployment of the Imperial army on various fronts of the Imperium has made them incredibly resistant. Through unusual formations and well-timed restocking, they can enhance this ability even further.

TPoisonReserves.name: Poisoned Reserves

TInterdictionZone.desc: To be effective, a no-fly zone has to be enforced by a mix of political and legal means, as well as military support often given from space.

TLivePerformance_Effect.desc: A good show provokes admiration, but a bad one invites mockery.

TEmpiricalData_Fake.desc: Progress is a constant back and forth between theoretical breakthrough and practical issues. Collecting data from real life fights on the surface of Arrakis informs current researches.

TAdministrativeBurden_MainBase.desc: By liberal use of red tape and obfuscation, a colonial administration can be almost completely immobilised, at least for a while.

THiddenBackdoor.name: Hidden Backdoor
THiddenBackdoor.desc: A tiny security default, hidden deep within the mechanical engineering of any machine built by the House, can be activated at any moment to take control. There shall be no witness to such an event left alive, for it would ruin Ix reputation.

ElaccaFog.desc: The Elacca drug from Ecaz forests is used in gladiator shows to inhibit self-preservation. During war time, it can be deployed as a thick fog to get the same effect.

Traitor.name: Traitor
Traitor.desc: You have recently taken actions that decreased a diplomatic status between you and another faction. Punitive actions have been taken against your faction, but your troops benefit from the effect of surprise.

Traitor_Ecaz.name: Traitor
Traitor_Ecaz.desc: You have recently taken actions that decreased a diplomatic status between you and another faction. Punitive actions have been taken against your faction.

Betrayed.name: Betrayed
Betrayed.desc: You have recently been betrayed by another faction. Their troops benefit from the effect of surprise against you.

Betrayed_Ecaz.name: Betrayed
