Rule_NoGovernor.name: [DuneGovernor] is not voted on in the [Landsraad]

line0.desc: [DuneGovernor] will not be voted on in the [Landsraad]

Game_FastStart.name: Quick Start
Game_FastStart.desc: Quick Start has been turned on in the game settings.

Main_AdministrativeHall.texts.name: Administrative Hall
Main_AdministrativeHall.texts.desc: The city hall centralizes the administrative formalities and acts as a nexus for your civic and political power.
Main_AdministrativeHall.texts.plural.name: Administrative Halls

Main_RecyclingVats.texts.name: Recycling Vats
Main_RecyclingVats.texts.desc: A complex but streamlined system of used water collection gathers the precious fluids to several recycling stations called "clear nodes", and then reinjects it as clean water into the system.
Main_RecyclingVats.texts.plural.name: Recycling Vats

Main_RecyclingVats_Fremen.texts.name: Recycling Vats
Main_RecyclingVats_Fremen.texts.desc: A complex but streamlined system of used water collection gathers the precious fluids to several recycling stations called "clear nodes", and then reinjects it as clean water into the system.
Main_RecyclingVats_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Recycling Vats

Main_ChoamBranch.texts.name: CHOAM branch
Main_ChoamBranch.texts.desc: Hosting a CHOAM branch is not mandatory in any way, but a wise leader will quickly find it quite advantageous, as it is sure to give them an edge in their economic endeavors.
Main_ChoamBranch.texts.plural.name: CHOAM branches

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: when the base exchange rate is at least ::value::

Main_HarvesterWorks.texts.name: Harvester Works
Main_HarvesterWorks.texts.desc: This structure trains technical harvesting crews and gives them tools to improve their work. Specialists of spice collection help optimize the process from start to finish.
Main_HarvesterWorks.texts.plural.name: Harvester Works

Main_SpiceLaboratory.texts.name: Spice Laboratory
Main_SpiceLaboratory.texts.desc: [Spice] has some unusual properties that deserve to be studied in a lab, and where else to put such a facility than right here, on Arrakis. Maybe someday a replacement can be found for the melange.
Main_SpiceLaboratory.texts.plural.name: Spice Laboratories

Main_MasonGuild.texts.name: Mason Guild
Main_MasonGuild.texts.desc: The many dangers of Arrakis makes hosting a Mason Guild an indisputable asset for anyone looking to build sizeable infrastructure on the planet
Main_MasonGuild.texts.plural.name: Mason Guilds

Main_RecruitCenter.texts.name: Recruitment Center
Main_RecruitCenter.texts.desc: This structure streamlines the process of enrollment for military units as well as make recruitment easier, ultimately bringing in more manpower to your forces.
Main_RecruitCenter.texts.plural.name: Recruitment Centers

Main_Barracks.texts.name: Barracks
Main_Barracks.texts.desc: Allows your military forces to recover and organize more effectively by giving them a place to fall back to and store their equipment.
Main_Barracks.texts.plural.name: Barracks

Main_FusionPlant.texts.name: Fusion Plant
Main_FusionPlant.texts.desc: While the usage of atomic weapons is forbidden by the Great Convention, civilian nuclear physics is widely used by the Great House for cheap efficient energy production. What they do with that energy is nobody's business.
Main_FusionPlant.texts.plural.name: Fusion Plants

Main_MilitaryAcademy.texts.name: Military Academy
Main_MilitaryAcademy.texts.desc: The Academy is a huge complex equipped with all the modern arsenal. Multiple classes of cadets can take courses in parallel and the concentration of pedagogical knowledge insures a constant stream of new soldiers.
Main_MilitaryAcademy.texts.plural.name: Military Academies

Main_Command.texts.name: Command Post
Main_Command.texts.desc: Optimizes logistics for your armies and improves communication down the chain of command, ultimately making your forces more efficient and dangerous.
Main_Command.texts.plural.name: Command Posts

Main_ResearchCenter.texts.name: Research Center
Main_ResearchCenter.texts.desc: Scientia potentia est: knowledge is power. The research center hosts the best scientists and gives them the means of making breakthroughs.
Main_ResearchCenter.texts.plural.name: Research Centers

line1.desc: ::s_percent_value:: [Hegemony] gain from fulfilling a Spice Contract

Main_Embassy.texts.name: Embassy
Main_Embassy.texts.desc: An important node of your power, where diplomats and other powerful people exchange information or work on political agreements.
Main_Embassy.texts.plural.name: Embassies

Main_Embassy_Fremen.texts.name: Embassy
Main_Embassy_Fremen.texts.desc: An important node of your power, where diplomats and other powerful people exchange information or work on political agreements.
Main_Embassy_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Embassies

Main_Bazaar.texts.name: Bazaar
Main_Bazaar.texts.desc: You can find a little bit of everything in a busy Bazaar, making any neighborhood more vibrant and dynamic.
Main_Bazaar.texts.plural.name: Bazaar

Main_Temple.texts.name: Al-Gaib Temple
Main_Temple.texts.desc: The temple draws the faithful, strengthening their will to serve for the good of the Fremen.
Main_Temple.texts.plural.name: Al-Gaib Temples

Main_LandsraadQuarters.texts.name: Landsraad Quarters
Main_LandsraadQuarters.texts.desc: A place to host dignitaries and important people during their time in your capital is an essential key to any political play in the Landsraad.
Main_LandsraadQuarters.texts.plural.name: Landsraad Quarters

Main_IntelAgency.texts.name: Intelligence Agency
Main_IntelAgency.texts.desc: The battle for information is best fought with the proper structures, and this agency contains everything you need to conduct proper espionage and counter-intelligence missions.
Main_IntelAgency.texts.plural.name: Intelligence Agencies

Main_CouncilChamber.texts.name: Council Chamber
Main_CouncilChamber.texts.desc: The best way to have an influence over the Landsraad is to make sure you are always in the midst of it, ever present and seemingly indispensable.
Main_CouncilChamber.texts.plural.name: Council Chambers

line0.desc: ::us_percent:: of [CouncilVote]s and [Influence] spent on a resolution choice that failed are reimbursed as [Influence]

Main_InterrogationCenter.texts.name: Interrogation Center
Main_InterrogationCenter.texts.desc: Information must flow. More often than not, it must be extracted from human beings, like sap is from a tree. Most abhor the method, but the Harkonnens will never shy away from a proven tool.
Main_InterrogationCenter.texts.plural.name: Interrogation Center

Main_BlackMarketBranch.texts.name: Black Market Branch
Main_BlackMarketBranch.texts.desc: Money is not the only thing that can be earned from commercial exchanges, especially when said transactions are on the verge of legality.
Main_BlackMarketBranch.texts.plural.name: Black Market Branches

Main_Monument.texts.name: Emperor Monument
Main_Monument.texts.desc: It is important to remind everyone of their position within the faufreluches, and their duties towards the Padishah Emperor. This monument symbolizes the unity of the Imperium and the legitimacy of its ruler.
Main_Monument.texts.plural.name: Emperor Monuments

Main_MuseumOfUnboundArts.texts.name: Museum of Unbound Arts
Main_MuseumOfUnboundArts.texts.desc: The creative process is a paradoxical one. It thrives on the tension between the constrained and the free. A truly radical museum would cage only the most extreme and unrestrained pieces of art.
Main_MuseumOfUnboundArts.texts.plural.name: Museums of Unbound Arts

line0.desc: Removes limit on number of [!Masterpiece]s per [!Village]

Main_NeuralCore.texts.name: Neural Core
Main_NeuralCore.texts.desc: The Nodal Network is fundamentally centralized on the [IxianCore]. A strong Neural Core, made of data and processing centers supported by specialized algorithms, reinforce the whole network.
Main_NeuralCore.texts.plural.name: Neural Cores

Refinery.texts.name: Refinery
Refinery.texts.desc: Refining is a second step to [Spice] harvesting. It allows the condensation of the pure and precious substance by extracting trace quantities out of large masses of rocks and sand.
Refinery.texts.plural.name: Refineries

line0.desc: Allows the deployment of a [!$my(Harvester)] to the nearest [SpiceArea]

SpiceSilos.texts.name: Spice Silos
SpiceSilos.texts.desc: When the [!Refinery] completes the refining process, it automatically distributes the [Spice] evenly among the silos.
SpiceSilos.texts.plural.name: Spice Silos

line0.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line1.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line2.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line3.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line4.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line5.desc: ::target_effects:: to ally [V_Harvester]s in the Region and its neighbors (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

SmugglingCenter.texts.name: Trafficking Station
SmugglingCenter.texts.desc: [Spice] is especially volatile during the refinery process. So much is lost, scattered into the atmosphere. Would anyone notice if a little bit more went missing?
SmugglingCenter.texts.plural.name: Trafficking Stations

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: to neighboring Regions of any owner

line2.desc: Gain ::percent_value:: of neighboring Region's [Spice] production as [Solari]

PlascreteFactory.texts.name: Plascrete Factory
PlascreteFactory.texts.desc: [Plascrete] is a hard material to come by, and a dedicated factory is still necessary for its production.
PlascreteFactory.texts.plural.name: Plascrete Factories

MaintenanceCenter.texts.name: Maintenance Center
MaintenanceCenter.texts.desc: Centralizes supplies for all buildings but also streamlines their logistics and uses, making upkeep easier and more efficient.
MaintenanceCenter.texts.plural.name: Maintenance Centers

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: in ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

Marketplace.texts.name: Wholesale Market
Marketplace.texts.desc: While [Spice] and [Water] are the most important resources on Arrakis, there is always money to be made with less glamorous wares.
Marketplace.texts.plural.name: Wholesale Markets

ProcessingPlant.texts.name: Processing Plant
ProcessingPlant.texts.desc: The excavator ultimately generates [Solari]s by extracting [PreciousMetalsArea] from the ground.
ProcessingPlant.texts.plural.name: Processing Plants

DewCollector.texts.name: Dew Collector
DewCollector.texts.desc: Collect the morning dew to produce a small amount of clean [Water].
DewCollector.texts.plural.name: Dew Collectors

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Water] per level of wind strength in the Region

WindTrap.texts.name: Windtrap
WindTrap.texts.desc: Captures humidity from the air and produces a small amount of clean [Water] out of it.
WindTrap.texts.plural.name: Windtraps

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Water] per level of wind strength in the Region

WaterExtractor.texts.name: Water Extractor
WaterExtractor.texts.desc: Gathers ice, melts it and filters it to produce clean [Water] in large quantities.
WaterExtractor.texts.plural.name: Water Extractors

ExperimentalAlloyFurnace.texts.name: Experimental Furnace
ExperimentalAlloyFurnace.texts.desc: Under certain pressure and temperature conditions, regular mineral can be turned into exotic and valuable alloys.
ExperimentalAlloyFurnace.texts.plural.name: Experimental Furnaces

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: in ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

ExperimentalAlloyFurnace_Fremen.texts.name: Experimental Furnace
ExperimentalAlloyFurnace_Fremen.texts.desc: Under certain pressure and temperature conditions, regular mineral can be turned into exotic and valuable alloys.
ExperimentalAlloyFurnace_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Experimental Furnaces

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: in ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

RecruitmentOffice.texts.name: Recruitment Office
RecruitmentOffice.texts.desc: Recruiting locally is both cheap and efficient for your crews and armies. Knowledge of the desert often makes all the difference.
RecruitmentOffice.texts.plural.name: Recruitment Offices

FuelCellFactory.texts.name: Fuel cell Factory
FuelCellFactory.texts.desc: This building, dedicated to the production of [FuelCell]s, optimizes the process and allows for better industrial productivity.
FuelCellFactory.texts.plural.name: Fuel cell Factories

MissileBattery.texts.name: Missile Battery
MissileBattery.texts.desc: A well-placed [!MissileBattery] can make a big difference in an attack's outcome. An efficiency that also makes it a good deterrent.
MissileBattery.texts.plural.name: Missile Batteries

line0.desc: Automatically attacks enemy units within your territory

MilitaryBase.texts.name: Military Base
MilitaryBase.texts.desc: The [!MilitaryBase] allows for better preparedness for your troops and your militia, allowing for easier defense of your controlled Regions.
MilitaryBase.texts.plural.name: Military Bases

Airfield.texts.name: Airfield
Airfield.texts.desc: A strong network of [!Airfield]s is an efficient way to maintain control over your territory or to organize surprise attacks on your enemies.
Airfield.texts.plural.name: Airfields

line0.desc: Ground Military Units can embark or disembark from [Shuttle]s within the [!Airfield]'s range

line1.desc: Allows placing the Rally Point within the [!Airfield]'s range

SandCaches.texts.name: Ceremonial Caves
SandCaches.texts.desc: In deep caves, Fremen have their [Spice] orgy, a secret ritual communion fueled by powerful narcotics.
SandCaches.texts.plural.name: Ceremonial Caves

OppressionHeadquarter.texts.name: Office of Order
OppressionHeadquarter.texts.desc: The key to loyalty is convincing your guard dogs they are above the common man, living embodiments of the natural order of things.
OppressionHeadquarter.texts.plural.name: Office of Order

MilitaryFactory.texts.name: Military Factory
MilitaryFactory.texts.desc: Serialization of ammunition and aiming accessories improves the efficiency of combat systems.
MilitaryFactory.texts.plural.name: Military Factories

line0.desc: Increases damage inflicted by military units by ::us_percent_value::

MilitaryFactory_Fremen.texts.name: Military Factory
MilitaryFactory_Fremen.texts.desc: Serialization of ammunition and aiming accessories improves the efficiency of combat systems.
MilitaryFactory_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Military Factories

line0.desc: Increases damage inflicted by military units by ::us_percent_value::

ShaiHuludTemple.texts.name: Shai-hulud Temple
ShaiHuludTemple.texts.desc: The guidance of Shai-Hulud strengthens the will of the people.
ShaiHuludTemple.texts.plural.name: Shai-hulud Temples

NuclearSilo.texts.name: Nuclear Silo
NuclearSilo.texts.desc: The use of nuclear weapons against humans is forbidden by the Great Convention. There is no greater crime recognized by [Landsraad-longname].
NuclearSilo.texts.plural.name: Nuclear Silos

line0.desc: Allows for the preparation and launch of [NuclearHead]s

ResearchHub.texts.name: Research Hub
ResearchHub.texts.desc: A provincial lab might find more about life on Arrakis than what we have in the big cities.
ResearchHub.texts.plural.name: Research Hubs

DataCenter.texts.name: Data Center
DataCenter.texts.desc: Sometimes, the best way to spy on your enemies is to stay close to them. This building was made exactly for that purpose.
DataCenter.texts.plural.name: Data Centers

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Intel] production, when neighboring an enemy Region

ListeningPost.texts.name: Listening Post
ListeningPost.texts.desc: Intercepting and listening to political discussions is often the best way to counter opponents.
ListeningPost.texts.plural.name: Listening Posts

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Influence] production, when neighboring an enemy Region

InvestmentOffice.texts.name: Investment Office
InvestmentOffice.texts.desc: Investing in the local infrastructure can bring great rewards.
InvestmentOffice.texts.plural.name: Investment Offices

line0.desc: Effects of [!SpecificityVillage] are applied ::value:: more time

CraftsWorkshop.texts.name: Crafts Workshop
CraftsWorkshop.texts.desc: Kull Wahad! High-quality craftsmanship can fetch a very high price, especially with offworlders.
CraftsWorkshop.texts.plural.name: Crafts Workshops

MonitoringStation.texts.name: Monitoring Station
MonitoringStation.texts.desc: A large radar array and careful monitoring of every signal is the only way to avoid total infiltration by foreign forces.
MonitoringStation.texts.plural.name: Monitoring Stations

line1.desc: Ally [!Village]s in the Region and its neighbors gain [MonitoringStation_Trait] (x::target_stacking_limit:: max): ::target_effects_list::

AtreidesFremenEmbassy.texts.name: Concord Chamber
AtreidesFremenEmbassy.texts.desc: Long lasting alliances are built on small, practical actions. A local presence helps climb these small steps, day after day.
AtreidesFremenEmbassy.texts.plural.name: Concord Chambers

line0.desc: [Sietch]s in this region and its neighbors get ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line1.desc: Allied [Sietch]s in this region and its neighbors get ::target_effects:: (x1 max)

PropagandaOffice.texts.name: Propaganda Office
PropagandaOffice.texts.desc: Propaganda is the opposite of artillery: the heavier it is, the less it carries.
PropagandaOffice.texts.plural.name: Propaganda Offices

ResearchStation.texts.name: Research Station
ResearchStation.texts.desc: Coordinates all scientific efforts to allow for better progression in the research of [Development]s.
ResearchStation.texts.plural.name: Research Stations

ResearchStation_Fremen.texts.name: Research Station
ResearchStation_Fremen.texts.desc: Coordinates all scientific efforts to allow for better progression in the research of [Development]s.
ResearchStation_Fremen.texts.plural.name: Research Stations

SpacingGuildBranch.texts.name: Spacing Guild Branch
SpacingGuildBranch.texts.desc: As the only known source of the geriatric [Spice], it's only natural that [SpacingGuild-longname] will take special interest in Arrakis.
SpacingGuildBranch.texts.plural.name: Spacing Guild Branches

RecyclingPlant.texts.name: Recycling Plant
RecyclingPlant.texts.desc: [Fremen-longname] have limited industrial capacities. They can however reach a decent output by scrapping and repurposing the invaders' machines.
RecyclingPlant.texts.plural.name: Recycling Plants

Masterpiece_Eco.texts.name: Masterpiece
Masterpiece_Eco.texts.desc: A true expression of beauty, pure and untainted by any defect its creator might have.
Masterpiece_Eco.texts.plural.name: Masterpieces

line2.desc: Destroying [!Masterpiece]s inflicts the loss of ::value:: [Authority] and ::value:: [Standing]

Masterpiece_Military.texts.name: Masterpiece
Masterpiece_Military.texts.desc: A true expression of beauty, pure and untainted by any defect its creator might have.
Masterpiece_Military.texts.plural.name: Masterpieces

line2.desc: Destroying [!Masterpiece]s inflicts the loss of ::value:: [Authority] and ::value:: [Standing]

Masterpiece_StateCraft.texts.name: Masterpiece
Masterpiece_StateCraft.texts.desc: A true expression of beauty, pure and untainted by any defect its creator might have.
Masterpiece_StateCraft.texts.plural.name: Masterpieces

line2.desc: Destroying [!Masterpiece]s inflicts the loss of ::value:: [Authority] and ::value:: [Standing]

NeuralNode.texts.name: Neural Node
NeuralNode.texts.desc: The whole is more than the sum of its parts, but a single missing node can unravel the network.
NeuralNode.texts.plural.name: Neural Nodes

line1.desc: Can only be built in [!Village]s where exactly ::value:: neighbor is connected directly to the [Vernius_ConnectedVillage]

BootlegMarket.texts.name: Bootleg Market
BootlegMarket.texts.desc: This illegal market can provide small quantities of rare resources.
BootlegMarket.texts.plural.name: Bootleg Markets

WaterSmugglers.texts.name: Water Thieves
WaterSmugglers.texts.desc: Stealing water is a dangerous job on Arrakis. It's also a very profitable one.
WaterSmugglers.texts.plural.name: Water Thieves

CorruptedAdministrators.texts.name: Corrupted Administrators
CorruptedAdministrators.texts.desc: The harsh life on Arrakis is a blessing for the Smugglers, making most administrators of remote settlements susceptible to bribery.
CorruptedAdministrators.texts.plural.name: Corrupted Administrators

WorkersGuild.texts.name: Worker's Guild
WorkersGuild.texts.desc: The [!WorkersGuild] can always provide labor. You just never know who they truly work for.
WorkersGuild.texts.plural.name: Worker's Guilds

TraffickingStation.texts.name: Harvesters' Union
TraffickingStation.texts.desc: A strong union emboldens the workers to fight for their rights. A corrupt one launders and intimidates. Strong and corrupt is the best of both worlds.
TraffickingStation.texts.plural.name: Harvesters' Unions

WaterNetwork.texts.name: Water Network
WaterNetwork.texts.desc: Optimizing supply lines to always get critical resources where they are needed is a lesson that a water merchant has to learn early to have a chance on Arrakis.
WaterNetwork.texts.plural.name: Water Networks

WaterSeller.texts.name: Water Seller
WaterSeller.texts.desc: Essential goods only have really good margins at the retail level.
WaterSeller.texts.plural.name: Water Sellers

ContrabandCache.texts.name: Contraband Caches
ContrabandCache.texts.desc: Hiding resources over time will be helpful for the day you take over.
ContrabandCache.texts.plural.name: Contraband Caches

line0.desc: Stores ::percent_value:: of the [!Village]'s [Spice] production, up to ::value(UWHQ_StolenProd_MaxStock)::

EnergyDiversions.texts.name: Energy Diversions
EnergyDiversions.texts.desc: There's always an unattended wire somewhere. And otherwise, you can just pay someone to get access.
EnergyDiversions.texts.plural.name: Energy Diversions

ScavengerCaches.texts.name: Scavenger Caches
ScavengerCaches.texts.desc: The dead hold many valuables that would be of more use to the living. The trick is to be the first to get to them.
ScavengerCaches.texts.plural.name: Scavenger Caches

HiddenExplosives.texts.name: Hidden Explosives
HiddenExplosives.texts.desc: A surprise attack can come from the outside, but it's way more efficient coming from within.
HiddenExplosives.texts.plural.name: Hidden Explosives

line1.desc: [!HiddenExplosives] are removed when [Smugglers] units attack the [!Village]

CovertRecruiters.texts.name: Covert Recruiters
CovertRecruiters.texts.desc: Every disillusioned young man can be turned into a jagged soldier ready to die at your command. The secret ingredients are lies and dreams.
CovertRecruiters.texts.plural.name: Covert Recruiters

LocalGang.texts.name: Local Gang
LocalGang.texts.desc: A local gang set up to support Smugglers activities and protect investments when needed...
LocalGang.texts.plural.name: Local Gangs

line1.desc: [!LocalGang] is removed when [Smugglers] units attack the [!Village]

BackAlleyDoctor.texts.name: Back-Alley Doctor
BackAlleyDoctor.texts.desc: Local help can make all the difference in a heavy conflict.
BackAlleyDoctor.texts.plural.name: Back-Alley Doctors

Spywares.texts.name: Spyware
Spywares.texts.desc: A bit of industrial spying has never hurt anyone.
Spywares.texts.plural.name: Spywares

WhisperersLair.texts.name: Whisperers Lair
WhisperersLair.texts.desc: A healthy whisper market spreads both the mundane and the extraordinary, the private and the public, the innocuous and the dangerous.
WhisperersLair.texts.plural.name: Whisperers Lairs

ActivistQuarters.texts.name: Activist Quarters
ActivistQuarters.texts.desc: Lobbying, influence, and veiled threats are the perfect recipe for good and healthy relationships.
ActivistQuarters.texts.plural.name: Activist Quarters

PropagandaCell.texts.name: Propaganda Cell
PropagandaCell.texts.desc: Propping up the right person in the public consciousness takes time and dedication, but it yields great rewards in the long run.
PropagandaCell.texts.plural.name: Propaganda Cell

EnrollmentStation.texts.name: Dead Drops
EnrollmentStation.texts.desc: Communication in enemy territory is mostly a question of finding the right hiding spots and using them sparingly.
EnrollmentStation.texts.plural.name: Dead Drops

MBSpiceTraffickers.texts.name: Spice Traffickers
MBSpiceTraffickers.texts.desc: He who controls those who control the Spice, controls the universe.
MBSpiceTraffickers.texts.plural.name: Spice Traffickers

MBContrabandHub.texts.name: Contraband Hub
MBContrabandHub.texts.desc: Stealing is only half of the work, you also need an efficient way to resell your goods.
MBContrabandHub.texts.plural.name: Contraband Hubs

MBLaunderingNetwork.texts.name: Laundering Network
MBLaunderingNetwork.texts.desc: Only fools pay their fair share of taxes.
MBLaunderingNetwork.texts.plural.name: Laundering Networks

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: per level of this main base's biggest completed [Economy] district

MBHiddenExplosives.texts.name: Hidden Explosives
MBHiddenExplosives.texts.desc: No wall is big enough when it can crumble from its core.
MBHiddenExplosives.texts.plural.name: Hidden Explosives

line0.desc: The Main Base cannot attack for a day upon ally [ArmySiege]

MBBeaconNetwork.texts.name: Beacon Network
MBBeaconNetwork.texts.desc: The best way to win a battle against a strong opponent is to exploit your own strengths.
MBBeaconNetwork.texts.plural.name: Beacon Networks

line0.desc: Ally Military Units in [::UWHQ_host_faction::-adjective] territory gain ::target_effects::

MBWeaponDealers.texts.name: Weapon Dealers
MBWeaponDealers.texts.desc: Weapons always get lost in a conflict...and found by clever people.
MBWeaponDealers.texts.plural.name: Weapon Dealers

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: per level of this main base's biggest completed [Military] district

MBWhisperersHub.texts.name: Whisperers Hub
MBWhisperersHub.texts.desc: It's always good to have an escape route, with people to help along the way.
MBWhisperersHub.texts.plural.name: Whisperers Hubs

MBSchemeLodge.texts.name: Scheme Lodge
MBSchemeLodge.texts.desc: Sometimes the best spies are the most noticeable.
MBSchemeLodge.texts.plural.name: Scheme Lodges

line0.desc: [::UWHQ_host_faction::-longname] gain access to Smuggler Contraband Offers

line1.desc: Gain ::value:: [Intel] when [::UWHQ_host_faction::-longname] finishes a Contraband Offer

MBActivistHeadquarters.texts.name: Activist Headquarters
MBActivistHeadquarters.texts.desc: Spreading propaganda directly among their people also lets them know how much you matter.
MBActivistHeadquarters.texts.plural.name: Activist Headquarters

line0.desc: ::target_effects:: per level of this main base's biggest completed [Statecraft] district

SIFremenNegotiator.texts.name: Fremen Trade Hub
SIFremenNegotiator.texts.desc: Trade is an essential part of Fremen culture. The strengthening of trade is a strenghtening of culture.
SIFremenNegotiator.texts.plural.name: Fremen Trade Hubs

SIFremenGoldsmithery.texts.name: Fremen Goldsmithery
SIFremenGoldsmithery.texts.desc: The Fremen craftmanship often surprises offworlders for its intricacy. Their jeweleries are really popular on the black market.
SIFremenGoldsmithery.texts.plural.name: Fremen Goldsmitheries

SISpiceSeekers.texts.name: Melange Mixing Mill
SISpiceSeekers.texts.desc: The Fremen have secret ways to increase spice concentration which requires specialised equipment.
SISpiceSeekers.texts.plural.name: Melange Mixing Mills

SIHiddenPlascreteFactory.texts.name: Hidden Plascrete Factory
SIHiddenPlascreteFactory.texts.desc: Good thing the Empire doesn't know all that can be hidden within a Sietch.
SIHiddenPlascreteFactory.texts.plural.name: Hidden Plascrete Factories

SIThumpersFactory.texts.name: Thumper Factory
SIThumpersFactory.texts.desc: Worm riding can be vital in times of conflict.
SIThumpersFactory.texts.plural.name: Thumper Factories

SIFremenWatchers.texts.name: Raid Gathering Site
SIFremenWatchers.texts.desc: Striking the invaders requires a place to coordinate, plan and resupply.
SIFremenWatchers.texts.plural.name: Raid Gathering Sites

SIDesertTrainingCenters.texts.name: Desert Training Centers
SIDesertTrainingCenters.texts.desc: Teaching even the weakest child to fight off the invaders makes a lengthy invasion hopeless.
SIDesertTrainingCenters.texts.plural.name: Desert Training Centers

line0.desc: Every [Sietch] and every allied or neutral [!Village] gains ::target_effects_list::

SISandForge.texts.name: Master Knife Makers
SISandForge.texts.desc: Many blades are crafted here, as well as the very invaluable Crysknives.
SISandForge.texts.plural.name: Master Knife Makers

SIFremenShadow.texts.name: Gossip Barterers
SIFremenShadow.texts.desc: The Houses like to think they are master spies, and yet in their arrogance they ignore the many ears surrounding them every day.
SIFremenShadow.texts.plural.name: Gossip Barterers

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Intel] production per neutral Villages in the region and its neighbors

SIFremenAnalyst.texts.name: Desert Analysts
SIFremenAnalyst.texts.desc: Arrakis still holds many secrets even the Fremen have not fathomed.
SIFremenAnalyst.texts.plural.name: Desert Analysts

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Knowledge] per neutral Villages in the region and its neighbors

SIUndergroundLakes.texts.name: Underground Lakes
SIUndergroundLakes.texts.desc: Most people think Arrakis is devoid of water, but deep under the surface lie huge underground lakes.
SIUndergroundLakes.texts.plural.name: Underground Lakes

SITerraformingResearchHub.texts.name: Terraforming Research Hub
SITerraformingResearchHub.texts.desc: The Fremen have a plan for their planet. It must remain secret.
SITerraformingResearchHub.texts.plural.name: Terraforming Research Hubs

Masterpiece.texts.name: Masterpiece
Masterpiece.texts.desc: A true expression of beauty, pure and untainted by any defect its creator might have.
Masterpiece.texts.plural.name: Masterpieces

line2.desc: Destroying [!Masterpiece]s inflicts the loss of ::value:: [Authority] and ::value:: [Standing]

ClandestineScouts.texts.name: Clandestine Scouts
ClandestineScouts.texts.desc: You just never know when a supply of weapons and ammunition will come in handy.
ClandestineScouts.texts.plural.name: Clandestine Scouts

Main_WeaponsFactory.texts.name: Underground Tunnels
Main_WeaponsFactory.texts.desc: You'll get lost down there, really lost, but at least you'll be safe. Now, if you manage to get a map of the tunnels, that's a whole other story.
Main_WeaponsFactory.texts.plural.name: Underground Tunnels

SupportStation.texts.name: Support Station
SupportStation.texts.desc: A standing army is expensive, but it is possible to reduce that price, with the right infrastructures.
SupportStation.texts.plural.name: Support Stations

SpotterCell.texts.name: Spotter Cell
SpotterCell.texts.desc: It can be easy to empty the riches of a place when everything has been meticulously prepared beforehand...
SpotterCell.texts.plural.name: Spotter Cells

Main_Fortifications.texts.name: Enhanced Fortifications
Main_Fortifications.texts.desc: Reinforces the Main Base's defensive capabilities, making it harder to take down.
Main_Fortifications.texts.plural.name: Enhanced Fortifications

CompositeMaterials.name: Composite Materials
CompositeMaterials.desc: Dune's harsh environment makes composite materials a key part of building a vast and durable infrastructure.

AdvancedEngineering.name: Advanced Engineering
AdvancedEngineering.desc: These improved construction techniques specific to Arrakis' environment are dedicated to infrastructure efficiency.

ModularParts.name: Modular Parts
ModularParts.desc: Modular parts unlock customization options for your vehicles, such as extra crew cabins in your Harvesters.

EnergyMarkets.name: Geothermal Condensers
EnergyMarkets.desc: Geothermal energy sources can be used for a lot more than charging batteries.

AraakisRiches.name: Riches of Arrakis
AraakisRiches.desc: Arrakis teaches the attitude of the knife - chopping off what's incomplete and saying: "Now, it's complete because it's ended here."

EconomicLobbying.name: Insulated Valley
EconomicLobbying.desc: Some places are naturally protected from the scorching winds of Arrakis. With a bit of effort, they can even be made almost livable.

GridexPlane.name: CHOAM Integration
GridexPlane.desc: Integrating yourself in the regular operation of the CHOAM gives you precious knowledge about the [Spice] trade.

line0.desc: See next period's [Spice] exchange rate in the Spice Report

StructuredWarehouses.name: CHOAM Support
StructuredWarehouses.desc: You might be harvesting Spice, but CHOAM distributes it, controls its flow, and gets very rich doing it. That is a powerful friend to have.

VeteranCrews.name: Crew Training Program
VeteranCrews.desc: Some Houses consider harvester crews as expendable. Others know in their happiness lies the recipe for the very best Spice yields.

LocalDialectStudies.name: Local Dialect Studies
LocalDialectStudies.desc: Efforts toward social and cultural integration always help assuage the pyons' fears.

LayoftheLand.name: Lay of the Land
LayoftheLand.desc: To the layman, Dune is only a pile of dust. Only those who know the land see the deadly traps and abundant opportunities.

LocalHubs.name: Local Hubs
LocalHubs.desc: Further fostering local ties helps when it comes to surviving on a planet like Arrakis.

Paracompass.name: Native Customs
Paracompass.desc: Learning the behavior of the locals and knowing when and how to react is an essential first step in gaining their acceptance.

WaterSellersContacts.name: Valuable Trinkets
WaterSellersContacts.desc: People of all creeds and origins overestimate the value of shiny, decorative objects.

OutpostLogistics.name: Outpost Logistics
OutpostLogistics.desc: Setting up a solid network of outposts generally requires defensive installations, the right people, and convincing gifts.

SpectralImaging.name: Civilian Defense Force
SpectralImaging.desc: Training civilians to take care of their own defenses is a key component of keeping a huge territory during war time.

BorderDefense.name: Border Defense
BorderDefense.desc: These small stations are usually built within villages, allowing for better communication with remote places.

WaterTrade.name: Wonders of the Desert
WaterTrade.desc: While the desert is often harsh and painful, it can also be beautiful in the right circumstances.

SurvivalTraining.name: Survival Training
SurvivalTraining.desc: Arrakis is the deadliest and most efficient instructor.

line0.desc: Unlocks the Armory to customize units' equipment

DefenseSystems.name: Mechanization
DefenseSystems.desc: Remote-controlled drones and small exoskeletons can help the armed force in many ways.

ArmyLogistics.name: Army Logistics
ArmyLogistics.desc: An army needs a lot of resources to operate, including those found in the field.

line1.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

CalltoArms.name: Recruitment Initiative
CalltoArms.desc: Restructuring the army and investing in recruitment is the only way to increase significantly its size.

MilitaryThreat.name: Energy Efficiency
MilitaryThreat.desc: New generations of energy cells are more efficient and durable.

GroundCommand.name: Parallel Training
GroundCommand.desc: Improved training techniques focusing on autonomy and tutorship from senior trainees allow for faster recruitment.

SupportStructures.name: Siege Incentives
SupportStructures.desc: Annhiliation of a complete city is a harrowing idea. Most people wouldn't do it. But with the right incentives, you can convince anyone.

line0.desc: Military units deal ::s_percent_value:: damage against Main Bases

line1.desc: Military Units gives ::value:: [Solari] per damage inflicted on a Main Base

AirCommand.name: Parts Production
AirCommand.desc: The mass production of serialized parts allows for fast and cheap repairs of mechanized units.

HighCommand.name: Military Propaganda
HighCommand.desc: There are times when appearing to be the strongest is more important than actually being so.

line1.desc: ::target_effects:: if no other factions use more [CommandPoint]

IntelligenceNetwork.name: Intelligence Network
IntelligenceNetwork.desc: All agents on the field should be able to input and access information, creating an ever-expanding web of knowledge.

line0.desc: Getting the chosen result on at least one resolution grants ::value:: [Standing] every Council

DiplomaticManoeuvers.name: Diplomatic Maneuvers
DiplomaticManoeuvers.desc: Diplomacy is a complex game, one that can be played only by those who accept and even enjoy such intricacies.

line0.desc: [MinorHouses] deliver a [MinorHousesDonation] near [$my(MainBase)] after every Council

SpyingLogistic.name: Spying Logistic
SpyingLogistic.desc: Not everybody is born a natural spy. Most have to train hard to become one.

CounterMeasures.name: Counter Measures
CounterMeasures.desc: Sometimes, the best offense is defense. This is particularly true in espionage and politics.

line0.desc: After every Council, receive <good>1</good> [LandsraadSoldiers_Dev] per ::value:: [Influence] spent, up to ::value(Dev_CounterMeasures_MaxUnitSpawn)::

PoliticalStrength.name: Landsraad Support
PoliticalStrength.desc: The deep spiral of politics can be overwhelming to newcomers.

NegotiationTactics.name: Nefarious Contacts
NegotiationTactics.desc: Some endeavors require to hire specialists, even if you might not want to meet them eye to eye.

StealthGear.name: Stealth Gear
StealthGear.desc: The best way not to get caught is to not be seen at all.

line0.desc: ::percent_value:: of an operation's [::target2::] cost is refund when launched in the territory of a faction in [War]

SandDiplomacy.name: Insider Trading
SandDiplomacy.desc: Politicians are as much subject to bribery as anyone else, but the bribe often takes a more subtle form.

line2.desc: Ignore CHOAM selling cooldown and max [Influence] during the [LandsraadCouncil]

SpyingMastery.name: Spying Mastery
SpyingMastery.desc: Secrets are best kept by fewer guardians, and a strong encryption.

AtreidesMerchants.name: Local Community
AtreidesMerchants.desc: Investing in local communities is the foundation of trust between the people and their leader.

UrbanPlanning.name: Urban Planning
UrbanPlanning.desc: With careful planning and heavy investment, it's possible to build a full city in no time.

AtreidesForemen.name: Atreides Foremen
AtreidesForemen.desc: Loyal workers at key posts will make sure that your assets are maintained in working order.

UnderstandTheBeauty.name: Air Network
UnderstandTheBeauty.desc: On a planet like Arrakis, distant outposts are islands in an ocean of sand. Reaching them on time is often easier by air.

EmbraceCulture.name: Cultural Assimilation
EmbraceCulture.desc: Most people would rather have a tyrant who act like them than a strange but benevolent leader.

VeteranMilitia.name: Veteran Militia
VeteranMilitia.desc: A soldier too old to remain on active duty can be sent as an officer in a far-away outpost. His knowledge will help the local militia with strategic planning and training.

NewHomeland.name: Post-Trauma Reintegration
NewHomeland.desc: With the proper medical techniques and thorough psychological care, soldiers who have lived through traumatic experiences can still serve.

AtreidesOfficers.name: Proud Liberator
AtreidesOfficers.desc: You are on the right side of this fight. Everyone says so. Just enjoy and stop thinking about it!

line2.desc: Units Liberating or Annexing a [!Village] from a faction with less [Standing] heal ::percent_value:: of [Life] for free

AtreidesSympathizers.name: Atreides Sympathizers
AtreidesSympathizers.desc: A pervasive spy network can also be used for benevolent means.

AtreidesDelegations.name: Political Entente
AtreidesDelegations.desc: With tension rising, gathering friendly houses into an informal alliance is the only way to get some help when chaos inevitably ensues.

line0.desc: When another faction betrays a [Peace] with [Atreides-longname], receive ::value:: free [::target::]

ActiveSurveillance.name: Active Surveillance
ActiveSurveillance.desc: To catch a spy in our midst, it is not enough to look within. We must also turn our gaze towards friends and enemies alike.

SustainableSpying.name: Sustainable Spying
SustainableSpying.desc: Agents that focus on bringing positive results to their House instead of participating in nefarious plots often end up forming deep and durable alliances.

line0.desc: [Agent]s assigned on [IChoam], [ILandsraad], or [ISpaceGuild] slots produce ::s_percent_value:: of their associated resources

line1.desc: [Agent] traits present only once on an [!Infiltration] field apply their effects twice

HarkonnenNegociation.name: Work Ethics
HarkonnenNegociation.desc: For too long, the lazy have fed off the diligent. No more! House Harkonnen needs men and women willing to give their 200%.

MartialEconomy.name: Martial Economy
MartialEconomy.desc: The invisible hand needs a good whip to teach these lazy locals how to be useful to the market.

InstillFear.name: Instill Fear
InstillFear.desc: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion.

line0.desc: Pillaging a village does not increase its annexation cost

line2.desc: ::percent:: [Authority] cost to [Annex] again a [!Village] owned by [Harkonnen-shortname] in the past

MonitoringNetworks.name: Savage Cleansing
MonitoringNetworks.desc: The savages hide in their dirty burrows. To get rid of that pest would only strengthen our claim on Arrakis.

line0.desc: Pillaging a [Sietch] for the first time gives ::value:: [Authority] and immediately reveals another [Sietch]

line1.desc: A successful[Pillage] resupply ::s_percent_value:: of max [Supply] of units in the occupation circle

SymbolsOfAuthority.name: Symbols of Authority
SymbolsOfAuthority.desc: Desecration of their symbols is the fastest way to tame the savages' spirit.

BloodCommand.name: Adrenaline Addiction
BloodCommand.desc: If they do not dread our very name, we have failed!

line1.desc: Every time a unit dies, ally Military Units that are fighting nearby receive ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)

line2.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

AssemblyLines.name: Assembly Lines
AssemblyLines.desc: Reduce the manufacturing process to its essential gestures, and even the dullest worker can do it.

AraakisButchers.name: Arrakis Butchers
AraakisButchers.desc: The butcher cuts off the diseased flesh before it can infect all the meat.

CruelReputation.name: Cruel Reputation
CruelReputation.desc: It is a good thing they are not too fond of us. It keeps them on their toes and us on our feet.

line0.desc: Using an operation on a faction in [War] grants ::percent_value:: of its [Solari] cost as [Influence]

LandsraadWhispers.name: Landsraad Whispers
LandsraadWhispers.desc: Always keeping both ears open and always being ready to jump at an opportunity is the key to a successful Landsraad Council.

HarkonnenLegacy.name: Enhanced Questionning
HarkonnenLegacy.desc: With the right tools, an enemy can be more helpful than a friend.

TinkererTeams.name: Tinkerer Teams
TinkererTeams.desc: It may only hold together with bits of string and tape, but it's better than breaking apart in the middle of the desert.

UnderworldContacts.name: Underworld Contacts
UnderworldContacts.desc: They say there is no money among friends. Maybe they should find more profitable friends.

CriminalPast.name: Criminal Barons
CriminalPast.desc: Being able to delegate, to share the leadership roles, makes an underworld empire more nimble.

UndergroundNetwork.name: Underground Network
UndergroundNetwork.desc: The Smugglers are everywhere and take advantage of every opportunity.

AegisoftheUnderworld.name: Illicit Methods
AegisoftheUnderworld.desc: A tactful shakedown can serve as a reminder of everyone's place on the ladder. No hard feelings.

line0.desc: Ignore the cost penalty to [Annex] pillaged [!Village]s

OrganizedLooting.name: Organized Looting
OrganizedLooting.desc: Looting seems random and messy to the untrained eye, but getting the most from a chaotic situation requires a coordinated team of rabble-rousers.

GuerrillaTactics.name: Guerrilla Tactics
GuerrillaTactics.desc: Mixing offense and defense is a sound tactic when you don't have the backing of a Great House.

IndustrialScavenging.name: Industrial Scavenging
IndustrialScavenging.desc: When a good team is supported by a proper industry of crime, profits are bound to rise.

line0.desc: Non-mechanical units in the same region as at least ::value:: [S_Drone] consume ::target_effects::

line1.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

MilitaryAdministration.name: Synchronized Heist
MilitaryAdministration.desc: If you have enough trusted men, hitting multiple locations at once ensures that at least one will go through.

line1.desc: On completing a siege, units in the occupation circle gain ::target_effects:: for 1 day

line2.desc: When at least ::value:: sieges are under way against the same faction, ::target_effects::

UnderworldBosses.name: Foot In the Door
UnderworldBosses.desc: Get them to agree to one thing, and they'll agree to anything.

line0.desc: ::s_percent:: [UWHeadquarters] installation costs within territories of factions in [Peace]

line2.desc: ::value:: [Influence] and [Intel] production per faction hosting at least one [UWHeadquarters]

SecurityDetails.name: Security Details
SecurityDetails.desc: Important men have important friends, and these friends would be happy to provide protection.

line0.desc: Receive ::value:: free [Mercenaries] after any resolution choice marked by a [Bounty] passes

UnderworldBribes.name: Underworld Bribes
UnderworldBribes.desc: Listening can get you further than talking.

line1.desc: Resolutions marked by a [Bounty] receives 1 more vote from the [MinorHouses] per ::value:: [Standing]

SpreadingTheFaith.name: Freedom Fighters
SpreadingTheFaith.desc: Those who fight for freedom and self-determination will always find support from those they free.

ArrakisSecrets.name: Arrakis Secrets
ArrakisSecrets.desc: The offworlders are not the only ones who need vast amounts of Spice.

line2.desc: When they pack up, [F_Harvester]s leave combat immediately and have [Sneak_Trait] for ::value:: day

SpiceMarket.name: Sand Brotherhood
SpiceMarket.desc: The strongest bonds are forged in adversity. Once the desert becomes your home, every visitor is your brother.

FremenCommand.name: Shared Transcendence
FremenCommand.desc: The [Spice] orgy is an intoxicating experience. The Fremen merge minds in a sensorial whirlwind, if only for an instant.

DuneWanderers.name: Heir of Arrakis
DuneWanderers.desc: For as much as the Pan and Graben people see Arrakis as their home, its rightful owners are the Fremen.

SpiceHegemony.name: Desert Wisdom
SpiceHegemony.desc: Fremen's number are often underestimated. When joining force, they can accomplish anything.

AdvancedThumpers.name: Desert Watchers
AdvancedThumpers.desc: The Fremen see all of Arrakis as their duty to protect from the invaders.

line2.desc: Ally units in [Fremen] territory and near allied [Sietch]s have [Sneak_Trait]

SkyGazing.name: Sky Gazing
SkyGazing.desc: The open desert is an invitation to look at the night sky and wonder.

DesertTrekkers.name: Desert Trekkers
DesertTrekkers.desc: When you are needed somewhere, the question is not whether you will get there on time, but how.

StalwartAlliance.name: Stalwart Alliance
StalwartAlliance.desc: Fremen society is often fragmented, but everyone agrees on the necessity to remove the offworlder oppressors.

line0.desc: During Liberation of an enemy [!Village], neighboring allied [Sietch]s send a supporting raid

line2.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

TruePeople.name: Iday Alakrab
TruePeople.desc: The scorpion keeps its strength hidden and only strikes once victory is certain.

line3.desc: On exiting wormriding, units inflict ::s_value:: damage on first attack and gain [Sneak_Trait] for a day

DesertShadows.name: Fremen Solidarity
DesertShadows.desc: Fremen do not agree on everything, in fact they rarely do. But on the subject of offworlders, they make an exception.

SandDiplomats.name: Sand Diplomats
SandDiplomats.desc: When a whole planet gets its mind on something, it generally have results.

SietchNetwork.name: Sietch Network
SietchNetwork.desc: Each rallied [Sietch] brings the Fremen closer to victory!

SolidMaterials.name: Solid Materials
SolidMaterials.desc: The Emperor's stay on Arrakis might be short, but the infrastructure He brings may endure for centuries.

ImperialTaxes.name: Integrated Costs
ImperialTaxes.desc: Infrastructure on the planet can deteriorate quickly without proper care. Integrating most of the maintenance into the [ImpBase] protocols would save costs.

CHOAMManipulation.name: CHOAM Manipulation
CHOAMManipulation.desc: A good grip on the CHOAM has been used for centuries to keep control of the Great Houses.

Megalopolis.name: Megalopolis
Megalopolis.desc: Centralization of power and population brings a lot of benefits through economies of scale.

ImperialResearchers.name: Imperial Researchers
ImperialResearchers.desc: Any government needs the support of the intellectual class. It's even more true for a galactic governement.

ImperialAdministration.name: Imperial Administration
ImperialAdministration.desc: Economies of scale are very powerful things that a galactic Emperor uses with abundance.

AdministrativeConsolidation.name: Administrative Consolidation
AdministrativeConsolidation.desc: Continuous investment can make the local economy thrive beyond imagination.

ImperialCommand.name: Imperial Command
ImperialCommand.desc: It's the prerogative of the Emperor to commandeer any airport He may need for official business.

line2.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

ImperialThreat.name: Imperial Protocols
ImperialThreat.desc: The presence of the Emperor alone is often enough to intimidate the bravest nobles of the Imperium.

line1.desc: ::target_effects:: for Military Units in regions where [Corrino-shortname] has a numerical superiority

AbsolutePower.name: Absolute Power
AbsolutePower.desc: One cannot lead without the consent of its subjects. The trick is to get their consent without their noticing.

line0.desc: Proposing a [::target::] has no cost if no [Peace] is active

line1.desc: Gain ::value:: [::target::] on Council opening if at least one [Peace] is active

DiplomaticSpying.name: Diplomatic Spying
DiplomaticSpying.desc: Keep your friends close, but your enemies even closer.

line0.desc: ::s_value:: [Influence] production per [Agent]s assigned on a faction in [Peace]

line1.desc: ::s_value:: [Intel] production per [Agent]s assigned on a faction in [War]

EmperorEyes.name: Emperor Eyes
EmperorEyes.desc: No machination can stay hidden for long from the sight of an Emperor.

line1.desc: ::s_percent:: Military Units cost while victim of a treason

ArtisticAspirations.name: Artistic Aspirations
ArtisticAspirations.desc: Even the lowest of men want to create, to shape the world to their image. If only we could channel this primal energy into practical matters!

CulturalTourism.name: Cultural Tourism
CulturalTourism.desc: Some people are attracted by the quaint and simple lifestyle of Arrakis' pyon. Why not indulge them, for a price?

ManicheanPropaganda.name: Manichean Propaganda
ManicheanPropaganda.desc: Who does not like an epic tale with a grand conflict between good and evil? It's hard not to be moved by such a story.

line1.desc: Other factions lose ::value:: [::target::] when killing an [Ecaz-adjective] [Militia]

NativeArtists.name: Native Artists
NativeArtists.desc: Even the savage inhabitants of a backwater planet like Arrakis are elevated by the act of creation.

PridefulCrown.name: Prideful Crown
PridefulCrown.desc: When you have an amazing jewel, you don't just leave it hanging around. No, you need an equally great casket to display it properly.

line0.desc: [!Village]s at a distance of ::value:: regions from the [::target::] gain: ::target_effects_list2::

NationalMythos.name: National Mythos
NationalMythos.desc: What is the difference between a people and a crowd? A story. Good stories you can believe in are the foundation of any patriotism.

line1.comments: target 2 is TNationalMythos, making the whole text: "-10% damage received by Ecazi units in a large area around the Champion"
line1.desc: ::target_effects2:: by [Ecaz-adjective] units in a large area around the [TEcazChampion]

MartialPerfectionism.name: Martial Perfectionism
MartialPerfectionism.desc: When you really want to shine, good enough is not good enough. Everything has to be perfect.

line1.desc: Can choose to pay ::s_percent_value(PerfectedRecruitment_CostFactor):: of the price to recruit units in ::s_percent(PerfectedRecruitment_TimeFactor):: of the time, giving them permanently: ::target_effects_list::

InspiringStandart.name: Inspiring Standard
InspiringStandart.desc: A well-designed flag should show strength and determination, evoking exaltation from any potential onlooker.

line1.desc: Non-mechanical units in the same region as at least ::value:: [E_Drone] ::target_effects::

LogisticalFlourish.name: Logistical Flourish
LogisticalFlourish.desc: War is won by the soldiers. But without the support of a precise logistic, they won't be able to show off their skills.

line1.desc: When a [TEcazChampion] dies, get ::target_effects:: for ::value:: days

CosmopoliteElegance.name: Cosmopolite Elegance
CosmopoliteElegance.desc: Elegance and style are the best disguises. The classy type can belong anywhere.

PoliticalArt.name: Political Art
PoliticalArt.desc: Art is inherently political. Some artworks assume and shape this component toward a focused objective.

line1.desc: Any Charter currently claimed by [Ecaz-longname] cannot be proposed to vote

InfluentialPlots.name: Influential Plots
InfluentialPlots.desc: Some people are so likable than they can get away with anything, even publicly.

line0.desc: When out of [::target::], [::target2::] is used in its stead for mission preparation, assassination upkeep and [Assassin] recruitment

EntropicEngineering.name: Entropic Engineering
EntropicEngineering.desc: [Spice] affects the mind's abilities in unexpected ways. Studying those effects, and the chemical composition of the melange, will require a much better yield from the gatherer.

line0.desc: Can spend up to 2 [FuelCell] in [$my(harvester)]s to increase their production

SpiceEnlightenment.name: Spice Enlightenment
SpiceEnlightenment.desc: As we begin to understand [Spice] as an organic component of the ecosystem, we discover new ways to attract it into our gatherer at a molecular level.

line0.desc: Can spend up to 4 [FuelCell]s in [$my(harvester)]s to increase their production

SequentialThinking.name: Sequential Thinking
SequentialThinking.desc: Most processes happen in order. One step. And the next one. And the next one. Our architectures must reflect and support this pattern.

line0.desc: The Nodal Network can optionaly connect to [NeuralNode]s across a [DeepDesert]

line1.desc: Each node on the longest path of the Nodal Network gives <good>+0.5</good> [Knowledge] and <good>+2%</good> [Authority] production

NeuralTropism.name: Neural Tropism
NeuralTropism.desc: The same species is capable of growing into many different shapes to accommodate the environmental conditions.

line0.desc: Enemy factions pay ::s_percent_value:: [Authority] to [Annex] a [!Village] neighboring at least <good>2</good> regions connected to the Nodal Network

AutomatedDefenses.name: Automated Defenses
AutomatedDefenses.desc: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link. It is natural to prioritize protecting our more sensitive spots. The Nodal Network is no exception.

line0.desc: Connected [NeuralNode]s automatically attack enemy units within your territory

line1.desc: [!Village]s connected to the Nodal Network gain: ::target_effects_list::

WaterBatteries.name: Water Batteries
WaterBatteries.desc: Machines, mechanical or organic, require energy to function. But how come can we not power ourselves with sharp electricity? And why could our drones not feed on fresh vegetables?

line0.desc: When out of [FuelCell]s, [Water] is used in its stead

line1.desc: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

GuildCollaboration.name: Guild Collaboration
GuildCollaboration.desc: A navigator is nothing without a ship to pilot. Their elevated world of probability would not exist without our grounded science of machine. It's worth a bit of support.

AutomatedManufacture.name: Automated Manufacture
AutomatedManufacture.desc: For as much as the Human mind is exquisite, its body is quite frail and demanding. Automating most of the workforce would free our minds and increase the pace of production.

line1.desc: ::s_percent_value:: recruitment and regeneration speed of all units per [Knowledge]

TechnologicalExchange.name: Technological Exchange
TechnologicalExchange.desc: The exchange of ideas, the exchange of truth, is the foundation of civilization. In many ways, the communicative scientist is at the heart of society, much more than any emperor.

line0.desc: Gain ::value:: [Standing] on Council opening per active [Peace]

HereticalComputing.name: Heretical Computing
HereticalComputing.desc: A machine would need many different elements to be "thinking". What if one of those elements could be isolated, and used for our purpose?

HolisticThinking.name: Holistic Thinking
HolisticThinking.desc: Treating information as isolated bits of knowledge is not enough. To see the whole picture you have to consider things in relation with everything else.

line1.desc: [!Infiltration] increases by ::value:: level in factions that have accepted a [HarmlessGadget]

PhysicalWiring.name: Physical Wiring
PhysicalWiring.desc: While electromagnetic transmission of data through the air has many advantages, a truly secured connection can only be achieved with good old wires and active surveillance of such wires.

line3.desc: Each [Statecraft] [!Building_Village] in the [!Village] of such a cell also gives: ::target_effects_list::

ImproveRelations.name: Non-aggression Pact
ImproveRelations.desc: Cost to propose decreases the longer the [War] lingers.

MilitaryPressure.name: Tributary
MilitaryPressure.desc: Allows the use of threats to extort resources.

line0.desc: ::value:: [::target::]s will appear at the rally point, they will last for the duration of the Resolution
::value:: [::target::]s will appear at the rally point, they will last for the duration of the Resolution
Raise relationship to [Peace] with every other factions
::value:: [::target::]s will appear at the rally point

All active [Charter]s, at the start of the council, are revoked.
[Charter] awarded during the same council are not affected.

line1.desc: Spent ::floored-crt::/::value:: [Influence] on Landsraad votes since the game started

line2.desc: You cannot be eligible for this [Charter].

line1.desc: Gain ::floored-crt::/::value:: Military [Experience] since the game started

line2.desc: You cannot be eligible for this [Charter].
You cannot be eligible for this [Charter].
You cannot be eligible for this [Charter].
You cannot be eligible for this [Charter].

Bounty.texts.name: Bounty
Bounty.texts.actionDesc: All other factions will be granted ::effects:: per vote on the targeted choice.
Bounty.texts.currentDescOwner: Other factions will gain ::effects:: per vote on ::choice:: on this resolution.
Bounty.texts.currentDescOpponent: ::effects:: will be granted per vote cast on ::choice:: on this resolution.

Corruption.texts.name: Corruption
Corruption.texts.actionDesc:
Discredit this resolution to make it less attractive.
Elected faction ::effects::.
[Harkonnen-longName] is immune.
Corruption.texts.currentDescOwner:
Effect on elected faction: ::effects::.
[Harkonnen-longName] is immune.

InciteRebellion.texts.name: Incite Rebellion
InciteRebellion.texts.actionDesc:
Speak to the people against this resolution.
If it passes, all other factions will suffer a rebellion.
InciteRebellion.texts.currentDescOwner: If this resolution passes, all other factions will suffer a rebellion.
InciteRebellion.texts.currentDescOpponent: If this resolution passes, all factions, except the [Fremen], will suffer a rebellion.

ImperialEdict.texts.name: Imperial Edict
ImperialEdict.texts.actionDesc: Switches the resolution's scope: from a single faction to every faction or, conversely, from every faction to a single faction.
ImperialEdict.texts.currentDescOwner: You have issued an edict to change this resolution's scope.
ImperialEdict.texts.currentDescOpponent: [Corrino-longName] has issued an edict to change this resolution's scope.

LandsraadImmunity.texts.name: Landsraad Immunity
LandsraadImmunity.texts.actionDesc: Leverage your reputation to get immunity to this resolution.
LandsraadImmunity.texts.currentDescOwner: You have leveraged your reputation to get immunity to this resolution.
LandsraadImmunity.texts.currentDescOpponent: [Ecaz-longname] has leveraged its reputation to get immunity to this resolution.

LandsraadImmunity_Bonus.texts.name: Landsraad Immunity
LandsraadImmunity_Bonus.texts.actionDesc: Withdraw gracefully from this resolution, making you immune.
LandsraadImmunity_Bonus.texts.currentDescOwner: You have withdrawn from this resolution, and cannot be affected.
LandsraadImmunity_Bonus.texts.currentDescOpponent: [Ecaz-longname] has withdrawn from this resolution, and cannot be affected.

LandsraadFavorite.texts.name: Dear to the Houses Minor
LandsraadFavorite.texts.currentDescOwner: If this resolution passes, all factions who have voted for it will be granted ::effects::.
LandsraadFavorite.texts.currentDescOpponent: If this resolution passes, all factions who have voted for it will be granted ::effects::.

Closed.texts.title: Closed
Closed.texts.nextPhase: The Council will open in ::remainingTime:: days

PreCouncilReview.texts.title: Agenda Review
PreCouncilReview.texts.costTipDesc: Finish your review of the agenda. The following resource changes will be definitive:

Decide.texts.title: Debates
Decide.texts.costTipDesc: Finish debating the agenda. The following resource changes will be definitive:

Recap.texts.title: Closed
Recap.texts.nextPhase: The Council will open in ::remainingTime:: days

line0.text: Cell Search
Infiltration Cells
Assassination
Add some funds

line1.text:
It's not cheap but it will avoid negative effects on your agents and their mission.
Chance of agent capture when launching the operation: ::percent_value1::.

line0.text: Keep a low profile

line1.text:
It's not cheap but it will avoid negative effects on your agents and their missions.
Duration of the mission: ::percent_value1::.
Chance of agent capture when launching the operation: ::percent_value2::.

line0.text: Recruit informants

line1.text:
It's not cheap but it will avoid negative effects on your agents and their mission.
Agent Captured in case of failure: +::value1::.

line0.text: Create a diplomatic diversion

line1.text:
It's not cheap but it will avoid negative effects on your agents and their mission.
Duration of the mission: ::percent_value1::.
Loss of Landsraad standing: ::value2::.

line1.text:
Your agent has less chances to be detected, but the mission has also less chances to succeed.
Duration of the mission: ::percent_value1::.
Chance of immediate agent capture: ::percent_value2::.

line0.text: Do nothing

line1.text: Chance of immediate agent capture: ::percent_value1::.

Use political sources
Recruit additional agents

Organize arrests
Do nothing

CloseMainBaseVision.desc: The regions owned by the faction around the [MainBase] are always visible

TerritoryVision.desc: All regions owned by the faction are always visible

CombatOngoing.name: Combat on-going
CombatOngoing.desc: Your Units are engaged in combat somewhere on Arrakis.

HostileUnitOnTerritory.name: Hostile units near territory
HostileUnitOnTerritory.desc: A hostile force has been seen close to your territory. You should prepare some defenses.

StealthUnitDetected.name: Cloaked unit detected
StealthUnitDetected.desc: A cloaked unit has been detected.

IncomingRaid.name: Raid Detected
IncomingRaid.desc: A raiding party has been seen close to your territory. Your Villages and Harvesters could be their targets.

Rebellion.name: Rebellion underway
Rebellion.desc: One of your villages is rebelling against you.

BrainwashedRebellion.name: Brainwashed Rebellion
BrainwashedRebellion.desc: You successfully brainwashed rebels to fight for you.

SardaukarRaid.name: Sardaukar Raid Detected
SardaukarRaid.desc: The Imperium is unhappy of your actions and they've sent [I_Elite] against one of your villages in retaliation.

LandsraadRaid.name: Landsraad Raid Detected
LandsraadRaid.desc: You are a pariah to the Landsraad and they've sent [Raider_LandsraadSoldiers] against your main base in retaliation.

VillageUnderSiege.name: Village under siege
VillageUnderSiege.desc: One of your villages is under siege. You need Militia or nearby troops to defend your Villages.

MBUnderSiege.name: [!$my(mainbase)] under siege
MBUnderSiege.desc: [!$my(mainbase)] is under siege. You need to defend it.

PeacefulAnnexVillageUnderSiege.name: Village with [PeacefullyAnnex] under siege
PeacefulAnnexVillageUnderSiege.desc: A village you are peacefully annexing is under siege. If the siege succeeds you will lose all progress.

CriticalStability.name: Unrest
CriticalStability.desc: Some of your Villages suffer from unrest, limiting their production. You might need more [Authority] to avoid unrest, and eventually rebellion.

ResourceDeficit.name: Resources Deficit
ResourceDeficit.desc:
The following resources have run out: ::resource_list::
Reduce your [!Upkeep] and build relevant [!Building_Village]s in your [Village]s to get rid of the deficit.

StormNearby.name: Sandstorm detected
StormNearby.desc: A [Sandstorm] is nearby. Make sure your flying units don't get caught or they will be damaged or destroyed.

WormSign.name: Sandworm detected
WormSign.desc: Signs of a [Sandworm] have been spotted in the region, all harvesting activities must cease as soon as possible.

NuclearHeadLaunched.name: [NuclearHead] Inbound
NuclearHeadLaunched.desc: A faction has broken the Great Convention. The poor souls in the area of impact will not even have the time to see what hit them before getting vaporized.

EnemyNuclearHeadReady.name: Enemy [NuclearHead] Ready
EnemyNuclearHeadReady.desc: An enemy faction has prepared a [NuclearHead]. It could get launched soon.

ContestedOccupation.name: Contested Siege
ContestedOccupation.desc: Your occupation of a village is being contested. Actions cannot progress until contenders leave or are neutralized.

UnitOrderCancelled.name: Unit Order Cancelled
UnitOrderCancelled.desc: Some of your units have had their order on this target cancelled. They are now idle and waiting for your command.

AssassinationDetected.name: Assassination Detected
AssassinationDetected.desc:
Someone is trying to assassinate you!
Hover on the Assassination Countdown to get more info on how to stop the attempt.
AssassinationDetected.gamepadDesc:
Someone is trying to assassinate you!
Inspect the Assassination Countdown from the top bar to get more info on how to stop the attempt.

MyAssassinationDetected.name: Assassination Detected
MyAssassinationDetected.desc: Your assassination attempt has been detected!

GardenResortOnTarget.name: Garden Resort on target
GardenResortOnTarget.desc: The [!Village] ::vname:: has been turned into a Garden Resort

LandsraadCouncil_Vote.name: Landsraad Council Vote
LandsraadCouncil_Vote.desc: Proposed Resolutions are locked. You can now use your [CouncilVote]s and [Influence] to sway the future of Arrakis.

LandsraadCouncil_Charter_NewEligibleFact.name: New [Charter] Eligible Faction
LandsraadCouncil_Charter_NewEligibleFact.desc: A new faction has just become eligible to the currently voted [Charter].

LandsraadCouncil_NewEligibleFaction.name: New Resolution Eligible Faction
LandsraadCouncil_NewEligibleFaction.desc: A new faction has just become eligible to one of the currently voted resolutions.

LandsraadCouncil_CouncilSpeaker.name: Council Speaker Call
LandsraadCouncil_CouncilSpeaker.desc: New Resolutions are under proposal. As the [Res_CouncilSpeaker] you are allowed to review them and propose changes.

LandsraadCouncil_Review.name: Landsraad Council Review
LandsraadCouncil_Review.desc: New Resolutions were proposed for the Council. They were now submitted to you for review.

DevelopmentWaiting.name: Development Research
DevelopmentWaiting.desc: A new Development can be researched. Click on the [Development] button to get started.
DevelopmentWaiting.gamepadDesc: A new Development can be researched. Open the [Development] menu to get started.

EnteredOccupation.name: Ongoing Siege
EnteredOccupation.desc: You can now choose what to do with the Village.

TradeRequest.name: Trade Request
TradeRequest.desc: You received a trade request from [::faction::-playername].

ForceTreatiesSent.name: Forced Treaties
ForceTreatiesSent.desc: Lady Jessica forced several treaties with [::faction::-longname].

ForceTreatyReceived.name: Forced Truce
ForceTreatyReceived.desc: Lady Jessica forced a [Peace] between [::faction::-longname] and your faction.

UnassignedAgent.name: Unassigned Agent
UnassignedAgent.desc: You can assign your [Agent]s to various activities in the Espionage window.

IdleHarvester.name: Inactive Harvester
IdleHarvester.desc: One of your [Harvester]s is inactive. You should deploy it as soon as possible to gather more [Spice].

IdleFHarvester.name: Caravan on [SpiceArea]
IdleFHarvester.desc: One of your [F_Harvester_Mobile]s has reached a [SpiceArea]. You should deploy it to gather [Spice].

IdleVHarvester.name: Harvesting Drone on [SpiceArea]
IdleVHarvester.desc: One of your [V_Harvester]s has reached a [SpiceArea]. You should deploy it to gather [Spice].

FHarvesterRecruitment.name: New Harvesting Caravan
FHarvesterRecruitment.desc: A new [F_Harvester_Mobile] is ready at [Tabr]. Send it to a [SpiceArea] to gather [Spice].

VHarvesterRecruitment.name: New Harvesting Drone
VHarvesterRecruitment.desc: A new [V_Harvester] is ready at [IxianCore]. Send it to a [SpiceArea] to gather [Spice].

ExtensionConstruction.name: Construction Complete
ExtensionConstruction.desc: A [!Building_Village] in one of your [!Village]s is now fully operational.

MBExtensionConstruction.name: Construction Complete
MBExtensionConstruction.desc: A [!Building_MB] in [!$my(mainbase)] is now fully operational.

UWHQExtensionConstruction.name: [UWHeadquarters] [!Building_UWHQ] complete
UWHQExtensionConstruction.desc: Your teams are set up in the enemy Village and have started their work.

MBConstructionAvailable.name: Construction possible in [!$my(mainbase)]
MBConstructionAvailable.desc: You have enough resources to start construction of a new [!Building_MB] in [!$my(mainbase)].

BaseDeploymentAvailable.name: [!$my(mainbase)] deployment possible
BaseDeploymentAvailable.desc: You have enough resources to deploy a second [!$my(mainbase)] on a [Corrino-adjective] or neutral [!Village].

UHWQVillageUnderLiberation.name: Village with [UWHeadquarters] is being liberated
UHWQVillageUnderLiberation.desc: A village you have [UWHeadquarters] in is being liberated. If the liberation is successful, the [UWHeadquarters] will be removed.

UWHQDestroyed.name: [UWHeadquarters] Destroyed
UWHQDestroyed.desc: One of your [UWHeadquarters]s has been destroyed!

FactionEliminated.name: Faction Eliminated
FactionEliminated.desc: [::faction::-longname] have been eliminated. Are you closer to victory?

HegemonyStageReached.name: Hegemony Threshold Reached
HegemonyStageReached.desc: You have reached ::value:: [Hegemony], unlocking new bonuses.

HegemonyMainBase.name: Hegemony Threshold Reached
HegemonyMainBase.desc: You have reached ::value:: [Hegemony], you can now build in your Main Base.

EnemyHegemonyCritical.name: Enemy Hegemony very Close to Victory

HarvesterLost.name: Harvester Destroyed
HarvesterLost.desc:
One of your [Harvester]s has been destroyed. and its [CrewPoint]s have been lost.
You will have to deploy a new one as soon as it is ready.
[Harvester]s can be destroyed by [Sandworm]s or enemy units. You should recall them when any danger is nearby.

FHarvesterCancelled.name: Harvesting Interrupted
FHarvesterCancelled.desc: One of the [SpiceArea]s exploited by your [F_Harvester]s has been claimed by another faction.

VHarvesterCancelled.name: Harvesting Interrupted
VHarvesterCancelled.desc: One of your [V_Harvester]s is no longer [Tethered].

LandsraadCouncil_CharterAgenda.name: New Charter on the Agenda
LandsraadCouncil_CharterAgenda.desc: The ::resolution:: charter has become a priority. It is currently favored to be examined during the next [LandsraadCouncil].

LandsraadCouncil_Decide.name: New Landsraad Council
LandsraadCouncil_Decide.desc:
The Landsraad Council will meet again soon.
New Resolutions have been announced. You can check them before the voting starts.

LandsraadCouncil_Results.name: Landsraad Council Results
LandsraadCouncil_Results.desc: The Council's voting results are now available. You can check the results in the Landsraad window.

SpiceContractUnpaid.name: [$my(contract)] missed
SpiceContractUnpaid.desc: You did not fully pay the [$my(contract)]. You lost [Standing] because of it.

ShortOnContract.name: The [$my(contract)] is due soon
ShortOnContract.desc: Your [Spice] stock is currently too low to pay the [$my(contract)].

StandingPessimal.name: Pariah Tier
StandingPessimal.desc: You have reach the lowest Standing tier, Pariah. You incur heavy penalties and the wrath of the council by having a low [Standing].

StandingVeryLow.name: Lowered Standing Tier
StandingVeryLow.desc: You have reach the Very Low Standing tier. You incur heavy penalties. If your [Standing] decreases again, you might end up a Pariah.

StandingLow.name: Lowered Standing Tier
StandingLow.desc: You have reach the Low Standing tier. You incur penalties. If you [Standing] decreases again, these penalties might worsen.

WaterLow.name: Low Water
WaterLow.desc: You are low on [Water]. The max [Supply] of your units will not allow them to leave your territory for long.

BribeUnpaid.name: [$my(contract)] missed
BribeUnpaid.desc: You did not fully pay the [$my(contract)].

VillageControl.name: New Village Controlled
VillageControl.desc:
[!Village]s give you control of the surrounding Region, and come with several [!Building_Village] slots to help with your expansion.
Make sure you have enough [Militia] or nearby troops to defend your Villages.

LiberationComplete.name: Liberation Successful
LiberationComplete.desc: Your troops have finished liberating a [Village].

PillageComplete.name: Pillage Successful
PillageComplete.desc: Your troops have finished pillaging a [Village].

TaxCollectionComplete.name: Tax Collection Successful
TaxCollectionComplete.desc: Your troops have finished collecting tax in a [Village].

SietchPillageComplete.name: Pillage Successful
SietchPillageComplete.desc: Your troops have finished pillaging a [Sietch].

RenegadeArrived.name: Renegades have arrived
RenegadeArrived.desc: [Renegades] from the Faufreluches have landed on Arrakis. The [SpacingGuild] would be happy to have them removed.

RenegadeDismantle.name: Renegade Base Dismantled
RenegadeDismantle.desc: Your troops have finished dismantling a [RenegadeBase].

NuclearHeadReady.name: [NuclearHead] Ready
NuclearHeadReady.desc: A [NuclearHead] is ready to be launched.

OutpostLost.name: Village Lost
OutpostLost.desc: You can defend your Villages by buying [Militia] or stationing troops nearby.

SietchDevastated.name: Ally Sietch Devastated
SietchDevastated.desc: An Ally [!Sietch] has been devastated. Its [!Building_MB] has been deactivated.

SietchDetected.name: Sietch Detected
SietchDetected.desc: A new [Sietch] has been discovered in the area. They could be a threat until you befriend them.

SietchRestored.name: Sietch Restored
SietchRestored.desc: A [Sietch] has been repopulated by [Fremen-longname], bringing it back to its former glory. It is no longer [DevastatedSietch].

TreatyBroken.name: Treaty Broken
TreatyBroken.desc: [::faction::-longname] broke off ::treaty:: with you. Its effects are now cancelled.

TreatyEnded.name: Treaty Ended
TreatyEnded.desc: ::treaty:: with [::faction::-longname] just ended. You can talk to them again to negotiate a new [Treaty].

DiplomaticStatusWorsen.name: Truce Ended
DiplomaticStatusWorsen.desc:
[::faction::] has officially declared that their [Peace] with you has ended.
You are now in [War] and any [Treaty] have ended. You should expect an attack soon.

DiplomaticStatusBroken.name: Truce Broken
DiplomaticStatusBroken.desc: The treacherous [::faction::] has broken the [Peace] with you. You are now in [War] and any [Treaty] has ended. Their surprise attack gives them military advantage against you for a while.

DiplomaticStatusBroken_Traitor.name: Truce Broken
DiplomaticStatusBroken_Traitor.desc: You have broken the [Peace] with [::faction::]. You are now in [War] and any [Treaty] has ended.

DiplomaticStatusImprove.name: Diplomatic Status Improved
DiplomaticStatusImprove.desc: Your diplomatic status with [::faction::] has just increased from [::oldState::] to [::newState::].

TradeDeclined.name: Trade Declined
TradeDeclined.desc: Your proposed trade to [::faction::-playername] was deemed insufficient and was refused.

TradeAccepted.name: Trade Accepted
TradeAccepted.desc: Your proposed trade to [::faction::-playername] was deemed sufficient and was accepted.

OrnithopterLost.name: Ornithopter lost in sandstorm
OrnithopterLost.desc: We have lost all contact with an ornithopter after it entered a [Sandstorm].

VoteOptionRemoved.name: Votes removed
VoteOptionRemoved.desc: Your recent [PoliticalAgreement] have removed an option on which you planned to spend votes.

CMarketOpen.name: The CHOAM Market is now open
CMarketOpen.desc: You can buy and sell [CHOAMShare]s in order to gain economic benefits or even achieve an economic victory!

CMarketSharesOpening.name: New [CHOAMShare]s were made available to buy
CMarketSharesOpening.desc: The CHOAM has released ::value:: more shares for all parties to buy. This can turn the tides of ownership.

WorldEventStolen.name: Point of Interest Stolen
WorldEventStolen.desc: The event you were investigating has been resolved by another faction.

CharterLost.name: Lost [Charter]
CharterLost.desc: The ::resolution:: [Charter] and its effects are no longer active.

NuclearSiloConstructionStarted.name: [NuclearSilo] Construction Started
NuclearSiloConstructionStarted.desc: [::faction::-longname] has started the construction of their [NuclearSilo].

NuclearHeadProductionStarted.name: [NuclearHead] in Preparation
NuclearHeadProductionStarted.desc: [::faction::-longname] has started preparing a [NuclearHead] for launch.

AssassinationCancelled.name: Assassination cancelled
AssassinationCancelled.desc: The assassination attempt from [::faction::-longname] was cancelled.

MyAssassinationCancelled.name: Assassination cancelled
MyAssassinationCancelled.desc: The assassination attempt against [::faction::-longname] was cancelled.
