As you can see, you are currently selling most of the [Spice] you harvest.

M216.text:
If you drag the slider up or down, it changes the ratio of [Spice] sold.
To pay the [$my(contract)] in time, you should raise the Spice slider to stockpile [Spice] faster.

M213.text: Harvested [Spice] is either immediately sold for [Solari] or stockpiled to pay the [$my(contract)].

M215.text:
The slider on the top-left corner of the screen indicates how much [Spice] you sell to the CHOAM, and how much you stockpile.
As you can see, you are currently selling most of the [Spice] you harvest.

M216.text: To change how much spice you stockpile, you need to use the Spice Report. To get to the Spice Report, open the menu navigation wheel by pressing [OpenMainWheel], then choose the [SpiceReportWindow] option.

M213.text: Here is the [SpiceReport]. You can see the price for selling [Spice]. The base price is the same for everyone in the universe, but the real price also changes with your reputation and other factors.

M216.text:
Use [GaugeSliderUp] and [GaugeSliderDown] to increase of decrease the ratio of [Spice] you stockpile.
To pay the [$my(contract)] in time, you should raise the Spice slider to stockpile [Spice] faster. Try stockpiling at least 40% of the [Spice] you produce.

M213.text:
Every ::value(CCT_Spice_Report_Frequency):: days, you must have enough [Spice] in your stockpile to pay the [$my(contract)].
Store 80 [Spice] in your stockpile to ensure the next [$my(contract)] is paid.

You are too greedy, Noble Born. You cannot sell all the [Spice] or you won't have enough to pay the [$my(contract)].
I will explain again how the slider works. Pay attention this time.

M211.text:
Well done. With all this [Spice] in your stockpile, you will pay the next [$my(contract)] easily.
Now you can start making your [Spice] production more sustainable.
You are too greedy Noble Born, your [A_Harvester] has been eaten by Shai Hulud.
When destroyed, [A_Harvester]s are automatically rebuilt at the [Refinery] but it takes some time.
Your new [A_Harvester] is ready, deploy it when the [Sandworm] has left to resume the [Spice] harvesting.

M213.text: Your [A_Harvester] is working in the desert, making a lot of noise. It will eventually attract a [Sandworm].

M214.text: [A_Harvester]s return automatically to the [Refinery] when a [Sandworm] is near.

M213.text: There are two ways to operate [A_Harvester]s: [!Greedy_Harvester] and [!Safe_Harvester].

M214.text: In [!Greedy_Harvester], [A_Harvester]s remain on the field until the last seconds before the [Sandworm] surfaces.

M216.text: They gather a lot of [Spice] that way, but incur high risk of losing [A_Harvester] and [CrewPoint]s.

M215.text: In [!Safe_Harvester], [A_Harvester]s are recalled as soon as a worm is detected, ensuring a safe return.

M213.text: Assigning an [Ornithopter] to [A_Harvester]s allows for the use of [!Safe_Harvester] and reduce the chance of losing [A_Harvester]s in [!Greedy_Harvester].

M214.text: Select an [Ornithopter] and [MouseRight] right-click on a [A_Harvester] to assign it to worm spotting.
M214.padText: Select an [Ornithopter] and press [Game_RightClick] on a [A_Harvester] to assign it to worm spotting.

M212.text:
The [A_Harvester] has been working for a while, a [Sandworm] will come soon.
Show me that you know how to toggle between [!Safe_Harvester] and [!Greedy_Harvester].

M213.text: To put your [A_Harvester] in a specific mode, you have to select it and [MouseLeft] click on the corresponding button.
M213.padText: To put your [A_Harvester] in a specific mode, you have to select it. Then, press [Selection_SafeMode] to put it in [!Safe_Harvester] or [Selection_GreedMode] to put it in [!Greedy_Harvester].

M213.text:
Now, look! A [Sandworm] has been spotted.
Don't worry, if you have properly put it in [!Safe_Harvester], the [A_Harvester] is perfectly safe.

Your [A_Harvester] is safe and sound at the [Refinery]. It will redeploy on its own once the worm leaves the region.
This concludes today's lesson.

M214.text:
Now that you know everything about [Spice] harvesting, you might have a chance to prosper on Arrakis, Noble Born.
Tomorrow, we'll talk about Supply and Water.

M213.text: In this tutorial, we will learn about [Solari] Upkeep and Neighboring Effects.

We have a lot of [Authority].
It is time to Annex a new [Village].
Launch an attack on the neutral [Village]!
Good, now annex the neutral [Village]!

M211.text:
We are running short of [Water].
We cannot Annex the new [Village] for the time being.

We must produce more [Water] to meet the requirement.
The main way to produce [Water] is the [WindTrap] [!Village] [Building].

M212.text: [WindTrap]s turn [Wind] into [Water].

M211.text: Build a [WindTrap] in your [Village] with the highest [Wind].

M212.text: You can use the [Toggle_Zone_Info] key to display the [Wind].

M211.text: The [Village] you built your [WindTrap] in doesn't have enough [Wind] to produce the required [Water].

M212.text: Build your [WindTrap] in the other [Village] to maximize the production.

M211.text:
Good pick,
Now that you have enough [Water], you can [Annex] the [Village].
Congratulations!
Now we are gonna talk about [Water]!
Congratulations!
Now we are gonna talk about [Solari] Upkeep and Neighboring Effects!

[Building]s construction costs [Plascrete].
You don't have a lot of [Plascrete] at the moment.

M212.text: The [PlascreteFactory] produces [Plascrete] allowing you to construct more [Building]s.

M211.text: Build a [PlascreteFactory] .
Your [Plascrete] production is higher now, it will allow you to construct more [Building]s.

[Building]s have different [Solari] Upkeep.
You should pay attention to your Upkeep otherwise your [Solari] production will vanish and you will face bankruptcy.

M212.text: You can select a [Building] to look at its Upkeep.

M213.text: Select your [PlascreteFactory].

M212.text: [PlascreteFactory]s have one of the highest Upkeep, build them parsimoniously.

M213.text: You can hover your [Solari] stock to see the detail of all your Upkeep.

M214.text: Hover your [Solari] stock.

M213.text: Now we are gonna learn ways to reduce your [Solari] Upkeep.

M211.text: The [MaintenanceCenter] is a [Building] that reduces the Upkeep of the other [Building]s of [Village]s.

M212.text: Select the [Village] in the middle Region and build the [MaintenanceCenter].

M211.text:
You are building a [MaintenanceCenter] in the wrong [Village].
Build your [MaintenanceCenter] in the designated [Village].
The Upkeep of your [Village]s are now lower.

M212.text:
The Upkeep reduction of the [MaintenanceCenter] is a Neighboring Effect.
They also apply their effect to the adjacent Regions.

M211.text:
We highlighted the Regions where [Village]s are under the Neighboring Effect of your [MaintenanceCenter].
If you own them, these [Village]s have a reduced [Solari] Upkeep.
Now we are gonna show you a more "radical" method to reduce your Upkeep.

You can demolish a [Building] to remove its Upkeep.
It is sometimes necessary to maintain your [Solari] production positive.

M212.text: Demolish [Building]s to have more than 40 [Solari] production.

M213.text: Select a [Building] and [MouseLeft] click on [Demolish] to demolish it.

M212.text: When you are running short of [Solari], look at your Upkeep and try to lower it with what you just learnt.

M211.text:
Congratulations!
You know everything about [Solari] Upkeep now!

M213.text:
Good morning, my lord.
You asked for a refresher on everything a proud leader needs to protect his standing within the Faufreluches.
Let's begin today, with a few reminders on the [LandsraadCouncil].

We'll have a few mock councils today, but first let's look at our political capability.
On the right side of the screen, below the [LandsraadCouncil] button are two precious resources: [Influence] and [CouncilVote]
M213.padText:
We'll have a few mock councils today, but first let's look at our political capability.
On the right side of the screen, below the [LandsraadCouncil] icon are two precious resources: [Influence] and [CouncilVote]

M215.text:
[CouncilVote]s are our direct political power. When the [LandsraadCouncil] is in session, we can use that amount of votes. Not doing so would be a waste.
It's technically possible to increase the amount of [CouncilVote]s but most of the time, it will remain at 100.

M216.text:
[Influence] is much more versatile, but also less permanent.
Like [CouncilVote]s, we can use it on resolutions to increase their vote total, but unlike [CouncilVote]s, [Influence] used that way is lost.

M217.text:
[Influence] is also used for most diplomatic actions.
As we are constantly producing more [Influence], you should not hesitate to use it.

M213.text: Let's start our first mock council.
This is the [LandsraadCouncil]. While the council is in progress, the game is paused.

On the right side, you can see the [CouncilVote]s and [Influence] of every faction.
The bars represent the total power of a faction for this council, [CouncilVote]s and [Influence] combined.

M214.text:
You can also see the [MinorHouses]' [CouncilVote]s.
The [MinorHouses] have little interest in Arrakis and are rarely in agreement with each other. It's hard to predict how they will vote.

M213.text: In the middle of the screen are the three resolutions under examination during this council: [InfrastructureValidations], [VehicleRegulation], and [SurveillanceCommittee].

M215.text: Each resolution can be of two scopes: it either affects everybody equally, like [SurveillanceCommittee], or it only targets one faction, like the other two.

M216.text: All three resolutions are examinated at the same time. It means that you have to allocate your [CouncilVote]s intelligently.

M217.text: Some prefer to put all their [CouncilVote]s on a single resolution, while others distribute them between the three for a more diffuse impact.

M213.text: Now, let's vote. For each resolution, choose the outcome you prefer and increase the vote count, until you've used all your [CouncilVote]s.
M213.padText: Now, let's vote. For each resolution, choose the outcome you prefer with [Menu_LeftClick] and increase the vote count with [CycleSelect_Increase], until you've used all your [CouncilVote]s.

M213.text: If you keep increasing the vote count, it will use [Influence] instead, and the count will be blue. Click on the Confirm button whenever you are happy with your votes.
M213.padText: If you keep increasing the vote count, it will use [Influence] instead, and the count will be blue. Go to the Confirm button and press [Menu_LeftClick] whenever you are happy with your votes.

M213.text: Voting is over, sir! You can see how many votes each proposition has received. Hover on results to get the details of where the votes come from.
M213.padText: Voting is over! You can see how many votes each proposition has received. Go over the results to get the details of where the votes come from.

M214.text: Each resolution that was approved will apply its effects immediately, and until the next council in 20 days.

M213.text: The council is now over. You can unpause and close the window.
M213.padText: The council is now over. You can close the window with [Menu_Back] and unpause.

M213.text: The third important political resource is [Standing]. It represents how much the whole Landsraad community appreciates you.

M214.text: A [Standing_High] will give you many bonuses, while a [Standing_Low] will hurt your success in the politics.

M216.text: [Standing] can raise slowly over time, mostly through alliances. But it can decrease abruptly if you betray an ally.

M217.text: [Standing] can bring many advantages. And having a high [Standing] makes you eligible to [Charter]s.
Click on the [Landsraad] button, and let's go look at the [Charter]s.
Let's go look at the [Charter]s. To open the [Landsraad] outside of a council, open the menu navigation wheel by pressing [OpenMainWheel], then choose the [LandsraadWindow] option.

At the top of the [LandsraadCouncil] you can see the 5 [Charter]s.
Each [Charter] is a powerful position within the [LandsraadCouncil] that you can get elected to.

M218.text: Set your cursor on a [Charter] to see both its effect and the prerequisites to become a candidate.

M219.text:
As you can see, [Corrino-longname] is already eligible to two [Charter]s.
We need to catch up.

M217.text: I'll give you enough [Standing] and make you eligible to [CouncilSpeaker], so we can proceed.
Now, you can be elected to the [CouncilSpeaker] [Charter], but the subject still needs to be on the council agenda if you want to have a chance to get elected.

M218.text: For a [Charter] to appear on the ballot, it needs to have at least ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment):: [AgendaPriority] and to have the most [AgendaPriority].

M217.text:
To raise [AgendaPriority] for [CouncilSpeaker] above ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment)::, you can spend [Influence] by clicking on the Support button.
The earlier you support a [Charter] after a [LandsraadCouncil] the more it increases its priority. Don't wait too long.
M217.padText:
To raise [AgendaPriority] for [CouncilSpeaker] above ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment)::, you can spend [Influence] by pressing [Menu_LeftClick] on the Support button.
The earlier you support a [Charter] after a [LandsraadCouncil] the more it increases its priority. Don't wait too long.

M217.text: Now that you have raised its [AgendaPriority] above ::value(Landsraad_MinimumCharterInvestment)::, [CouncilSpeaker] will be examined in the agenda of the next [LandsraadCouncil]
You were supposed to raise [CouncilSpeaker] priority, but if you think it's better this way, so be it.
It's now time for our second mock council.

As you can see, the [Charter] has replaced a regular resolution.
Options on the ballot are restricted to eligible factions, but it otherwise functions as a normal resolution.

Other things to look out for are resolution modifiers.
Here, [WaterRegulation] is [LandsraadFavorite]. Look at the modifier's effect.

M218.text: Some resolution modifiers appear randomly, like [LandsraadFavorite], and some can be added by player factions.

M213.text: It's time to vote again, exactly like in the previous council.
Unlike other resolutions, [Charter]s last until a new vote is called for the same [Charter].

That's it. We've reviewed the customs of [LandsraadCouncil] and [Charter]s. But, as you know, proficiency with politics comes with years of experience.
That's all for today, my lord.

While you offworlders only care about [Spice], people who live on Dune are more concerned by [Water].
You should learn about this most precious resource before anything else. Let's do a little practical exercise.
We spotted a [CrashedShuttle] discovery, far away from your territory.

Investigate the [CrashedShuttle].
Select your [A_Trooper], then [MouseRight] right-click on the discovery.
M213.padText:
Investigate the [CrashedShuttle].
Select your [A_Trooper], then press [Game_RightClick] on the discovery.

M213.text:
Units lose [Supply] outside of your territory.
When out of [Supply], units will lose [Life] instead.

M215.text:
The [Supply] of your units is represented by the orange bar under their [Life] bar.
You can also look at the exact number by selecting the unit.

M214.text:
You don't have enough [Supply] to reach the [CrashedShuttle] alive.
Send your [A_Trooper] back to your [!Village] before they die from lack of [Supply].
Send your [A_Trooper] back to your [!Village].

M213.text: Near an ally [!Village] or your Main Base, units will regenerate [Supply].
Let's wait for your [A_Trooper] to be fully supplied.

The maximum [Supply] of your units is based on available [Water].
More [Water] means more [Supply], which means your units can go farther away.
We need more [Water] to reach the [CrashedShuttle].

M214.text: The easiest way to produce [Water] is to build [DewCollector]s in [!Village]s.

M213.text: Build a [DewCollector] in every of your three [!Village]s.
There are many other sources of [Water] but you will have to find them on your own.

M214.text: The [CrashedShuttle] is still a bit too far away. We should also look at our [Water] consumption.

M213.text:
[!Building_Village]s require [Water] to function. Parched people cannot work.
The many [!Building_Village]s in your [!Village]s consume most of the [Water] you produce. You should demolish some of them.

M212.text:
To demolish a [!Building_Village]:
Select the [!Building_Village] and [MouseLeft] click on [Demolish].

M213.text: Remember: [DewCollector]s are producing and not consuming [Water]. You should not demolish them.

M214.text: Demolish enough [!Building_Village]s to have 25 [Water].

M212.text:
To demolish a [!Building_Village]:
Select the [!Building_Village], open the selected [!Village] wheel by pressing [OpenSelectionWheel] and choose the Demolish Building option.
Remember: [DewCollector]s are producing and not consuming [Water]. You should not demolish them.
Demolish enough [!Building_Village]s to have 25 [Water].

M213.text: Now you have enough [Water] to reach the [CrashedShuttle].

There are many different discoveries in the world, each providing different benefits to the adventurous.
When you find a new discovery, select it to learn more about its effect, and how to recover it.
Complete the investigation of the [CrashedShuttle].
Good, now resolve the discovery.
M213.padText:
Good, now resolve the discovery.
Select it, and press [WorldEvent_RightAction].

M213.text:
Congratulations, Noble Born, you understand the importance of [Supply] and [Water].
You still have much to learn, but I've taught you all I know.

CBAS1.text:
Hello, House representatives.
A gang of renegades have managed to dodge their exile on Tupile. They have come to Arrakis to destabilize the [Spice] trade.

CBAS2.text:
Could you do the [SpacingGuild-shortname] a favor and get rid of the nuisance?
We have arranged passage for two of your ships.

line0.text: The CHOAM calls for help. This is an opportunity to take control of [::territory::] without a drop of blood. We only need to outbuy the other Houses.

line1.text:
The CHOAM is falling apart, just slightly, and everyone cries for a bailout! What happenened to the invisible hand?
Anyway, you can profit from this. It's easy, just buy some shares.

line2.text: CHOAM instability is bad for the whole Imperium. We should remind everyone why [Corrino-longname] is at the helm.

line3.text:
The CHOAM is in trouble. It's not good. We should help.
Also, [::territory::] is nice, don't you think? It would be a shame if it fell into the wrong hands.

CBAS1.text: This place is sacred for the Fremen. You might have good intentions, but others won't. Help us protect it, and we will part as friends.
You found our sacred sietch. Now what, offworlder? Some of us hope you might be better than the others. What do you have to say?
A snake has invited itself on Arrakis. The [::territory_owner::-adjective] supervisor of [::territory::] is a threat to both our plans and yours. We can help you remove him.
Now that we know of their secrets, the path forward is clear. Only start the assassination when you are ready. We cannot afford to waste time with failure.

line0.text: My fremen contacts have told me that a [Sietch] in the region has special value to the local population. We should try to find out more about this [SietchAncient] before it falls into the wrong hands.

line1.text:
I heard a rumor that a certain [Sietch] hidden in this region holds an especially great value. We should find this [SietchAncient] before the other houses.
Who knows what secrets it will contain?

line2.text: The story says an [SietchAncient] precious to the Fremen is located in this region. We must find it before a disloyal house gets hold of it.

line3.text: I've heard the fremen are protecting an [SietchAncient] full of secrets and wonders in this region. If we are perceptive enough, we may find it soon enough.

line0.text: I'm going to free this place from [::territory_owner::-adjective] influence. Their vigilance is down, they won't have time to react.

line1.text: We got close without [::territory_owner::-shortname] noticing. If we're fast enough, we might avoid a bloodshed. A battle of speed and wit, in the heart of the desert.

line2.text: [::territory_owner::] are too negligent. I'm going to take this place fast and clean.

line3.text: [::territory_owner::] have not taken good care of this place. If we attack swiftly, they might not be able to react.

line4.text: They've no idea we're here. I'm gonna break them like little twigs, before they even react.

line5.text: These fools have slipped, leaving [::territory::] at my mercy. I'll strike with force, fast and bloody.

line6.text: The [::territory_owner::-shortname] should have kept their eyes on [::territory::]. If we move fast, they will not be able to react.

line7.text: The [::territory_owner::-shortname] are not good keeper of this land. They have not even noticed we're here. Let's strike them where it hurts.

line0.text: We've planned this assault for months. They know we are coming. We have to win. For Atreides!

line1.text: This battle is decisive. We will succeed.

line2.text: The blood of [::territory_owner::-adjective] men will flow today. We take their [ConquestBase] and the land is ours.

line3.text: We can expect heavy resistance, but we've come in force. It'll be a great battle where boys become men, and glory is gained by all!

line0.text: We need to increase our ground footprint on Arrakis to be legitimate in our claim. The [::territory::] is currently unclaimed land. It is our best candidate for a relatively peaceful annexation.

line1.text: The [::territory::] is unclaimed. If we grab the land before anyone else has the time to do it, it might form a good base for our economy on Arrakis.

line2.text: We cannot rule without imposing our will on the population. With enough people under our thumb, we gain control of their dream and fear! You know how powerful that is!

line3.text: The [::territory::] is a nice piece of land, but war is coming. Will it be spared under our protection?

line0.text: The [::territory::] is a critical land for economical growth and local support. We need to secure it to ensure our future on Arrakis. I expect heavy resistance.

line1.text: The [::territory::] is a strategic point for our plan on Arrakis. I'm surprised that it is still unclaimed. We should demonstrate our superiority here, once and for all.

line2.text: The [::territory::] has been empty for so long. What a mistake! It's the key to domination on Arrakis! And it should be ours!

line3.text: I don't like to bring our wars on these lands, but the [::territory::] is critical. We cannot let the other Houses get to it first.

line0.text: The prestigious [::signature_region::] could be very useful to our development. Nobody has taken claim on it yet, but it won't be the case for very long.

line1.text: We should take [::signature_region::] and hold onto it to demonstrate to all the supremacy of [Corrino].

line2.text: [::signature_region::] is right here for the taking. Everyone knows it. It's going to be a race! Or maybe a brawl... Anyway, we should prevail.

line3.text: [::signature_region::] is such a beautiful sight. But it'll be even better with our flag on it. Don't let the other Houses take it.

line0.text: We've detected an imminent assault on your position. Hold them off until I arrive. We're going to get you through this, you hear me?

line1.text: An assault on your position has been detected. I'm coming to you with a full legion of reinforcements. Today is not the day you die, soldier. It's the day you rise up and hold.

line2.text: The enemy is nearly there. I'm coming to end their foolish incursion. Hold on until then.

line3.text: They are coming for you. How dare they defy Father's authority? It cannot stand! Hold your position at all cost, soldier, we are coming.

line4.text: The weaklings are trying to take our land from us. I'm coming to whip them. Just hold on until I get there, eh!

line5.text: Enemy forces are converging on your position. This pitiful land is ours! You have to hold position until I come with reinforcement. Everyone is expendable in this fight!

line6.text: An assault is coming on your position. We're coming with reinforcement, but you'll have to hold off on your own until then.

line7.text: We did not anticipated this assault, and you are going to pay the price. I'm bringing reinforcement as fast as possible. Good luck!

line0.text: They are already here. Chin up, soldier! We're on our way.

line1.text: The enemy is at your door. Ring the bell and hold the wall! We're coming.

line2.text: They are here. Hold!

line3.text: I think they have started the attack. Hold tight, soldier.

line4.text: They're already there, eh! I'll hurry. Leave some for me!

line5.text: They are already on you. Don't let them take one inch!

line6.text: They are already here. Keep your cool, soldier. We're coming to rescue you.

line7.text: The assault has begun. Hold tight!

line0.text: The cavalry has arrived! Let's show them what Atreides are capable of.

line1.text: I see you haven't lost hope. Now, friends are here. It's time to push despair to their side of the field.

line2.text: I'm here. Take me to them and I'll end this.

line3.text: We've arrived! Well done, soldier. Now, the hunter becomes the prey!

line4.text: Eh eh! I'm here. I'll make them suffer!

line5.text: I'm here. We'll punish them for their arrogance, together!

line6.text: We're here. Let's show them bravery. This one is for the history books.

line7.text: The reinforcements have arrived. You did good. Let's finish this cleanly!

line0.text: There is noise from our fremen contacts that they want [::territory_owner::-longname] gone. I think we should give them a hand. If we can prove ourselves, they'll be more favorable to us.

line1.text: Eh eh! The [::territory_owner::-shortname]s have trouble with the fremen. Gives me an idea. Maybe we could use the fremen for once, and get rid of the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s.

line2.text: A kerfuffle is happening in [::territory::]. We should take this opportunity to get an advantage over [::territory_owner::-longname]. If we play our cards right, the locals will take our side.

line3.text: The fremen of [::territory::] are restless. They want the [::territory_owner::-shortname] gone. Let's help them with that.

CBFU1.text: The [::territory_owner::-shortname] have ruled here long enough. You've been helpful, stranger. If you are ready to finish the job, we're making an assault on their base now.

line0.text: This region is mostly undefended. We're going to take it just under their nose, but we cannot bring any more forces to the fight without attracting attention.

line1.text: The [::territory_owner::-shortname]s have left this place unsupervised. They might enjoy a more gentle master. I'll take it with a small force to avoid drawing attention.

line2.text: My commando is on position to take [::territory::] from the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s. No reinforcements are available. I don't need them, anyway.

line3.text: I've taken the initiative to lead a small force to take [::territory::]. Don't worry about it. I will hire [Mercenaries]s if needed be.

line4.text: I'm gonna beat the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s to a pulp. Gotta keep a low profile, though, take them by surprise.

line5.text: My special commando is more than enough to take this pitiful land from the [::territory_owner::-shortname]s.

line6.text: A small force and a pouch of gold is all I need to take such a badly defended region. You can trust me.

line7.text: This is a good opportunity to show [::territory_owner::-longname] how it's done. I and a few units are enough to shake things up.

line0.text: You deceitful bastard! I'm going to send you back where you came from.

line1.text: The snake has no choice but to deceive. The hawk has no choice but to end its life.

line2.text: You're out of luck. I'm here.

line3.text: You thought you could get away with an assault behind Father's back. It is my duty to stop you.

line4.text: Eh eh eh! Finally a bit of excitement on this wretched planet. I gonna whip you, little worm!

line5.text: What do we got here? A little worm who thinks he can take on the griffin. You'll regret this.

line6.text: Only the weak use such treacherous ways. And I cannot allow weakness to prevail.

line7.text: I'm used to these kind of treacheries, and I've always come up victorious. You don't impress me.

CBSC1.text: Sietch leaders throughout this region are too prideful to follow any imperial laws. Someone ought to get them in line.
Now that everyone's here, I hope they're ready for some shaking.

CBSC3.text: We must take control of this territory

CBSC4.text: Very well, and now to expand out grasp...

CBKA.text: [Arrakeen] holds a strong, active shield, we must deactivate it from the inside. It so happens that I had a short talk with Dr. Yueh...

line0.text: [!Leto] is hiding behind the shield of [Arrakeen]. Any attack would be pointless until we find a way to deactivate it from the inside.

line1.text: The weak [Atreides-shortname] are cowering in their burrow. Let's take out their defenses and hit them with all we got.

line2.text: Sadly, we must end [Atreides-longname]'s illegitimate occupation of Arrakis. We must first disable their shield, then [Arrakeen] will fall easily.

line0.text: The shield is down. If we act fast, we will benefit from the element of surprise.

line1.text: Attack! Put an end to the [Atreides-adjective] line!

line2.text: It's a shame to see [Atreides-shortname] fall so low, but they're lucky we're the one to end their misery.

line0.text: The [Harkonnen-shortname]s are holed up in their den. [Carthag] is a formidable fortress, but we've seen worse.

line1.text: The ugly fortress in its crack is hard to break. We must take our time and be careful.

line2.text: The [Harkonnen-adjective] fortress present a serious challenge, but we'll rise to the occasion.

line0.text: The fortress is vulnerable. It's time to give the assault.

line1.text:
The evil Baron in his castle is ready to fall. All the hate that he spread to his people will finally eat him alive.
With such a large meal, everyone will have a share.

line0.text: The so-called emperor of the whole universe is stuck in the sand. We just have to destroy his last few ships and we'll have free reign on Arrakis.

line1.text: The fallen emperor is weakened. We'll show him and the whole galaxy what strength looks like. For Atreides!

line2.text: Sardaukars won't be enough to save the emperor this time! This battle will be in every history books. We only have to take care of a few frail ships.

line0.text: Ah! That was easy! ... Is the old fool going to try defending himself?

line1.text: One bird down. Two still singing. The emperor is probably not gonna let us win so easily. ... I have a bad feeling.

line2.text: That was glorious. But beware of the old emperor, he still have a few tricks up his sleeves. Something is coming.

line0.text: Only one ship left. The emperor is cornered. All his pitiful might won't be enouh this time.

line1.text: It's too soon for celebration. The dying lion still has claws.

line2.text: Beautiful! We should expect a last-ditch effort to win from the poor emperor, but greatness is around the corner.

line0.text: The [Ecaz-adjective] artists have overstayed their welcome. I like their style but they shouldn't oppose [Atreides-longname]. Let's take their glorified crib and end this non-sense.

line1.text: That is [Foliage]? It's supposed to be beautiful. I ain't getting it, it's ugly! I see why we should burn it down, now.

line2.text: I don't care about art. Life is not that complicated: they oppose the Emperor, they die.

SH1.text: To produce [Spice], you need to build a [F_Harvester_Mobile] and deploy it on a [SpiceArea] in a neutral or owned region.

VI1.text:
There are 4 different ways to win the game:
1. Hegemony Victory: Reach ::value(Game_Victory_HegemonyScore):: [Hegemony].
2. Domination Victory: Eliminate every other player by destroying their bases or assassinating their leaders.

VI2.text:
3. Political Victory: Get elected to [DuneGovernor] in the Landsraad and keep the charter for 2 councils.
4. Economic Victory: Own more than 50% of the CHOAM by buying more [CHOAMShare]s than your opponents.

RA1.text: Raiders can come out of hidden Sietches to free Villages from your control.

RA2.text: Each raid suffered gives a chance to reveal the hidden [Sietch] it came from.

MB1.text: [!Building_MB] slots in your Main Base are split into Districts of different sizes.

MB2.text: If you fill all the slots of a district with only one type of [!Building_MB], it will grant you a bonus depending on the District's size.

SE1.text:
You can assign [Agent]s to various postings to get different bonuses.
Each agent also has a special trait.

SE2.text:
Assigned [Agent]s generate [Intel] and other resources depending on their posting.
[Intel] allows you to launch spying missions.

SE3.text: Assigned [Agent]s also improve the relevant [!Infiltration] level, unlocking more advanced missions.

SS1.text:
[Sandstorm] reduce production in nearby Villages.
They may destroy military units, [Ornithopter]s and [Harvester]s alike.

SS2.text:
Controlled villages can shelter military units.
Still, the best way to survive a [Sandstorm] is to flee.

SI1.text: You can trade with a [Sietch] to improve your Relations towards it.

SI2.text: If you reach max Relation with a [Sietch] in your territory, you can forge an alliance (using an [Agent]) to unlock its passive ability.

SI1.text: You can trade with a [Sietch] to improve your Relations towards it.

SIF2.text: If you reach max Relation with a [Sietch], you can forge an alliance to unlock its passive ability. Allied [Sietch]s have an authority [!Upkeep].

DI1.text:
The trade screen allows you to trade resources and manage your diplomatic status.
Put resources on both sides of the exchange to propose a trade.

DI2.text:
There are two diplomatic statuses between factions: [War] and [Peace].
In [War], you can attack the other faction freely, while [Peace] allows you to use powerful treaties in a trade.

DI3.text:
To go from [War] to [Peace], use the [ImproveRelations] in a trade.
It costs less [Influence] to propose the longer you have been in [War].

DI4.text:
While you are in [Peace], you can attack the other faction, but doing so will brand you a traitor.
Instead, you can pay [Influence] to declare officially that the [Peace] is ending without incurring any penalty.

CM1.text: The CHOAM Market allows you to buy and sell shares of the Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles, that own all legal trade in the Imperium.

CM2.text:
Share value rises and falls depending on availability and total Spice sold to the CHOAM.
Every now and then, new shares will be produced by the CHOAM, increasing the total number of shares.

CM3.text: If a player ever has more than half the shares, they become majority holders and immediately win the game.

LC1.text: Three resolutions are put up to vote at every Council.

LC2.text: Each Faction can use [CouncilVote]s or [Influence] to pass or counter Resolutions.

LC3.text:
Some special Resolutions, called [Charter]s, may be unlocked during the game.
Each [Charter] has its own eligibility conditions that you'll have to fulfill if you want to get elected to one of them.

MU1.text:
Military units have several statistics.
[Power], [Life], [Armor] and a special Ability.

MU2.text:
Units lose [Supply] as they move outside of your territory.
A Unit with no [Supply] will die from exposure.

MU3.text:
The maximum [Supply] of your units is based on available [Water].
More [Water] means more [Supply], which means your units can go farther away.

MU4.text: [Supply] is refilled while staying close to a controlled [Village] or Main Base.

HS1.text:
You have enough Intel on a faction to launch a mission against it.
Missions are hostile manoeuvers toward the targeted Faction.

HS2.text:
By sending an Agent, you could steal some of its goods or drastically reduce its surviving odds on Arrakis.
If mission achieves success without being discovered, your Faction won't get Standing penalties!

HS3.text:
During a mission, your [Agent] can face Complications that affects the success rate. You will have the opportunity to cancel the Mission.
they can also be discovered by the targeted Faction. When discovered, the target can try to capture or wiretap them.

OP1.text: Villages are an important part of our growth. You have to choose what to build and where.

OP2.text:
They contain several [!Building_Village] slots. Click on one to bring up a list of [!Building_Village]s.
Additional slots can be added by paying [Plascrete].

OP3.text:
Each [!Building_Village] has a cost and [!Upkeep], generally in [Solari] and [Plascrete].
Overextension can quickly lead you to run out of essential resources.

OP4.text: You should hire Militia to defend your Villages from Raiders or nearby enemies.

EX1.text:
Exploring Arrakis is vital to find the precious [Spice] as well as other resources.
Each region contains points of interest [?] that your [Ornithopter]s can recon.

SH1.text: To produce [Spice] you must capture a Village in a region with a [SpiceArea].

SH2.text: Then you'll need to build a [$my(refinery)] and deploy its [$my(harvester)] to start harvesting.

NV1.text:
Villages are defended by Militias.
If you defeat them, your units will occupy the Village, unlocking the possibility of taking control using [Authority], or pillaging for Resources.

RU1.text:
Each military unit has a training and an [!Upkeep] cost.
They also take up a certain amount of Command Points, which limits the size of your army.

WA1.text:
The more Villages and military units you control, the more water you will need.
If your [Water] is negative, you will see unrest in your Villages, leading to rebellions.

WA2.text: Wind Traps gather [Water] in a Region depending on its wind strength.

HF1.text:
Harvesters will attract [Sandworm].
At the first wormsign, you will have to recall your Harvester if you don't want it to be destroyed along with its crew.

HF2.text: You can increase [Spice] production by adding more [CrewPoint] to your [$my(Harvester)]s.
You can increase [Spice] production by adding more [CrewPoint] to your [$my(Harvester)]s.

ST1.text:
Every ::value(CCT_Spice_Report_Frequency):: days, you will have to pay the [$my(contract)].
Failing to do so will cause various penalties.

ST2.text:
Collected [Spice] can be stockpiled to pay taxes, or sold to the CHOAM for [Solari].
You can change the amount of Spice you sell, in favor of stocks.

ST3.text: The Spice to Solaris exchange rate changes frequently, think to check it.

ST1.text:
Every ::value(CCT_Spice_Report_Frequency):: days, you will have to pay the [$my(contract)].
Failing to do so will cause various penalties.

ST2.text:
You will also receive [Spice] paid in taxes by great houses present on Arrakis.
Don't rely exclusively on it as they can potentially not pay up.

STC3.text:
Harvested [Spice] can be stockpiled to pay the fee, or sold to the CHOAM for [Solari].
You can change the amount of Spice you sell, in favor of stocks.

ST3.text: The Spice to Solaris exchange rate changes frequently, think to check it.

line0.text: When we deactivate the shield, it will not stay down for long. We have to attack immediately.

line1.text: Timing is of the essence. Only put the shield down right before the attack.

line0.text: The shield is back up. Retreat, regroup and start again.

line1.text: We didn't get them this time. Let's start again from the start!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries "territory" is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, sinister, sombre, can insist on "crush"
line0.text: Conquering Arrakis will mean fighting for the smallest patch of land, the tiniest grain of sand, the slightest mote of dust. Any stretch of territory counts when you must corner the enemy and crush them.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries squeeze is a specific book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, sinister on the first sentence, can be a bit onctuous on the last sentence (we could hear that the Baron and Piter share a common cruelty)
line0.text: Without House Harkonnen to squeeze them, the villages of Arrakis are purposeless. Only you, Baron, know best how to profit from this planet.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries militia is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious but he is also mocking the Baron (maybe smiling a bit). Last sentence: cruel, calm, like a predator
line0.text:
The villages have barely had time to rejoice. They had barely started celebrating your departure from Arrakis, and here you are again.
I can't wait to see the terror on their faces when they see the Harkonnen army slaughtering their militias.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit despising, confident, arrogant
line0.text: No doubt, those wretched clod villages will be dazzled by the sheer splendor of our House. I have a feeling that once subdued, they will come to rely on our blessings.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, calm, focused
line0.text: I fear we will need to resort to violence to subdue the villages of Arrakis. Considering the locals lived under the Harkonnens' yoke for decades, they'll greatly distrust any foreign House.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising and determined (about to invade innocent villages to find manpower)
line0.text: Our people can't harness the resources of Arrakis as well as the locals would. We need a workforce, which is qualified and accustomed to this wretched climate – the laborers of these villages will suffice.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat "your enemies" is neutral and do not refer to anyone specific
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, serious
line0.text: The more territory you hold, the more you deprive your enemies of resources. No House, however powerful, can rely solely on outside support. We'll need to seize as much land as possible from the enemy.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat "territory" is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, serious, convinced that this territory would be helpful
line0.text: My lord, this territory is of strategic importance in the conquest of Arrakis. We can use its resources to sustain the troops' efforts. We must make the most of the smallest patch of land.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a specitif game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, serious
line0.text: Based on the scouts' reports, this territory could serve as a rear base for our troops. Securing our progress on Arrakis is crucial. We must capture it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring folk of pan and graben is a specific book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, neutral, polite and serious. We can feel that Fenring is despising toward the Harkonnen.
line0.text: The Harkonnens oppressed the folk of pan and graben when they held Arrakis. By comparison, any other ruling power would seem preferable to them. Once we control their villages, they will follow you out of fear of falling into the hands of a House crueler than yours.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically says "Majesty", not "Your Majesty" territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, neutral, polite and serious. Killing villagers is not important.
line0.text: Majesty, this territory is dotted with villages, which will be quick to challenge your authority. My advice is to deploy your troops there before they fall under your rivals' influence.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically says "Majesty", not "Your Majesty" territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, neutral, polite and serious.
line0.text: This territory is equally rich in manpower and resources. Occupying these villages should stabilize our supply lines in the continuing conquest of Arrakis. This was a wise choice on your part.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm but firm
line0.text: You cannot let this territory be seized by any other House than our own. Our army needs these resources – the spaceships cannot supply us forever.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm and then, more and more confident and gentle (she is speaking to her dear husband). She clearly believes what she is saying
line0.text: These villages will not welcome us with open arms. All they know of the Imperium is the Harkonnens’ domination. But when they see the care with which you treat your people, they will rally your cause. Have no fear, my love – I know you will garner their loyalty.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm and determined, maybe smiling at the end of the sentence.
line0.text: Don’t let the hostility of the people of Arrakis wear you down. They’ll fight back against our drones, to be sure, but once their villages are ours, they will benefit from the finest in Ixian technology. And once they’re used to all the advantages House Vernius offers, they’ll wonder how they ever lived without us.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, calm, maybe jalous or defiant when talking about the Great Houses.
line0.text: These villages have never been a great source of revenue, but our contacts there are invaluable. Without a support base, the Smugglers won't be able to develop their operations enough to compete with the Great Houses.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising and casual, upset/bored: fighting against those Great House is not a big deal
line0.text: It seems that one of your opponents has their eye on these villages and the nearby resources. Ah! It reminds me of the Harkonnens' rule over Arrakis. Why must these outsiders make trade so complicated?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: upset than the foreign people thread to wipe out their hard work. Then, very determined, ready to fight
line0.text: We put in decades of effort to establish contacts in every village in this territory, and these outsiders are about to wipe it all out. We must stay in control, Father, or the Smugglers won't amount to more than a bunch of flea-bitten market vendors. Our family deserves better !

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar folk of pan and graben is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: deadly serious, concerned
line0.text: The folk of the pan and graben will not withstand the offworlders' assault for long. If their villages fall, their numbers will strengthen our enemies. We must help them before that happens.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Stilgar
folk of pan and graben is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit sad/regretful the city men are not true fremen. Serious
line0.text: We cannot rely on the men of the cities, sister. They have Fremen blood, but they have forgotten how to live in the desert. In their time, they submitted to the Harkonnens. If we don't support them now, the folk of the pan and graben will once again serve the offworlders' ambitions.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: alerting Liet, then upset, aggressive and determined Cielagos : Furry bats of Arrakis trained for communication by the Fremen.
line0.text:
The cielagos have returned to the sietch! The offworlders have established their bases in this territory!
Those wormfaced scum must already think they're the great lords of the desert. Let's prove them wrong, sister!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit amused at first, even dreamy or lyrical Then, serious and determined, even a bit onctuous
line0.text:
House Harkonnen aren't the only ones taking an interest in this territory! So many souls eager to die of thirst in an endless desert...
No one knows Arrakis as well as you do. Your men have already colonized these lands, and they'll be up to the challenge again.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: surprised, despising, amused
line0.text: Why is your heart set on this territory, Baron? It's as dusty and dry as the others. Do you intend to use it as a rear base? As a bridge to more appealing land? Or is it the resources described in the latest reports?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and neutral, then a bit ironic, taunting the Baron
line0.text: According to our spies, your enemies have already taken up position in this territory. We've also detected a few Fremen and some resources, which would aid your progress. Needless to say, every territory counts towards conquering Arrakis. As you well know.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, determined
line0.text: I regret to inform you we're not alone in eyeing this territory. Our scouts have spotted enemy installations, which will deploy if we let them. You must thwart them, Mother.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz filmbooks is a specific book term territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: thinking, calm
line0.text: I find a certain beauty in this territory. These deserts aren't as dull as the filmbooks suggested. I bet it will inspire many artists when our House takes it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, determined
line0.text: This territory seems ideal for our expansion, Mother. Beneath all that sand are the resources we need to continue our conquest of Arrakis and drive out our rivals.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a specific game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, determined
line0.text: None of your rivals have captured this territory, but our agents say they've taken up position there. We must ensure that the locals submit to the Atreides' authority rather than your enemies'.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, determined, respectful
line0.text: Judging by the information taken from the Harkonnens, this territory contains more resources than meets the eye. The same reports also mention a number of villages, which might cause trouble. Should we try to placate them through diplomatic means?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat Spacing Guild is a specific book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, serious then determined
line0.text: I reviewed the reports the Harkonnens sent to the Spacing Guild before they left. They reveal that this territory was harvested up to the last minute – we should find resources there that would prove valuable in the conquest of Arrakis.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm and respectful
line0.text: None of the Great Houses have yet claimed this territory, but it won't be long now. Our scouts report that your rivals have set up outposts there. They need to be shown the superiority of the Empire.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring
line0.voice_notes: Tone: facual at first then thinking then doubting or defiant twoard Kynes
line0.text: Reports prepared by Kynes described this territory as arid and of little use. Recent expeditions, however, indicate the presence of many deposits. I wonder what kind of game your planetologist was playing…

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious
line0.text: Your enemies' presence in this territory points to its strategic importance. The Empire can ill afford to backtrack in the face of the Great Houses of the Landsraad – you have no choice but to capture these lands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: confident
line0.text: With this territory’s resources, we can establish our dominance over Arrakis and support our army. Your rivals will soon be forced to give up and accept defeat.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm as she was reading a report, then determined and firm on the last sentence
line0.text: The analytic machines have selected this territory as among the most strategic to our goals. Its location, its resources, its villages… everything about these lands makes them a perfect fit for our needs. We must not let them fall into our enemies’ hands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined and confident. She is not angry about their enemies, she knows that her husband can defeat them.
line0.text: Your enemies already have a foothold in this territory, but no matter. You will have no trouble conquering it before them. No one knows how to exploit Arrakis more effectively than we do. With the technology of House Vernius at our disposal, our victory is assured.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising
line0.text:
Such ambition! Your rivals think they can take possession of this territory! They know virtually nothing of the desert, yet they're certain they can conquer it! Ha!
Not only can we capture it before them, we can harvest it a hundred times more efficiently!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined
line0.text: The Smugglers must increase their influence if they hope to compete with the Great Houses. We must tighten our grip on Arrakis! This territory's resources would give us a head start.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm and serious, trying to appear more obedient and mature than he is.
line0.text: I have learned from your instruction, Father. I am well aware that corruption is an expensive enterprise, in terms of both men and solari, which is why I recommend that you seize this territory. We could use its resources to recruit new spies and add to the bribes we can offer.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, then determined and solemn
line0.text: The offworlders hope to find here the resources they need to conquer Dune. Their ‘thopters are already searching the desert for the slightest trace of spice. The Fremen must not let them advance any further.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, teaching Liet
line0.text: The more territories your enemies have, the harder it will be to stop them. Take care that they don't seize this one, for its resources are rich and its villages prosperous.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious
line0.text: The tribes must be able to move about freely. When forced to avoid your enemies' territories, our warriors waste time and water. This one must not fall into their hands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit surprise, as if he was reading a new report. More deep, serious even Machiavellian/scheming on the last sentence
line0.text: Your conquest of Arrakis could be more profitable than we think. If the reports on this territory are accurate, it could allow you to invest in the CHOAM. The influence to be garnered by House Harkonnen would be most valuable.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual on the first sentence, then smiling, amused.
line0.text: As expected, the spice war is destabilizing the CHOAM. It would be a shame not to take advantage of this, Baron. Buying shares at a low cost would strengthen House Harkonnen's influence in the Imperium.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term directorship is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused, casual. Then serious, arrogant
line0.text:
The conquest of Arrakis has had entertaining effects on our merchant friends – it would seem that the CHOAM is about to collapse. It's the perfect time to buy the Houses Minor's shares on the cheap.
We would prepare a future directorship and demonstrate our strength to our rivals.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term House minor is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising, amused then determined and motivated on the last sentence.
line0.text: The entertainment offered by our conquest is not to everyone's liking – the Houses Minor seemed especially ill at ease. According to our contacts at the CHOAM, they're desperate to get rid of their shares. Let's seize the opportunity to buy them at a good price.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term House minor is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, factual, even a bit concerned. Then serious and determined
line0.text:
The conquest of Arrakis is disrupting the spice trade, and the CHOAM along with it. The Houses Minor are panicking – and therefore liable to sell their shares to the highest bidder.
My lord, I would suggest buying them before it falls into your enemies' hands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat CHOAM is a book and game term shares is a game term House minor is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, worried then serious and determined
line0.text: The CHOAM's status is worrisome, sire, but I also see an opportunity. Were you to buy enough shares, your enemies would be less inclined to attack you. They wouldn't be able to sell their spice without your consent.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring CHOAM is a book and game term solari is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, factual
line0.text: The CHOAM is struggling. Should the organization collapse, your Empire's balance will be threatened. Majesty, we have no choice but to support it. The flow of Solaris from your end will reassure the merchants that your conquest of Arrakis is proceeding smoothly.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Hasimir Fenring CHOAM is a book and game term
House minor is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, factual
line0.text: The Houses Minor are in a panic. They're all trying to sell their shares in the CHOAM en masse. The shares must be bought – it's the only way to reassure the market in the Imperium that your conquest is going well. If it collapses, Arrakis would be the last of your worries.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: she can be a bit upset, as if the behavior of the House Minor was irrationnel but then, she appears confident and more and more casual.
line0.text: The Houses Minor seem to believe that the spice war will destroy the CHOAM. We must prove them wrong! Let us buy their shares with the resources acquired on Arrakis. Their fears will be swept aside, and your rivals will be put on notice.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: at first, she is thinking, almost smiling (as if she has predicted Minor Houses' behavior). Then soft and gentle but determined (she has found the solution and just waits to apply it).
line0.text:
I did not expect the CHOAM to suffer the effects of this war so quickly…
My husband, we must not allow the Imperium's economy to collapse because of the conquest of Arrakis. We must use this territory's wealth to support it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: neutral, telling a story, then serious when saying "he is not the only one". Casual (even smiling?) on the last sentence
line0.text:
You have taught me to listen for rumors, Father. Allow me to tell you of one that has piqued my interest.
In a recent transaction, one of our merchants noticed that a man he was dealing with appeared quite agitated. This representative of a House Minor informed the merchant that his lord is trying to sell his CHOAM shares by any means necessary. And it seems he's not the only one.
If the Company is really in trouble, no one will challenge our acquiring an interest in it. Could this be the opportunity we've been waiting for?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, explaining
line0.text:
The effects of the spice war are beginning to spread throughout the Empire. According to our spies, it's now CHOAM's turn to suffer the consequence. The value of its shares has plummeted in recent days, and the Houses Minor are rushing to sell.
Do you think it would be advisable to acquire an interest in the Company? We won't have many chances like this one.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: thinking at first, as if he was reading a report. Then, hesistate on the word "share". A bit puzzled (or overwhelmed) on the last two sentences
line0.text: Our contacts amongst the smugglers are in a panic. They say it's related to something those thieves call CHOAM. Some have mentioned buying shares. Great gods! Have you any idea what they mean?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: fatalistic, resigned.
line0.text: The Guild and CHOAM, the Great Houses and the Faufreluches, all these things the offworlders are obsessed with… You understand them better than we do, Liet. If these shares can help the tribes liberate Dune, then the Fremen must acquire some.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, worried but not panicking. Could speak quicker than usual. Deep and sombre on the last sentence
line0.text:
The latest reports are worrying, Baron. The enemy is preparing to launch a massive assault on this position, and their army has already reached the border.
Your rear bases have been warned, but I'm sorry to say that troops are moving too slowly. This territory's defense depends on you alone.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, worried but not panicking. Could speak quicker than usual. Deep and sombre on the last sentence
line1.text:
The latest reports are worrying, Baron. The enemy is preparing to launch a massive assault on this position, and their army has already reached the border.
Your rear bases have been warned, but I'm sorry to say that troops are moving too slowly. This territory's defense depends on you alone.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term "Ecazis" are people from planet Ecaz, it's a book term here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, tense, serious
line0.text:
Mother! Our hold on this territory is compromised. We haven't heard from our scouts since they reached the border. I fear they've been intercepted… An enemy attack seems imminent.
I'm attempting to contact our rear bases to get reinforcements, but I urge you to defend this territory. Our troops may not make it in time.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term "Ecazis" are people from planet Ecaz, it's a book term here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, tense, serious
line1.text:
Mother! Our hold on this territory is compromised. We haven't heard from our scouts since they reached the border. I fear they've been intercepted… An enemy attack seems imminent.
I'm attempting to contact our rear bases to get reinforcements, but I urge you to defend this territory. Our troops may not make it in time.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, worried, even angry toward the enemy. Very determined to fight on the last sentence
line0.text:
Our scouts report enemy troops amassing at the border. The assault could begin any moment!
Your reserve troops are too far away – they won't get to us in time. We must hold out until they arrive!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Hasimir specifically say "Majesty" and not "Your majesty" here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, factual, then despising about the "Great House", he is angry toward this traitor. Then factual, serious and sombre.
line0.text:
Our agents are clear: The enemy is about to launch an assault. I don't know why a Great House would attack you directly, but it seems they've been preparing for this for some time. Unlike us.
Your reserve troops most likely won't arrive in time to defend this position. We're alone against our opponent, Majesty.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Hasimir specifically say "Majesty" and not "Your majesty" here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, factual, then despising about the "Great House", he is angry toward this traitor. Then factual, serious and sombre.
line1.text:
Our agents are clear: The enemy is about to launch an assault. I don't know why a Great House would attack you directly, but it seems they've been preparing for this for some time. Unlike us.
Your reserve troops most likely won't arrive in time to defend this position. We're alone against our opponent, Majesty.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit affraid or preoccupied and then more calm but determined
line0.text:
We’ve intercepted an enemy message…
Your rival is preparing to attack this territory! His army is already on the march. My love, you must be ready to use every tool at your disposal to buy time until reinforcements arrive. This territory is ours. We won’t let anyone take it from us.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.voice_notes: Tone: a bit affraid or preoccupied and then more calm but determined
line1.text:
We’ve intercepted an enemy message…
Your rival is preparing to attack this territory! Her army is already on the march. My love, you must be ready to use every tool at your disposal to buy time until reinforcements arrive. This territory is ours. We won’t let anyone take it from us.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"The enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: scared, about to panic
line0.text:
Father! I have catastrophic news! The enemy is upon us!
Our spies have seen hundreds of their men massing at the border! They're mounting an assault!
We must defend ourselves. I've already contacted our allies in the other territories, but I don't know how long they'll take to reach us. Without them, we can only rely on ourselves!
