Our spies have seen hundreds of their men massing at the border! They're mounting an assault!
We must defend ourselves. I've already contacted our allies in the other territories, but I don't know how long they'll take to reach us. Without them, we can only rely on ourselves!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious. Then a bit casual when talking about the "massacre"
line0.text:
The assault is imminent. And it seems even worse than what our intelligence conveyed.
Without reinforcements, we can expect a massacre.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined to fight, brave and proud as a knight
line0.text:
With or without reinforcements, the Ecazis are fighting and dying with great panache.
This territory is ours, and we fought hard to seize it. Handing it over to the enemy is out of the question. Know I shall stay by your side as long as it takes.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: determined to fight, brave and proud as a knight
line1.text:
With or without reinforcements, the Ecazis are fighting and dying with great panache.
This territory is ours, and we fought hard to seize it. Handing it over to the enemy is out of the question. Know I shall stay by your side as long as it takes.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: tired, sad
line0.text: I have alarming news, my lord. Our spies confirm that the enemy attack is imminent, and our reinforcements are nowhere to be seen. We'll have to hold out as long as we can, and hope that your men will get here in time to save us.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Hasimir specifically say "Majesty" and not "Your majesty" here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, serious, then more factual, as he was planning something
line0.text:
The enemy has crossed the border, Majesty.
Your opponent is cunning – He's planned multiple waves to wear down your forces. We must be cautious to hold out until reinforcements arrive.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Hasimir specifically say "Majesty" and not "Your majesty" here "the enemy" is masculine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: determined, serious, then more factual, as he was planning something
line1.text:
The enemy has crossed the border, Majesty.
Your opponent is cunning – She's planned multiple waves to wear down your forces. We must be cautious to hold out until reinforcements arrive.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, firm when she says "But we will prevail"
line0.text: The enemy is upon us. His troops have reached our border, and their numbers are impressive. But we will prevail. Our defenses are strong, and we are prepared to protect our villages. They will not fall. Our reinforcements will have time to reach us.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.voice_notes: Tone: determined, firm when she says "But we will prevail"
line1.text: The enemy is upon us. Her troops have reached our borders, and their numbers are impressive. But we will prevail. Our defenses are solid, and we are prepared to protect our villages. They will not fall. Our reinforcements will have time to reach us.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"The enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: scared, trying to stay calm (but failing)
line0.text:
The enemy is attacking!
Father! We must hold strong as long as we can. Our allies are still too far away to be of any help!

line1.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"The enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: scared, trying to stay calm (but failing)
line1.text:
The enemy is attacking!
Father! We must hold strong as long as we can. Our allies are still too far away to be of any help!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: aggressive, determined to revenge
line0.text:
The reinforcements have arrived, Baron!
Disregard their exhaustion! They must fight for House Harkonnen. Your hold on this territory depends on it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud, fierce, determined to revenge
line0.text:
Mother! The reinforcements have arrived!
We'll avenge the affront done to you! Your enemy will regret ever attacking House Ecaz!

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: proud, fierce, determined to revenge
line1.text:
Mother! The reinforcements have arrived!
We'll avenge the affront done to you! Your enemy will regret ever attacking House Ecaz!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: eager to fight, determined, proud
line0.text:
My lord! Our reinforcements have arrived! They await your orders!
It's time to make the enemy regret attacking the Atreides!

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: eager to fight, determined, proud
line1.text:
My lord! Our reinforcements have arrived! They await your orders!
It's time to make the enemy regret attacking the Atreides!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Hasimir specifically say "Majesty" and not "Your majesty"
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, factual but the player can hear that he is determined to revenge (but not too obvious, Fenring has a deep control on his feelings and emotions.
line0.text:
Majesty, our reinforcements have arrived.
Your men are ready to avenge this affront to the Empire.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: triumphant, hopeful
line0.text:
Reinforcements incoming!
Our troops have arrived! Let us drive these wretches from our lands! You need only give the order!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: crying he has just seen the reinforcements on his radar. Hopeful/relieved on the last sentence
line0.text:
Our men! Our men have reached the territory! They're awaiting your orders!
Great gods, at last! We can now counterattack.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Sietch is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: genuinely surprised, intrigued, thinking. On the second paragraph, he is serious, even a bit concerned. Considers Fremen like wild animals.
line0.text:
The number of Fremen in this territory is unanticipated. To be honest, it contradicts our most generous estimates of their population throughout Arrakis. Have they regrouped here for some reason, or were we somewhat optimistic about the threat they represent?
I must advise you to take an interest in the region's sietches. House Harkonnen won't be undermined by some Fremen.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Ecazis is a book term (people from Ecaz planet)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: scandalized and despising toward the Harkonnens, annoyed. Then proud of her and her Mother, determined but casual
line0.text:
What were the Harkonnens basing their reports to the Imperium on? The Fremen population here is higher than their estimates for the planet! It seems like they never looked up from their harvester tracks.
The Ecazis aren't cut from the same cloth, right, Mother? We must use this territory to contact the sietches, and learn more about those desert creatures.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, calm,
line0.text:
According to Duncan Idaho, this territory is of the utmost importance to the Fremen – his report mentions a number of sietches in the region. We can assume they're protecting some kind of sacred site.
If we could develop relationships with the locals, we might convince them that we alone can protect this place against the Great Houses' appetite.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Fenring specifically says "Majesty" and not "Your Majesty"
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising or annoyed about the Harkonnens' reports as if he was getting used to their incompetence. Tired. Then factual and calm
line0.text: Once again, the reports sent by the Harkonnens for years were false. The Fremen in this territory number higher than in all the Baron's estimates! His lack of interest in the desert people puts us in a delicate position, Majesty. It would behoove us to approach the Fremen sietches and negotiate with this people. We need to assess their threat level.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: preoccupied, thinking, as she was reading a report. Then she is intrigued
line0.text:
My love, I have a strange feeling.
Our analytic machines show a large number of Fremen sietches in this area. It seems there are more in this territory than in all the Harkonnens’ estimates…
Could this land be sacred?
We must learn more. Let us make contact with their villages.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual, even amused, proud. Impressed when saying "But who could have...". Then planning and determined
line0.text:
I have long suspected the Fremen were hiding something in this territory. The way they always avoid talking about that part of the desert, all those ‘thopters that have mysteriously disappeared, the alleged absence of spice… But who could have guessed it was a sacred sietch?
Our spies still don't know exactly where it is, but the local tribes surely must. If we gain their trust, someone will eventually let the secret slip.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries "pain amplifiers" is a book term Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Sietch is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual, torture is normal for him. Destroying the sietch is not moral dilemma just a possibilty
line0.text:
I'm pleased to tell you the pain amplifiers worked wonderfully well. We now know why there were so many Fremen in this territory. They were drawn to the presence of one of their underground villages, a very ancient and probably sacred sietch.
Destroying it would prevent anyone from seeking their support and stifle any impulse to rebel on their part. Then again, we could also protect it from your enemies. The gratitude these people would show you could prove useful indeed.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Sietch is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: 1§ intrigued, suprised. Then : 2§ thinking. Then: 3§ determined
line0.text:
This sietch is so vast and ancient… Some sort of Fremen capital perhaps?
We could wipe it out, dealing such a blow to the desert people that they wouldn't dare threaten us again. On the other hand, protecting it from our rivals could secure a profitable alliance for the Ecazis.
The decision is yours, Mother.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Sietch is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud, relieved 2§ Detemined, and serious, planifiying but then, on the last setntece; hesisting 2§ he would prefer helping the Fremen but cannot exclude the risk
line0.text:
Sire! Our efforts have paid off!
We found the location of the Fremen sietch! It's much larger and older than our projections indicated. By protecting it from your rivals, we could secure an alliance with the locals. That said… destroying it is also an option.
Duncan Idaho admires them, but these are fearsome fighters. Were they to join forces with one of your enemies, it could spell the end of House Atreides.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Fenring specifically says "Majesty" and not "Your Majesty" sietch is a game and book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, calm.
line0.text:
We discovered what's been drawing Fremen to this territory, Majesty. There's a site considered sacred to the desert people, a sietch – as they call their villages – which is older and larger than the others.
If we help to defend them against your rivals, this unexpected mass of fighters could prove useful. But we could also destroy it. To weaken the Fremen is to weaken their potential allies.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: smiling, proud of herself, joking with her husband. Then, she becomes serious and respectful.
line0.text:
There was something sacred in this territory. An ancient sietch, no less! The instinct of the Bene Gesserit is quite formidable, isn't it?
It falls to you to decide what we should do with this marvel. Destroy it to break the Fremen’s will… or protect it from the Great Houses and make the people of the desert our allies.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"Ancient Sietch" is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: enthousiastic, ready to fight but then, he tries to appear more reasonnable
line0.text:
The Ancient Sietch!
Let us take it by storm! After such a show of force, the Fremen will never again dare to put up the slightest resistance! …
Unless you wish to form an alliance with them? If we swear to defend this sietch from the Great Houses, the Fremen will consider you as one of their own. They will let us harvest the spice wherever we like.

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Stilgar Iduali is a book term, invariable in english but it might vary per language. It is an insult in the fremen language meaning "Water Insect" that is exclusively used againt the Cast Out fremen present in Children of Dune Sietch Jacurutu is a book term from Children of Dune Old Father Sun is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: telling a sad and terrible story. Despising on "Iduali" term (which means "water insect". Then, insists that Liet must kill those outcasts.
line0.text: Sister, this is a tale that dates back to my great-great-grandfather: Fremen attacking Fremen to steal their water. The Iduali. The people thought they had exterminated them by destroying Sietch Jacurutu, but scouts have found desiccated bodies, abandoned to Shai-Hulud and Old Father Sun… You are our guide today, so you must discover where the Iduali are hiding and kill them off once and for all. None of the Fremen will be safe as long as they live.

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Stilgar Iduali is a book term, invariable in english but it might vary per language. It is an insult in the fremen language meaning "Water Insect" that is exclusively used againt the Cast Out fremen present in Children of Dune Accursed Sietch is the in-game name of the sietch in this battle, please use the same name in this text as for the AccursedSietch structure
line0.voice_notes: Tone: "Accursed Sietch" = furious/ almost an insult. Then fierce and violent: Idualis must die.
line0.text:
The Accursed Sietch!
You must destroy them, Liet! God and our laws command it. This time, no Iduali must escape alive!
Those pieces of lizard turd will try to scuttle away the minute they sense a threat. Make sure that you surround them, and that all the villages are ready for them!

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Stilgar Iduali is a book term, invariable in english but it might vary per language. It is an insult in the fremen language meaning "Water Insect" that is exclusively used againt the Cast Out fremen present in Children of Dune
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, aggressive, as if he was seing the Idualis running away
line0.text: Look out, sister! The Iduali are trying to flee! None of them must pass! Our Fremen must hold their position!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed Reverand Mother of the Bene Gesserit Bene Gesserit is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: neutral, calm. Maybe a bit more violent or sombre or sinister on the last sentence.
line0.text: The Bene Gesserit know you are eyeing this territory and are willing to help you get it. We ask for only one thing in exchange: its supervisor's death.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed Reverand Mother of the Bene Gesserit Bene Gesserit is a book term agent is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, formal
line0.text: Your interests align with those of the Bene Gesserit: The supervisor of this territory must die. We are prepared to send you agents in exchange for his assassination.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed Reverand Mother of the Bene Gesserit Bene Gesserit is a book term "The order" = Bene Gesserit is a book term here the person she's talking to is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal but in fact she is pressuring the player. She can be a stiff
line0.text: I must inform you that the Bene Gesserit are somewhat restless. Are you still prepared to fulfill your mission? The Order is counting on your House.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed Reverand Mother of the Bene Gesserit Bene Gesserit is a book term "The order" = Bene Gesserit is a book term here the person she's talking to is feminine
line1.text: I must inform you that the Bene Gesserit are somewhat restless. Are you still prepared to fulfill your mission? The Order is counting on your House.

line2.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed Reverand Mother of the Bene Gesserit Bene Gesserit is a book term
line2.text: The noose is tightening around the supervisor – the Bene Gesserit are happy with your efforts and urge you to continue with the same eagerness.

line0.text: The noose is tightening around the supervisor – the Bene Gesserit are happy with your efforts and urge you to continue with the same eagerness.

Look at him, Mother! Plagued with villages he thought he'd conquered! Should we lend a hand to those oppressed peoples? They would soon agree to be ruled by a power that so conveniently aided them.

line1.voice_notes: Tone: amused, despising
line1.text:
Who could've known the locals would give the Great Houses so much trouble? Certainly not your rival, haha.
Look at her, Mother! Plagued with villages she thought she'd conquered! Should we land a hand to those oppressed peoples? They would soon agree to be ruled by a power that so conveniently aided them.

line0.voice_notes: Tone: intrigued, factual, formal. Then, determined
line0.text:
Interesting…
Duncan Idaho's Fremen contact speaks of a rebellion in this territory. With support from the folk of pan and graben, they're trying to shake off your rival's rule. This is the perfect chance for the Atreides to show the Fremen how useful their support would be.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) territory is a game term folk of pan and graben is a book term here "your rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: intrigued, factual, formal. Then, determined
line1.text:
Interesting…
Duncan Idaho's Fremen contact speaks of a rebellion in this territory. With support from the folk of pan and graben, they're trying to shake off your rival's rule. This is the perfect chance for the Atreides to show the Fremen how useful their support would be.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) territory is a game term folk of pan and graben is a book term here "your enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, formal.
line0.text:
Your opponent's grip on this territory is not as firm as we thought. The villages are challenging his authority.
It has to be a Fremen ploy – the folk of pan and graben aren't known for their rebellious spirit. The confusion might be of benefit to us. By liberating the locals, you would simultaneously gain their allegiance and drive out your enemy from these lands.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) territory is a game term folk of pan and graben is a book term here "your enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, formal.
line1.text:
Your opponent's grip on this territory is not as firm as we thought. The villages are challenging her authority.
It has to be a Fremen ploy – the folk of pan and graben aren't known for their rebellious spirit. The confusion might be of benefit to us. By liberating the locals, you would simultaneously gain their allegiance and drive out your enemy from these lands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius here "your rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm
line0.text: A rebellion is underway in this territory. Our agents report that the Fremen are behind it, urging the folk of pan and graben to rise up against your rival. We should make the most of the unrest, my husband. Support these people and free their villages. Become their savior. After that, it will be easy to turn them into loyal subjects.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius here "your rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm
line1.text:
A rebellion is underway in this territory. Our agents report that the Fremen are behind it, urging the folk of pan and graben to rise up against your rival.
We should make the most of the unrest, my husband. Support these people and free their villages. Become their savior. After that, it will be easy to turn them into loyal subjects.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "your rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising, mocking, planning
line0.text:
Those Great Houses…! To them, a village conquered is a village converted, and a colorful banner is enough to change the people's allegiance! Ha!
The Fremen have already lit the embers of rebellion. All that's left now is for us to fan the fire. We should liberate a few villages, Father. If only to stifle your rival's arrogance.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "your rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: despising, mocking, planning
line1.text:
Those Great Houses…! To them, a village conquered is a village converted, and a colorful banner is enough to change the people's allegiance! Ha!
The Fremen have already lit the embers of rebellion. All that's left now is for us to fan the fire. We should liberate a few villages, Father. If only to stifle your rival's arrogance.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Piter de Vries Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) base is a game term (main base)
here "your opponent" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused (this mission is a lot of fun for Piter), mocking the Baron. Eager and enthusiastic on the last sentence
line0.text:
The Fremen were dumbfounded when the butchers – that's how they refer to your House! Haha – liberated their villages.
They're now asking you to help them destroy your opponent's base. Say yes, Baron! I'm dying to see the look on your enemy's face on learning that Fremen and Harkonnens have joined forces against them.

They're now asking you to help them destroy your opponent's base. Say yes, Baron! I'm dying to see the look on your enemy's face on learning that Fremen and Harkonnens have joined forces against them.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz base is a game term (main base) here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: impressed by the player, admiring. Then, on the 2§, neutral
line0.text:
Thanks to your expertise, the rebellion is turning into an insurrection. What a master stroke!
Our new allies are captivated – they're getting ready to attack your enemy's base and requesting your support as a favor. I reckon it's time to finish your work.

line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, pleased, proud of his duke
line0.text: The Fremen are cheering your name and Lady Jessica's. They're ready to launch a final assault on your enemy's base. Shall I give the order?

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) base is a game term (Main base) here "your rival" is feminine

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fremen is a book term (invariable in english but it might vary between language) Sardaukar is a book and game term (invariable in english, but it might vary between language) base is a game term (main base) Fenring specifically use "Majesty", not "your majesty"
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit surprised at first then, comes back to facts and formality
line0.text:
I never thought I would see Sardaukar and Fremen fighting side by side. The effectiveness of their combined forces has proven fearsome.
It's given them ideas: They are begging for your aid in their assault against the enemy base. Majesty, we should make use of such men. We can always get rid of them once the conquest of Arrakis is complete.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius here "your enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, smiling, proud of her husband. Then, she becomes serious, pushing gently her husband to follow her advices
line0.text:
Your achievements have impressed the people of Arrakis. They seem willing to put their trust in you.
We should seal this promising partnership with an attack on your enemy’s Base. It will not be easy, my love, but a victory will bring us both a new territory and reliable allies.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius here "your enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, smiling, proud of her husband. Then, she becomes serious, pushing gently her husband to follow her advices
line1.text:
Your achievements have impressed the people of Arrakis. They seem willing to put their trust in you.
We should seal this promising partnership with an attack on your enemy’s Base. It will not be easy, my love, but a victory will bring us both a new territory and reliable allies.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "your noble opponent" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, grinning on the last sentence
line0.text: The Fremen's uprising is proceeding as planned. The men of the desert are more than satisfied. Otheym, who is leading this mission, even suggested that we take part in a raid on the enemy base. Imagine your noble opponent's terror when he sees the united people of Arrakis descending upon his positions.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "your noble opponent" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, grinning on the last sentence
line1.text: The Fremen's uprising is proceeding as planned. The men of the desert are more than satisfied. Otheym, who is leading this mission, even suggested that we take part in a raid on the enemy base. Imagine your noble opponent's terror when she sees the united people of Arrakis descending upon her positions.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar here "your enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, preoccupied but not fearful, determined
line0.text:
The night sky was black with cielagos… and the messages they carried were darker still. The sietches fear an attack from your enemy and are preparing to defend their water and their families, but the tribes cannot help one another. They fear too much for their own survival.
Let us march on the offworlders' base. Our warriors must destroy it before the Fremen in this territory fail.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar here "your enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: serious, preoccupied but not fearful, determined
line1.text:
The night sky was black with cielagos… and the messages they carried were darker still. The sietches fear an attack from your enemy and are preparing to defend their water and their families, but the tribes cannot help one another. They fear too much for their own survival.
Let us march on the offworlders' base. Our warriors must destroy it before the Fremen in this territory fail.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "our enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: mocking (blackmarket is the Smugglers' specialty, seen a Great House trying to join them is ridiculous). Fierce and grinning on the last part.
line0.text:
The information seemed so preposterous, I was reluctant to tell you, but… it seems our enemy is dipping his toe into the black market. The buyer is none other than a Great House of the Landsraad, come to collect its spice shipment at the source.
We should give them a little lesson in smuggling! Let's raid their stocks of spice and intercept their transporters, to teach them how things work around here. The hard way!

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban here "our enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: mocking (blackmarket is the Smugglers' specialty, seen a Great House trying to join them is ridiculous). Fierce and grinning on the last part.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban Spice Freighter is the in-game name of a unit. Please use the same translation here.
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual but serious
line0.text: According to our spies, the first Spice Freighter has just left the enemy base. Should I give our men the order to shoot it down? It might draw unwanted attention, but we could recover its cargo.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban Spice Freighter is the in-game name of a unit. Please use the same translation here.
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual, mocking, amused
line0.text: There's another possibility, too. We could replace one of their mysteriously lost Freighters with one of our own... An explosive delivered into the heart of the buyer's base would teach them an unforgettable lesson.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de vries territory is a game term here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: eager
line0.text: Attacking brutally, suddenly, mercilessly – isn't that House Harkonnen's specialty? Baron, this opportunity was made for you! Your rival's reinforcements are a long way off. You need only reach out and snatch this territory from your enemy.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de vries territory is a game term here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: eager
line1.text: Attacking brutally, suddenly, mercilessly – isn't that House Harkonnen's specialty? Baron, this opportunity was made for you! Your rival's reinforcements are a long way off. You need only reach out and snatch this territory from your enemy.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: smiling, despising toward this enemy.
line0.text: An exposed territory, a distracted enemy army… What a thoughtful gift for House Ecaz. All you have to do is accept it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, determined
line0.text: The enemy has neglected this territory. He's already led his army elsewhere, leaving but a paltry defense behind. I advise you to attack this position without delay – your rival won't have time to react.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: serious, determined
line1.text: The enemy has neglected this territory. She's already led her army elsewhere, leaving but a paltry defense behind. I advise you to attack this position without delay – your rival won't have time to react.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring territory is a game term base is a game term (main base) Fenring specifically says "Majesty", and not "your majesty" here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, formal, calm
line0.text:
Our scouts have spotted troop movements. The enemy is focused on a territory far away from this one.
Majesty, it's the perfect time to strike. We must act fast and take your opponent's base before he has time to recall his men.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring territory is a game term base is a game term (main base) Fenring specifically says "Majesty", and not "your majesty" here "the enemy" is feminine

Our scouts have spotted troop movements. The enemy is focused on a territory far away from this one.
Majesty, it's the perfect time to strike. We must act fast and take your opponent's base before she has time to recall her men.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, confident
line0.text: Your rival believes that his grip on this territory is unshakable, but he obviously underestimates our House. Let’s show him that against Ixian technology, all of his victories are merely temporary.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, confident
line1.text: Your rival believes that her grip on this territory is unshakable, but she obviously underestimates our House. Let’s show her that against Ixian technology, all of her victories are merely temporary.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"your rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, then determined and fierce (impulsive) on the last two sentences
line0.text:
Our merchants have returned from the villages. Much to their surprise, they didn't encounter a single enemy patrol.
Your rival is neglecting this territory's defenses - perhaps his troops are busy conquering some other part of the desert. We should send in our men to strike his base! A lightning attack will rob him of his reinforcements!

Speaker is Staban

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and calm, but we can feel that Stilgar will be not mercy for the outsiders
line0.text: The men are ready to launch a raid on the offworlders' base. Ask your finest warrior to guide the Fremen to victory.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused on the last sentence then formal, then eager or onctuous
line0.text:
Who would look twice at a handful of men when a Harkonnen army is camped outside their door?
Your rival won't expect a small detachment to attack his territory, having left it practically defenseless. You could so easily claim it…

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: amused on the last sentence then formal, then eager or onctuous
line1.text:
Who would look twice at a handful of men when a Harkonnen army is camped outside their door?
Your rival won't expect a small detachment to attack her territory, having left it practically defenseless. You could so easily claim it…

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, determined. Smiling (cruel?) on the last sentence
line0.text: This territory's defenses were created to stop an army, not a small contingent of soldiers. A small group of men could quietly capture this territory without drawing your rival's attention. By the time he finds out you seized his base, it'll be too late.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: factual, determined. Smiling (cruel?) on the last sentence
line1.text: This territory's defenses were created to stop an army, not a small contingent of soldiers. A small group of men could quietly capture this territory without drawing your rival's attention. By the time she finds out you seized her base, it'll be too late.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat mercenary is a game term here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: factual, formal, determined
line0.text:
Your rival expects an army to attack this territory. A group of inconspicuous men would pass through his defenses without him noticing.
If necessary, the detachment could be supported by mercenaries. They've been spotted all over Arrakis since the Harkonnen decolonization.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat mercenary is a game term here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: factual, formal, determined
line1.text:
Your rival expects an army to attack this territory. A group of inconspicuous men would pass through her defenses without her noticing.
If necessary, the detachment could be supported by mercenaries. They've been spotted all over Arrakis since the Harkonnen decolonization.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring mercenary is a game term here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, calm, perfectly in control
line0.text: Our spies have convinced the enemy he should expect a massive assault from you. Now all his attention will be on your troops' movements. This is the perfect time for a small detachment to sneak behind his lines and free the villages in this territory from his rule. We've also located mercenary camps, which could provide support without arousing suspicion.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring mercenary is a game term here "the enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: formal, calm, perfectly in control
line1.text: Our spies have convinced the enemy she should expect a massive assault from you. Now all her attention will be on your troops' movements. This is the perfect time for a small detachment to sneak behind her lines and free the villages in this territory from her rule. We've also located mercenary camps, which could provide support without arousing suspicion.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious
line0.text:
The analytic machines examining the enemy’s strategy have detected a flaw in his defenses. A small group of soldiers should be able to exploit it while his attention is elsewhere. With a handful of mercenaries, they could take your rival’s base before he can react.
Choose your men carefully, my husband – they could be the key to our victory.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious
line1.text:
The analytic machines examining the enemy’s strategy have detected a flaw in her defenses. A small group of soldiers should be able to exploit it while her attention is elsewhere. With a handful of mercenaries, they could take your rival’s base before she can react.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Staban
"Your rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising and calm at first, then upset (maybe jalous of their big army?), then determined trying to stay calm but a bit pressing
line0.text:
Your rival has only ever faced massive armies, so his defenses are adapted to large-scale battles. It's pathetic! What planet does he think he's on?
We must take advantage of his mistake and send a small group into this territory with orders to liberate the villages discreetly. They may even find backup amongst the folk of the pan and graben.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban "Your rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: despising and calm at first, then upset (maybe jalous of their big army?), then determined trying to stay calm but a bit pressing
line1.text:
Your rival has only ever faced massive armies, so her defenses are adapted to large-scale battles. It's pathetic! What planet does she think she's on?
We must take advantage of her mistake and send a small group into this territory with orders to liberate the villages discreetly. They may even find backup amongst the folk of the pan and graben.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Stilgar
"The enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, cold but despising on "Just Look at their defenses!" Then planning, serious, cold
line0.text: The enemy is misguided: he thinks he can fight on Dune the way he would on planets where water falls from the sky. Just look at his defenses, Liet! The offworlders expect to fight an army, so they won't notice a small group slipping in through the shadows. You can safely send in a few of our Fremen behind their lines. They will liberate the folk of the pan and graben before the offworlders even notice.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar "The enemy" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, cold but despising on "Just Look at their defenses!" Then planning, serious, cold
line1.text: The enemy is misguided: she thinks she can fight on Dune the way she would on one of those planets where water falls from the sky. Just look at her defenses, Liet! The offworlders expect to fight an army, so they won't notice a small group slipping in through the shadows. You can safely send in a few of our Fremen behind their lines. They will liberate the folk of the pan and graben before the offworlders even notice.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused, despising, taunting the player
line0.text: Well, well! Is this a secret sabotage mission I'm witnessing? How ridiculous to see a party as powerful as your own stooping to such indignities. Not to mention the insult to House Harkonnen! Do you think the good Baron is foolish enough to leave one of his territories unattended?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term "A victory ... is no victory" is a quote from Rivvy Dinari in the book "Dune: House Harkonnen"
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising, proud of herself
line0.text: My mother's bodyguard often says, "A victory without honor is no victory." Luckily for you, I'll spare you the shame of conquering this territory through villainy. I hope those men weren't too important to you…

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat the duke and lord leto are book term (Duke Leto Atreides)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: furious, despising
line0.text: I recognize your treacherous methods. You thought to attack the Duke with a small detachment of men? How pathetic! Even for you. Lord Leto would never leave a territory wide open for you.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Quote from the book: "Listening to the man gave Feyd-Rautha the feeling his head was being pushed through mush". Count Fenring may use this strange sounds to annoy his opponent. In English there are translated this way : "When you're mm-m-m ironic, that ah-h-h suggests you're hm-m-m-m thinking deep thoughts" "Um-m-m-m-m-ah-h-h-hm-m-m, you come upon such, mm-m-m, preciseness so rarely," the Count said, addressing the Baron's shoulder. "I . . . ah, congratulate you on the hm-m-m perfection of your ah-h-h heir. In the light of the hm-m-m elder, one might say."
line0.voice_notes: Quote from the book: "Listening to the man gave Feyd-Rautha the feeling his head was being pushed through mush". He is clearly taunting the player with this way of talking
line0.text:
Sabotage… mm-m-m? Isn't that a bit… mm-m-m… unbecoming of a House as… hmm-m-m… decent as yours?
The Emperor will be somewhat… mm-m-m… displeased to see that you… hmm-m-m… underestimated him in this way. I hope the… Imperial welcoming committee gives you… ah-h-h… a preview of… hmm-m-m… the retaliation.
