line1.voice_notes: Quote from the book: "Listening to the man gave Feyd-Rautha the feeling his head was being pushed through mush". He is clearly taunting the player with this way of talking
line1.text:
Sabotage… mm-m-m? Isn't that a bit… mm-m-m… unbecoming of a people as… hmm-m-m… brave as yours?
The Emperor will be somewhat… mm-m-m… displeased to see that you… hmm-m-m… underestimated him in this way. I hope the… Imperial welcoming committee gives you… ah-h-h… a preview of… hmm-m-m… the retaliation.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: moking at first and then despising, even disgusted (her ennemy has underestimate her dear husband!)
line0.text:
Did you think a small detachment of men could escape our machines’ surveillance? Your reluctance to use Ixian technology makes your House a poor adversary indeed.
I hope you’ve learned a lesson here today…

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: falsely polite, despising, sure that the player will fail attacking them.
line0.text:
The Baron wanted to offer words of encouragement for the coming battle, and I would add my own. Attacking the greatest fortress in Arrakis, built by the Harkonnens themselves, is a bold choice. Even for you.
We look forward to seeing your forces come down on the city's defenses.

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Piter de Vries mentat is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: mocking the player, casual, sure that the player will fail
line0.text: You don't lack ambition. Attacking Carthag. The greatest fortress in Arrakis. Truly, I'm shocked. No self-respecting Mentat would advise their lord to do something so foolish. But you're already here, so there's no point going back – you would deprive House Harkonnen of a spectacular sight. We look forward to seeing your forces come down on the city's defenses.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat shield is a book term. It's a forcefield, not a buckler
line0.voice_notes: Tone: furious, despising
line0.text: What is your army doing here? They don't stand a chance against Arrakeen. Its shield will halt your sorry attempts to destroy it. It's impenetrable – you'll wear yourselves out before the city gates.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat shield is a book term. It's a forcefield, not a buckler Duke is a book term (Duke Leto Atreides)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: surprised, sacred or puzzled. Then furious, aggressive, determined
line0.text:
The shield…! How did you do that? Is there a traitor within Arrakeen?
Such treachery will be rewarded with death! Our men will fight to the last to defend the Duke and his family. Arrakeen will not fall!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is hasimir fenring Salusa secundus is a book term Landsraad is a book and game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: cold anger (he does not use his annoying way of speaking), determined, serious and factual as a judge, as if the player has already lost the battle.
line0.text:
Let us drop the false pretenses.
You decided to attack the Empire, and His Majesty cannot allow such an affront to go unpunished. Your House will be eradicated, your bloodline destroyed, and your men – the ones who survive the coming slaughter – will die in the jails of Salusa Secundus.
This battle will serve as a warning to all of the Landsraad.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is hasimir fenring Salusa secundus is a book term Landsraad is a book and game term
line1.voice_notes: Tone: cold anger (he does not use his annoying way of speaking), determined, serious and factual as a judge, as if the player has already lost the battle.
line1.text:
Let us drop the false pretenses.
You decided to attack the Empire, and His Majesty cannot allow such an affront to go unpunished. Your people will be eradicated, and I'll personally make sure that you end your days in the jails of Salusa Secundus.
This battle will serve as a warning to the whole Empire.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker in Sanya Ecaz Ecazis is a book term (people of planet Ecaz) Foliage is a game term (House Ecaz Main Base)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: furious, scandalized
line0.text:
How dare you attack Foliage!
You don't know who you're dealing with. The Ecazis are not simply artists – they are brave fighters whom you've underestimated for too long. This siege will end with your defeat, and our troubadours will ever sing of this day as your House's last!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker in Tessia Vernius
line0.text:
You know it as well as I do: your attack is bound to fail. House Vernius' technological superiority places us far above all others. In our eyes, your mighty army is nothing more than a barbarian horde wielding rocks!
It is high time you learned that knowledge is power. We will rid Arrakis of your ilk!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen) here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual at first then taunting the Baron
line0.text: This territory is far too strategic to be left in the hands of a rival. In fact, I’m surprised you haven’t already recaptured it, Baron. Surely you’re not suffering from an excess of caution in your approach to your adversaries?

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen) here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: casual at first then taunting the Baron
line1.text: This territory is far too strategic to be left in the hands of a rival. In fact, I’m surprised you haven’t already recaptured it, Baron. Surely you’re not suffering from an excess of caution in your approach to your adversaries?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries base is a game term (main base) Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious but casual. Sombre or cruel on the last sentence
line0.text: Our men are ready to start the assault, Baron. I’d even say they’re eager to wipe this enemy Base off the map. Indulge their enthusiasm, and they won’t disappoint you.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: faking suffering, dramatic,
line0.text: Seeing anyone but a Harkonnen mining the sands of Arrakis is sheer torture, Baron. Their profits are so meager compared to what you could extract! Someone must put an end to this needless waste.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term base is a game term (main base) here "the rival" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal but arrogant
line0.text: It won’t be easy to expel your rival from this territory. He seems to have made himself quite comfortable here – his villages are well defended, and his Base looks well fortified. But nothing can resist our House's ingenuity. I know you will emerge victorious, Mother.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term base is a game term (main base) here "the rival" is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: formal but arrogant
line1.text: It won’t be easy to expel your rival from this territory. She seems to have made herself quite comfortable here – her villages are well defended, and her Base looks well fortified. But nothing can resist our House's ingenuity. I know you will emerge victorious, Mother.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz base is a game term (main base) here "the enemy" is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising and arrogant, then casual on the last sentence (as if she was not talking about a war)
line0.text: All these vulgar fortifications and filthy, reeking soldiers... your enemy’s Base is an oozing boil on the face of Arrakis. Someone should lance it and replace it with something more appealing. Wouldn’t you agree, Mother?

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz base is a game term (main base) here "the enemy" is femine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: despising and arrogant, then casual on the last sentence (as if she was not talking about a war)
line1.text: All these vulgar fortifications and filthy, reeking soldiers... your enemy’s Base is an oozing boil on the face of Arrakis. Someone should lance it and replace it with something more appealing. Wouldn’t you agree, Mother?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, serious, determined, ready to fight too
line0.text:
The men are ready to attack and risk their lives to secure victory.
They’re only awaiting your order.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term here the enemy is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious
line0.text: Your enemy’s progression must be stopped. Conquering one of his territories will weaken his grip on Arrakis and undermine his troops’ morale.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term here the enemy is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: serious
line1.text: Your enemy’s progression must be stopped. Conquering one of her territories will weaken her grip on Arrakis and undermine her troops’ morale.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring territory is a game term here your rival is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, organizing
line0.text: Your rival is expanding his holdings on Arrakis too quickly. If his momentum isn’t broken, he'll become unstoppable. Snatching back one of his newly conquered territories before he can react should slow him down for a while.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring territory is a game term here your rival is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, organizing
line1.text: Your rival is expanding her holdings on Arrakis too quickly. If her momentum isn’t broken, she'll become unstoppable. Snatching back one of her newly conquered territories before she can react should slow her down for a while.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term here your adversary is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, organizing
line0.text: Majesty, our spies report that your adversary has left only a light garrison in this territory. You could seize it from him quickly, before he has time to call in reinforcements.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term here your adversary is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, organizing
line1.text: Majesty, our spies report that your adversary has left only a light garrison in this territory. You could seize it from her quickly, before she has time to call in reinforcements.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined, even fierce.
line0.text:
We must capture this territory, no matter how long it takes. Leave it in your enemy’s hands, and he will continue to draw on its resources and villages to support his war against you.
House Vernius has already reconquered an entire planet. This territory is nothing in comparison.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.voice_notes: Tone: determined, even fierce.
line1.text:
We must capture this territory, no matter how long it takes. Leave it in your enemy’s hands, and she will continue to draw on its resources and villages to support her war against you.
House Vernius has already reconquered an entire planet. This territory is nothing in comparison.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.text: We must weaken your enemy to ensure our victory. Depriving him of this territory and its resources and troops will consolidate our advances and slow his progress. We have no choice – we must drive him from these lands.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line1.text: We must weaken your enemy to ensure our victory. Depriving her of this territory and its resources and troops will consolidate our advances and slow her progress. We have no choice – we must drive her from these lands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: grinning, planning, he is sure of the victory
line0.text: This Great House is too ambitious for their own good. Depriving them of one of their territories will surely force them to reconsider their attitude towards us.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: a bit worried, trying to convince his father to react
line0.text: Father, the speed at which this Great House has spread across Arrakis is alarming. It is high time we put a damper on their ambitions. I fear that if we do not react now, we will soon be forced to submit to their laws.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm and determined
line0.text:
The scouts have returned from the villages, and the warriors are all ready to attack.
You need only give the order, my sister. Your enemies' water will not be lost.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: upset, furious then determined and fierce
line0.text:
Great gods below!
Those wormfaced scum are already there! They're swarming amongst the rocks!
We must act quickly and break the offworlders' grip on this territory before they expand their reach further still.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed representant of the Spacing Guild Renegade and Renegade houses are a game and book term Tupile is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: very formal and professional, no emotion, this is a report Context: Tupile is a planet where the defeated houses can live in peace, excluded from the Imperium.
line0.text:
Renegade Houses have left Tupile without authorization. They may have taken advantage of the confusion to seek refuge on Arrakis.
We are counting on your help to find them and eliminate them. Their presence is already disrupting order in the Imperium.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is an unnamed representant of the Spacing Guild Spacing Guild is a book term Renegade and Renegade houses are a game and book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: very formal and professional, no emotion, this is a report Context: Tupile is a planet where the defeated houses can live in peace, excluded from the Imperium.
line0.text:
The Spacing Guild has been informed of the presence of renegade Houses on Arrakis. They could try to interfere with trade and spice production. We ask that you eliminate them.
We will compensate you richly for your efforts.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, more and more serious
line0.text: Your conquest is proceeding apace, Baron. Each territory you acquire strengthens the Harkonnens and weakens your enemies. Soon all Arrakis will be yours.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries
line0.voice_notes: Tone: pleased, almost a complicity between him and the Baron
line0.text: A most definitive victory. No one crushes their enemies like you do.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising toward the enemy, satisfied, mocking or cruel on the last sentence
line0.text: Who would dare challenge such a victory, Baron? Your enemies fought so hard... Their disappointment must be cruel indeed!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal and satisified at first. Serious on the last sentence
line0.text:
Your enemies are withdrawing, Baron!
This territory is yours! Your victory is indisputable.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual, amused, even mocking the Baron
line0.text: How satisfying to see you triumph over your enemies... This territory is yours, Baron, for better and for worse.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: very proud of the player (her Mother), enthusiastic (but noble)
line0.text:
What panache! What brio!
Our troubadours will make sure that your enemies never forget this day.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud and pleased
line0.text: The enemy is retreating before our advancing army. This territory is yours!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: eager, determined, enthusiastic
line0.text: Our conquest of Arrakis is progressing admirably, Mother. Soon, all the spice in the Imperium will be in our hands.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud of the player (her Mother)
line0.text: You’re becoming quite the muse, Mother. This victory will be the subject of many a masterful work.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and proud of the player, rewarding on the last sentence
line0.text: Our banner flies over all the villages in this territory. This is a great victory, my lord.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and proud of the player
line0.text: Your men are proud to have been part of your victory. You have made these hostile lands into a new home for the Atreides.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: reporting the situation, proud of the player
line0.text: This territory is yours, sire! The enemy is withdrawing! House Atreides is triumphant!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and proud of the player, rewarding on the last sentence
line0.text: Your conquest is progressing more quickly than we had hoped, my lord. It is an honor to serve at your side.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, smiling, complicity with the duke
line0.text: A victory worthy to be immortalized in song by Gurney Halleck.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: reporting the situation, serious, calm
line0.text: This territory belongs to you. Your enemies have fled.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and calm
line0.text: Majesty, this territory is yours.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, serious and calm but also pleased
line0.text: The Empire’s conquest of Arrakis is proceeding in line with our projections. I believe congratulations are in order.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and calm
line0.text: This territory’s resources are ours, Majesty. The villages will exploit them in accordance with your wishes.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: smiling, very proud of her husband
line0.text: I never doubted your victory, my husband. I knew that this territory would belong to House Vernius.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud of her husband, determined
line0.text: Our House’s grip on Arrakis grows stronger with each territory we conquer. Soon the entire planet will be yours, my Earl.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: very proud of her husband
line0.text: You are victorious! I couldn’t be prouder of you, my husband.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, proud
line0.text: How satisfying to see our plans for Arrakis coming to fruition! Your triumphs bring us closer to victory every day.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: relieved, proud of Liet, happy
line0.text: The territory is free, sister! The offworlders are leaving! They're retreating!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: grateful, proud of his friend (not his true sister)
line0.text: Your victory lifts our hearts on wings of pride, sister. Listen as the sietches sing your name!

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Stilgar
"Old Father Sun" is a quote from the book
line0.voice_notes: Tone: happy, celebrating
line0.text: May Old Father Sun bear witness to your success! May all of Dune celebrate your victory!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar naib is a fremen term from the book
line0.voice_notes: Tone: happy, enthusiastic
line0.text: These lands are free! The Fremen are victorious! Soon we shall be the new naibs of Dune!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud of his father, cannot believe his eye
line0.text: You are triumphant, Father! Victory is ours! No one can deny our dominance over this territory.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: too proud, happy
line0.text: Ah! Your enemy is retreating! A Great House flees before the Smugglers!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud, determined
line0.text:
Victory is ours! Our grip on the spice grows ever tighter!
Soon we shall declare our own laws on Arrakis!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: proud, happy, determined
line0.text: A few more victories like this one, and our family will be as powerful as any Great House. We'll soon be pulling the strings of the whole Empire!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused, mocking the player (Baron), taunting
line0.text: What happened, Baron? It seems this territory has gotten away from you!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: amused, mocking the player (Baron), taunting
line0.text: Perhaps you underestimated your enemies, Baron? They didn’t seem to have too much trouble driving you out of this territory.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries territory is a game term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: casual
line0.text: I’ve already ordered the retreat, Baron. This territory is no great loss, though. You should concentrate on more strategic regions.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: worried, sombre
line0.text: This defeat is a disturbing sign for your plans of conquest, Baron. Each enemy victory weakens you and strengthens them.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, worried
line0.text: We must retreat, Mother. This territory is lost.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: arrogant but worried
line0.text: Yes, we’ve lost a territory, but no matter. We’ll conquer a new one soon enough.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: arrogant, proud and determined
line0.text: Only the weak are ground down by defeat, and your men are anything but. They’ll fight even more fiercely next time and conquer a new territory for you.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: determined
line0.text: This defeat will teach us to be cautious, but we need not abandon our efforts. The conquest of Arrakis is still possible.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: furious
line0.text: Witch blood! This territory has slipped from our grasp! We must withdraw!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: disappointed, sad, reporting the situation
line0.text: We must retreat, my lord. This territory is now in enemy hands. There is nothing more we can do.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: fierce and determined
line0.text: The enemy has won the day, but we shall return stronger than ever. The conquest is far from over.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: fierce and determined
line0.text: My lord, this territory is lost, but the planet is vast. We can still conquer it.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term Quote from the book: "Listening to the man gave Feyd-Rautha the feeling his head was being pushed through mush". Count Fenring may use this strange sounds to annoy his opponent. In English there are translated this way : "When you're mm-m-m ironic, that ah-h-h suggests you're hm-m-m-m thinking deep thoughts" "Um-m-m-m-m-ah-h-h-hm-m-m, you come upon such, mm-m-m, preciseness so rarely," the Count said, addressing the Baron's shoulder. "I . . . ah, congratulate you on the hm-m-m perfection of your ah-h-h heir. In the light of the hm-m-m elder, one might say."
line0.voice_notes: Tone: disappointed
line0.text: Forgive my bitterness, Majesty, but seeing this territory fall into enemy hands is... hmm-m-m... deeply disappointing.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone mortified, sorry
line0.text: This never should have happened, Majesty. I offer my most profound apologies. This territory is lost to us.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" territory is a game term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, serious but also a bit sinister has if he was lying
line0.text: We mustn’t waste time regretting the loss of this territory, Majesty. The conquest of Arrakis must continue.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious
line0.text: Let your enemies savor this victory. It shall be their last.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: upset, angry
line0.text:
Vermillion hells!
We have failed! This territory is lost!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: gentle as she was comforting her husband
line0.text: Despite this defeat, you must not lose sight of your broader goal of conquering Arrakis. Don't lose heart – you can still crush any enemy.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: gentle as she was comforting her husband
line0.text: Our will shall not be broken by the loss of a single territory. We have great plans for this planet and for House Vernius. No temporary defeat will stop us.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: despising toward her ennemies, then determined and fierce
line0.text: Let your enemies rejoice today, my love. We shall have our revenge. We will come back even stronger and more determined to drive them from Arrakis.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: bitter, upset, frustrated (could sound like a small child)
line0.text: We lacked ambition, Father! This territory should have been ours!

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: astonished, cannot believe his eye, a bit scared, does not understand
line0.text: Impossible! How could those outsiders have pushed us back? Where did we go wrong?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: disappointed, bitter, dark
line0.text: I have given the order to retreat. You can rely on the men to avoid capture, but everything we have built in this territory is lost.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: trying to look mature and wise but sad and disappointed
line0.text: Perhaps we will regain this territory one day. I shall strive to maintain the patience you have taught me.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: resigned, sad
line0.text: This territory is in our enemies' hands. The sietches are no more. As Shai-Hulud has chosen.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Stilgar
"the taste of it sours us" is a quote from the book
line0.voice_notes: Tone: resigned, sad
line0.text: The taste of this defeat sours us, sister. We have failed to liberate these lands from your enemies.

line0.translation_notes:
Speaker is Stilgar
"La la la" is a fremen cry of grief, from the book
line0.voice_notes: Tone: trying to not look too sad, then determined "La la la" is a fremen cry of grief, from the book
line0.text: La la la… Let us not spill water for the dead, sister. Our friends shall be avenged.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: calm, serious, then determined
line0.text: The surviving tribes are fleeing in our direction. Promise them worthy vengeance, and they will forgive you for the loss of their sietch.

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Stilgar Iduali is a book term, invariable in english but it might vary per language. It is an insult in the fremen language meaning "Water Insect" that is exclusively used againt the Cast Out fremen present in Children of Dune Accursed Sietch is the in-game name of the sietch in this battle, please use the same name in this text as for the AccursedSietch structure
line0.voice_notes: Tone: concerned, dark. This is not a victory
line0.text: The Accursed Sietch is no more, but the Iduali are still swarming about. How long will it be until these parasites regroup to attack our tribes? None of the Fremen will sleep soundly tonight.

line0.translation_notes: The Speaker is Stilgar Iduali is a book term, invariable in english but it might vary per language. It is an insult in the fremen language meaning "Water Insect" that is exclusively used againt the Cast Out fremen present in Children of Dune Accursed Sietch is the in-game name of the sietch in this battle, please use the same name in this text as for the AccursedSietch structure
line0.voice_notes: Tone: very proud of his sister, relieved
line0.text: We have finished what my great-great-grandfather and his brethren began. The Accursed Sietch is no more, and the Iduali will never be a threat to the Fremen again. You have succeeded, sister.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, reporting the situation. Formal at first then more and more hopeful
line0.text:
The moment has come, sire. The conquest of Arrakis is ready to begin.
The men are in good spirits, but they’re uneasy. They don’t know what to expect in a world so different from their own. Men who know only oceans and skies must now fight for control of a world covered in desert.
Even so, I can promise they will follow you, no matter what you decide to do. Under your command, they will make this world into a new home for House Atreides.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries CHOAM is a game and book term Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: thinking, dreaming. Smiling, cruel, maybe taunting on the last sentence
line0.text:
Arrakis... How ironic that such a sterile planet should be the source of such great power! A desert world, arid, crawling with reeking clods, yet by some twist of fate, the most coveted world in the Imperium.
Exploiting its spice has made House Harkonnen rich beyond measure for decades. It might even have offered you a directorship in the CHOAM. If only the Emperor hadn’t ordered you to leave...
But you’re not ready to give up, are you, Baron?

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" The Guild is a book term (Spacing Guild) Sardaukar is a book term (Sardaukar is invariable in english but it might vary by language)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, serious, respectful. A bit worried on the last part, preoccupied or even doubting
line0.text:
The Guild informs me that your troops have safely arrived in orbit over Arrakis. The Sardaukar are ready to disembark. The conquest of Arrakis will begin on your command, Majesty.
Your enemies aren’t expecting your arrival, but they will react to it with violence. No Emperor has ever decided to harvest the planet himself. The resistance of the Landsraad Houses will be just as ferocious as that of the locals.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz
line0.voice_notes: Tone: arrogant, confident
line0.text:
We cannot leave Arrakis in the hands of an enemy House. The influence conferred by the spice within the Imperium is too dangerous.
And once they have accepted our supremacy, Mother, I’d venture we'll find a way to make this sterile world much more bearable.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious and calm, as she was reading a report. When she starts talking about their technology she becomes more and more confident and proud. On the last sentence she is gently pushing her husband (who tends to avoid action)
line0.text:
Our machines have detected the presence of other Great Houses on Arrakis. They have already deployed their Bases, but we have no reason to think they have any real advantage over us yet. We, on the other hand, have our Ixian technology. None of your enemies is prepared to face us. Victory will be ours, my love.
We mustn't hesitate, and there's no turning back now. The spice war is imminent.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: at first, very calm, even neutral, as he was watching the scene from a long distance. Then grinning, smilling, arrogant, enthusiastic
line0.text: You were right, Father. The Great Houses and their armies have just landed on Arrakis. The impending war will be long and costly for the Landsraad lords. Missing out on this conflict would be criminal. Smugglers thrive during periods of unrest! Our profits are highest when the smoke of battle shields us! And who knows… When the dust settles, perhaps we will be the new masters of Arrakis.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious then, from "They have no idea..." to the end, much more serious and determined, fierce.
line0.text: The offworlders have come in great numbers to bring war to Dune. They carry different banners and expect to fight one another for control of the spice. They have no idea that we're already here. We, the free people. The men of the desert. The Fremen.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen) here "the enemy" is neutral (it's a general enemy, not a specific person)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, sinister, disappointed
line0.text: Arrakis has slipped from your grasp once again, Baron, and this time there will be no second chance. The enemy has control of the spice. We have nothing else to hope for on this planet.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Piter de Vries Baron is a book term (Baron Vladimir Harkonnen) Giedi Prime is a book term (planet Giedi Prime)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: serious, taunting carefully. Can have a break between "hands" and "your only option".
line0.text: It seems Arrakis has escaped your control, Baron. And this time, you won’t have a second chance. The spice has fallen irreversibly into the enemy’s hands. Your only option now is to withdraw to Giedi Prime, and to hope that your rival doesn’t send their legions to your world in reprisal.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Sanya Ecaz Spacing Guild is a book term
line0.voice_notes: Tone: first sentence: serious and formal, then, a bit more familiar, sad for her mother
line0.text: I have ordered our legions to withdraw from Arrakis. The Spacing Guild is ready to bring us back to Ecaz. I am sorry that your efforts on Arrakis have ended in defeat, but you have fought well, Mother. You have proven yourself worthy of our House.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Thufir Hawat here "your enemy" is neutral (it's a general enemy, not a specific person)
line0.voice_notes: Tone: sad, disappoined, but serious and hurrying
line0.text: We must abandon Arrakis, my lord. Your enemy’s conquest of the planet has progressed too far. Let us leave now, while some of our men can still be saved.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" here the enemy is masculine
line0.voice_notes: Tone: formal, calm, but more an more worried
line0.text: Arrakis is lost, Majesty. The enemy’s grip on this world will soon be complete. To fight on would only waste your men’s lives, at a time when you must save your strength to confront the upheaval this defeat will unleash within the Imperium.

line1.translation_notes: Speaker is Hasimir Fenring Fenring specifically say "Majesty", not "your majesty" here the enemy is feminine
line1.voice_notes: Tone: formal, calm, but more an more worried
line1.text: Arrakis is lost, Majesty. The enemy’s grip on this world will soon be complete. To fight on would only waste your men’s lives, at a time when you must save your strength to confront the upheaval this defeat will unleash within the Imperium.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: she is sad but tries to comfort her husband
line0.text:
All hope of victory is lost, my husband. We must give up.
Continuing this fight would only bring about the destruction of our House. We must withdraw to Ix. Perhaps we can accomplish there what we have failed to achieve here.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: sad, resigned to die, desperate and fatalistic
line0.text:
Our steps have led us down a dark path. This is the end of our people, Liet.
These offworlders will destroy what remains of our sietches and seize our water and our land. Our friends' bodies will be swallowed up by the desert, and the Fremen will fade into oblivion.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: fear for his life, pressing his father to live, trying to not panic
line0.text:
We have no choice, Father! We must leave!
Our Guild contact has agreed to transport us to another planet, and we must seize this opportunity. Leave Arrakis to the Great Houses and Fremen hordes, for we have failed. Their war is no longer our concern!

You've won, Baron!
Arrakis is yours! All the spice in the Imperium lies beneath your fingers!

Mother! You've succeeded! House Ecaz has conquered Arrakis!
For generations, every soul in the Imperium will remember your name.

Arrakis is yours, Sire!
The whole planet is under your control. The Atreides have triumphed over their enemies!
Majesty, I'm honored to report that Arrakis is yours. Nobody will be able to oppose you ever again.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Tessia Vernius
line0.voice_notes: Tone: satisfied, pleased, smiling.
line0.text:
My husband, you have won. You are the master of Arrakis.
The winds of change will soon sweep over the entire Imperium.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Staban
line0.voice_notes: Tone: triumphant, arrogant, proud and happy
line0.text:
Those who considered us mere thieves must now bend to our will! Our influence over the Empire and the Landsraad is unrivaled, for we have a stranglehold on their precious spice trade!
You have played your cards skillfully, Father. You are the new master of Arrakis.

line0.translation_notes: Speaker is Stilgar
line0.voice_notes: Tone: relieved, grateful, screaming at first (as if he was watching the ships leaving) and talking directly to Liet : proud, moved, happy
line0.text:
The offworlders are leaving! Their ships are returning to the stars!
Sister! You have succeeded! Dune has returned to the Fremen, and your father's dream lives on.

Controls.texts.name: 1. Basic Controls
Controls.texts.desc: Control the camera|Give orders to your Units|Control the flow of time

LandsraadCouncilTuto.texts.name: 6. The Landsraad Council
LandsraadCouncilTuto.texts.desc: Participate in the Landsraad Council|Understand [CouncilVote], [Influence], and [Standing]|Mold the Charter Agenda

Agony.texts.name: Agony
Agony.texts.desc: Fight to prevent the enemy from taking your region.

RichGetRicher.texts.name: Bailout
RichGetRicher.texts.desc: The Combine Honnete Ober Advancer Mercantiles is unstable. It needs major investment urgently. The [::territory::] has been set as bounty for the House that will contribute the most.

TheRenegades.texts.name: The Renegades
TheRenegades.texts.desc: Renegades have evaded the watchful eyes of the [SpacingGuild].

GenericBattle1.texts.name: Skirmish
GenericBattle1.texts.desc: Sometimes, a big confrontation, where everyone fends for themselves and the winner is uncertain until the end, is the only way to go forward.

GenericBattle2.texts.name: Skirmish
GenericBattle2.texts.desc: Sometimes, a big confrontation, where everyone fends for themselves and the winner is uncertain until the end, is the only way to go forward.

GenericBattle3.texts.name: Skirmish
GenericBattle3.texts.desc: Sometimes, a big confrontation, where everyone fends for themselves and the winner is uncertain until the end, is the only way to go forward.

ExtendGrasp.texts.name: Extend your grasp
ExtendGrasp.texts.desc: There is always more room to expand on Arrakis. Hopefully, the land is worth it.

StrategicExpansion.texts.name: Strategic Expansion
StrategicExpansion.texts.desc: Taking control of this strategic territory before your opponents is critical.

Summit.texts.name: Famous Summit
Summit.texts.desc: Reach the summit before your opponents and keep it under control.

AncientSietch.texts.name: Ancient Sietch
AncientSietch.texts.desc: The Fremen have accidentally let slip that an ancient sietch is hidden in [::territory::]. Find it before the others.

DoomedSietch.texts.name: The Water Thieves
DoomedSietch.texts.desc: The accursed Iduali have been hidden in [::territory::] for ages. They are a danger to any self-respecting Fremen. It is time to root them out.

FremenUprising.texts.name: Fremen Uprising
FremenUprising.texts.desc: Turmoil among the Fremen gives a unique opportunity. They'll help us liberate the [::territory::] from [::territory_owner::].

Rescue.texts.name: Sietch Rescue
Rescue.texts.desc: [::territory_owner::] is trying to eradicate Fremen from [::territory::]. It is time to take a stand and deny the invaders.

SpiceHeist.texts.name: Spice Heist
SpiceHeist.texts.desc: [::emissary::-longname] is secretly visiting [::territory_owner::-longname]. Rumor has it [Spice] will be changing hands. You cannot allow this unsanctioned trade of melange to go through ... without taking your share.

Incursion.texts.name: Incursion
Incursion.texts.desc: The [::territory::] is vulnerable. With the element of surprise, a fast strike with a small force might be enough to take it from [::territory_owner::].

BeneGesserit.texts.name: Cutting the Head Off
BeneGesserit.texts.desc: The [::territory::] supervisor is a weak man. There might be an opportunity to remove him and take the land without a fight. It appears the [BeneGesserit_Faction] might help.

HiredHelp.texts.name: Hired Help
HiredHelp.texts.desc: [::mission_hero::-fullname] wants to go on a covert mission to claim the [::territory::].

Assault.texts.name: Assault
Assault.texts.desc: Sometimes, the only way to advance is through a major, gruesome fight. The [::territory::] is in a perfect spot for it.

PoliticalShowdown.texts.name: Political Showdown
PoliticalShowdown.texts.desc: Gather the support of the [MinorHouses] and rule the [Landsraad].

Insurrection.texts.name: Insurrection
Insurrection.texts.desc: The Fremen in [::territory::] are restless. If we gather their support, we might be able to take control.

Assassination.texts.name: Assassination
Assassination.texts.desc: The [::territory_owner::] have made a mistake coming there. Their commandant is weak. Even their own troop don't trust him. Let's murder him.

Blockade.texts.name: Blockade
Blockade.texts.desc: [::territory::] is under attack, but reinforcement have been blocked. You'll have to make do with the available means.

line1.desc: [::mission_instigator::] won't take control of the territory

Defend.texts.name: Defend
Defend.texts.desc: Fight to prevent the enemy from taking your region

line1.desc: [::mission_instigator::] won't take control of the territory

Arena.texts.name: Arena
Arena.texts.desc: This territory belong to [::territory_owner::], but it does not have to

Defend3.texts.name: Defend
Defend3.texts.desc: Fight to prevent the enemy from taking your region

line1.desc: [::mission_instigator::] won't take control of the territory

GDP.texts.name: Growth Domestic Product
GDP.texts.desc: Impress the locals by vitalizing the economy

SietchControl.texts.name: Sietch Control
SietchControl.texts.desc: Sietch leaders in throughout this region are too prideful to follow any imperial laws. Someone ought to get them in line.

CuttingTheHead.texts.name: Cutting the Head Off
CuttingTheHead.texts.desc: The [::territory::] supervisor is a weak man. There might be an opportunity to remove him and take the land without a fight. It appears the [BeneGesserit_Faction] might help.

line0.desc: Center of the Atreides power on Arrakis
Start every game with a random [Charter]
Start every game with a [!Ecaz_PerfectRecruit] [!TEcazChampion] [::target::] at max level
Start every mission with a random development from each tree
Start every mission with ::value:: random [!Building_MB]s in [ConquestBase_Vernius]
At the start of every game, gains: ::target_effects_list::
Natural resources are reconned at the start of the game
::s_value:: [Authority] at the start of the game
Start every mission with the first development of each tree
Start every mission with two developments from the second [Economy] level
Start every mission with two developments from the second [Military] level
Start every mission with two developments from the second [Statecraft] level
Start every mission with two developments from the second [Expansion] level
Start every game with ::value::[::target::] at max level
Start every game with ::value::[::target::] at max level
Start every game with the operations [MSandCloak], [MHiddenThumpers], and [MAwakePeople] ready to use
Negative value so scores gives peace

Pole.texts.name: North Pole
Pole.texts.desc:
The Pole is the only region in which you'll find abundant water in the form of snow and ice.
[Sandworm]s cannot roam these lands for the humidity would kill them.

ImperialBasin.texts.name: Imperial Basin
ImperialBasin.texts.desc: Enclosed inside the mountains of Arrakis, the Imperial Basin is protected from sandworms and storms. It is one of the more densely populated areas on the planet.

VolcanicRange.texts.name: Volcanic Range
VolcanicRange.texts.desc: This old volcano range is still active. It is covered with ash but benefit from a very high geothermal activity.

MountIdahoRange.texts.name: Mount Idaho Range
MountIdahoRange.texts.desc: At 7400m, the Mount Idaho is the second highest peak on the planet. Its range countains enough hard minerals to last an eternity.

BrokenLand.texts.name: Broken Land
BrokenLand.texts.desc: The highest peak on the planet, Observatory Mountain, is surrounded by a range of unhospitable mountains and valleys, characterised by shattered silhouette and difficult terrain.

HaggaBasin.texts.name: Hagga Basin
HaggaBasin.texts.desc: Hagga Basin is enclosed in the Shield Wall. It is almost as populated as the Imperial Basin, and only slightly shallower.

PastyMesa.texts.name: Pasty Mesa
PastyMesa.texts.desc: The Pasty Mesa is a high plateau, whose climat is surprisingly livable. Its high concentration of sietches makes it particularly hostile to offworlders.

MinorErg.texts.name: Minor Erg
MinorErg.texts.desc: The Minor Erg is a small stretch of sand distinct from the deep desert because of its proximity to the North Pole and the Shield Wall. It's a good place to gather Spice, for those who don't want to risk the open desert.

GreatErg.texts.name: Great Erg
GreatErg.texts.desc: The Great Erg is a large stretch of sand distinct from the deep desert because of its proximity to the North Pole and the Shield Wall. It's a good place to gather Spice, for those who don't want to risk the open desert.

CielagoDepression.texts.name: Cielago Depression
CielagoDepression.texts.desc: A geological anomaly has lowered the sand level in a part of the desert known has the Cielago Depression. Its sand holds a higher than average amount of salt. Where does that come from?

PlasterBasin.texts.name: Plaster Basin
PlasterBasin.texts.desc: The Plaster Basin is quite unremarkable at first glance. It's just another basin among the dunes. Nothing important ever happened here.

GroseValen.texts.name: Grose Valen
GroseValen.texts.desc: Arrakis' has a lot of unusual geological features. Grose Valen, a long rift crossing the desert, is one of the more notable.

FalseWallEast.texts.name: False Wall East
FalseWallEast.texts.desc: False Wall East is technically a part of the Shield Wall, but it does not connect to anything. As a result, sandworms roam freely on both sides.

FalseWallWest.texts.name: False Wall West
FalseWallWest.texts.desc: False Wall West is technically a part of the Shield Wall, but it does not connect to anything. As a result, sandworms roam freely on both sides.

FalseWallSouth.texts.name: False Wall South
FalseWallSouth.texts.desc: False Wall South is technically a part of the Shield Wall, but it does not connect to anything. As a result, sandworms roam freely on both sides.

WindPass.texts.name: Wind Pass
WindPass.texts.desc: The Wind Pass is a small rock outcropping. The wind makes an unusual sound when passing through its numerous openings.

HangPass.texts.name: Harg Pass
HangPass.texts.desc: The Harg Pass is a small rock outcropping. Millenia of erosion has left many openings and big rocks seemingly hanging from the ridge.

FuneralPlain.texts.name: Funeral Plain
FuneralPlain.texts.desc: The funeral plain is a great expanse, close to the equator. It is said that the souls of Fremen warriors cross through the Funeral Plain before reaching the afterlife. Dry as it is, no living soul would want to cross it, anyway.

ErgHabanaya.texts.name: Erg Habbanya
ErgHabanaya.texts.desc: Erg Habbanya is a big expanse of deep desert, far away from the Shield Wall. Its only notable feature is the Habbanya ridge, a rock outcropping that can protect the lost traveler from worms and storms.

ErgSihaya.texts.name: Erg Sihaya
ErgSihaya.texts.desc: Erg Sihaya is a big expanse of deep desert, far away from the Shield Wall. Its only notable feature is the Sihaya ridge, a rock outcropping that can protect the lost traveler from worms and storms.

GreatFlat.texts.name: The Great Flat
GreatFlat.texts.desc: The Great Flat is a huge desolated desert where nothing lives. No one has ever charted it, or even know how far it extends, but it is said that it covers the whole southern hemisphere of the planet.

PlainsOfArrakeen.texts.name: Plains of Arrakeen
PlainsOfArrakeen.texts.desc: Arrakeen was the biggest city on Arrakis before the arrival of House Harkonnen. Its heavy walls and large shield makes it a formidable fortress. Some say it would be impossible to take down without the help of someone from inside.

CarthagsRift.texts.name: Carthag's Rift
CarthagsRift.texts.desc: Carthag is a fortress of concrete and steel built by House Harkonnen upon their arrival. It is the biggest city on the planet. It sits at the end of an awkward crack that only leaves one real path of approach, making any assault on the city needlessly gruesome.

EmperorsLanding.texts.name: Emperor's Landing
EmperorsLanding.texts.desc: The Emperor has landed in force on the planet. He has settled his base of operations on a clear field near the Shield Wall, and manned it with multiple platoons of Sardaukar.

ForestHeart.texts.name: Heart of the Forest
ForestHeart.texts.desc: Foliage has been built to accommodate the Ecazi court during their residency on Arrakis. The location has been chosen carefully for its potential for gardening, as it was out of question for the Ecaz family to remain away from the forest too long, even on such a dry planet.

IxianConvergence.texts.name: Scholar's Refuge
IxianConvergence.texts.desc: Fleeing the persecution of the Butlerian Jihad, cybernetic engineers have finally found a haven on Arrakis. How long it will last depends only on House Vernius' capacity to secure the Spice trade as a bargaining chip.

Tuek.texts.name: Sietch Tuek
Tuek.texts.desc: This old sietch was left behind by a dying Fremen tribe. The Smugglers needed a place to hide their operations while remaining close to the major population centers of the planet, so they took over the cave. Nowadays, Sietch Tuek is the most important hub of illegal trade on Arrakis.

Pressure.texts.name: Pressure
Pressure.texts.desc: You are not alone on Arrakis. The other Great Houses are going to do everything in their power to prevent you from rising to dominance.
Pressure.texts.defeatDesc: Through a combination of military might, intense plotting and sheer luck, your opponents have managed to put an end to all your hopes of gaining full control of Arrakis. This failure will stifle the growth of your House for the rest of your reign.

line0.desc: You are not alone on Arrakis. The Great Houses do not appreciate the influence of commoners of your kind, and will try to stiffle the growth of your enterprise by any means, even the most sordid.
line0.defeatDesc: Through a combination of military might, intense plotting and sheer luck, your opponents have managed to root out your family's hold on Arrakis. The Spice trade will keep benefiting a few smart entrepreneurs, but you will no longer share in the benefits.

Pressure_Fremen.texts.name: Pressure
Pressure_Fremen.texts.desc: A Spice War between two Great Houses is the perfect time to turn the situation to our advantage. While they squabble, we will strike and get rid of them for good.
Pressure_Fremen.texts.defeatDesc: Against the rising threat of a Fremen insurgency, the imperium has united. You failed to seize the chance to free Arrakis. The Fremen are retreating to the south once again, and the oppression of your people will continue, for a few centuries more at least.

Murder.texts.name: Murder
Murder.texts.desc:
Your arrival on Arrakis and your increase in influence has attracted jealousy.
Your spies have identified small signals that seem to induce that parties are trying to plot for your murder.
Murder.texts.defeatDesc:
A painful insect sting, or so you thought.
The lethal poison of the sting of a Hunter-seeker drone was rapidly spreading in your body.
Despite your best efforts to stay conscious you did not last long...
<bad>Your enemies have managed to assassinate you.</bad>

Bankruptcy.texts.name: Bankruptcy
Bankruptcy.texts.desc:
Your arrival on Arrakis and your increase in wealth has attracted jealousy.
Your spies have identified small signals that seem to induce that parties are trying to plot for your insolvency.
Bankruptcy.texts.defeatDesc:
The coffers are empty and the CHOAM now has us on a leash due to our crippling debt.
Our trip on Arrakis can no longer be supported and we must abandon our plans...
<bad>Your enemies have managed to bankrupt your house.</bad>

Defamation.texts.name: Defamation
Defamation.texts.desc:
Your arrival on Arrakis and your increase in reputation has attracted jealousy.
Your spies have identified small signals that seem to imply that parties are trying to plot for the loss of your status as a great house.
Defamation.texts.defeatDesc:
You leave the Landsraad headquarters on Salusa Secundus with haste. The vote was unanimous, your House is no longer a part of the Galactic Empire.
As is customary, they give you the choice between exile and execution. You have to leave immediately for Tupile, the sanctuary planet, never to return.
<bad>Your enemies have managed to shame your house out of the Landsraad.</bad>

Defeat_Atreides.texts.title: Defeat [Atreides-longname]
Defeat_Atreides.texts.desc: Complete missions in [Atreides-adjective] territories until you can take [PlainsOfArrakeen].

Defeat_Harkonnen.texts.title: Defeat [Harkonnen-longname]
Defeat_Harkonnen.texts.desc: Complete missions in [Harkonnen-adjective] territories until you can take [CarthagsRift].

Defeat_Corrino.texts.title: Defeat [Corrino-longname]
Defeat_Corrino.texts.desc: Complete missions in [Corrino-adjective] territories until you can take [EmperorsLanding].

Defeat_Ecaz.texts.title: Defeat [Ecaz-longname]
Defeat_Ecaz.texts.desc: Complete missions in [Ecaz-adjective] territories until you can take [ForestHeart].

Defeat_Vernius.texts.title: Defeat [Vernius-longname]
Defeat_Vernius.texts.desc: Complete missions in [Vernius-adjective] territories until you can take [IxianConvergence].

Defeat_Any.texts.title: Defeat a Great House
Defeat_Any.texts.desc: Complete missions in a Great House territory until you can take their capital.

Own_Territories.texts.desc: Complete missions that give you Sovereignty over territories to expand.

Improvement_Territories.texts.desc: Use [CQ_ImprovementPoint]s to build Improvements on your territories.

Free_Territories.texts.desc: Complete missions that defend or free a territory with a [Bonus_SpiceField] to disrupt the [Spice] trade.

Ally_Fremen.texts.title: Ally [Fremen-longname]
Ally_Fremen.texts.desc: Ally [Sietch]s and complete secondary objectives to increase your relationship with the [!Fremen].

Ally_Fremen_Fremen.texts.title: Unite [Fremen-longname]
Ally_Fremen_Fremen.texts.desc: Purge hostile [Sietch]s and complete secondary objectives to unite the [!Fremen] behind your cause.

Ally_Faufreluches.texts.title: Corrupt the Faufreluches
Ally_Faufreluches.texts.desc: Launch [CB_MFraufrelucheBribe] on Great Houses and complete secondary objectives to infiltrate the Faufreluches system.
